loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she utilized to buy gardening materials and supplies needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, house hold and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizer and garden inputs for her business. Her profits from this business will definitely help her sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Flordeliza hopes that her business will continue to exist and dreams to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer and garden inputs for her business.

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen is 48 years old and a mother of two sons and two daughters. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. With her family. Her Husband is running a spare parts shop and one of her son is doing a job in a multinational cellular company. Shaheen is also running a beauty saloon and contributes her income with her husband and son to fulfill her family's needs. 
Shaheen has requested a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. Because she has to purchase cosmetics and other accessories, e.g. combs, nail polish, eye shade, hair color, and creams, etc. But due to insufficient financial resources she is unable to purchase these items for her business. This loan will help her to make purchases for her business. It will also help her make savings by earning profit. 
Shaheen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and other items for her business.

loans.name: Blanca Dolly

texts.es:
Blanca, a sus 55 años de edad, es una mujer carismática y servicial que se dedica a trabajar en su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes que inició por la necesidad de generar ingresos para sacar adelante a su familia, ya que es cabeza de hogar desde que se separó de su esposo. A pesar de las adversidades, ella tuvo la fortaleza y la determinación para levantarse y seguir adelante y, gracias a ello lleva 13 años de trayectoria en el sector.
Su propósito en la vida es seguir progresando y por ello desea fortalecer su negocio acreditándolo con la compra de un refrigerador que necesita para almacenar mejor sus productos y poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor calidad y servicio, logrando aumentar notablemente sus ventas y los ingresos que recibe de ellas.
Blanca manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo con su negocio y, en un futuro desea convertirlo en un supermercado, en el que los clientes puedan encontrar todos los artículos que necesiten y así mejorar la rentabilidad y poder ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
At her 55 years of age Blanca is a charismatic and helpful woman that works at her own business: a grocery store. She started it because she had the need of generating her own income to support her family since she is separated from her husband and the head of the household. Despite the adversities, she had the strength and determination to get back on her feet and keep moving forward, and thanks to that she has been working in this type of business for 13 years.

Her purpose in life is to keep improving and for that she wishes to strengthen her business by purchasing a refrigerator that she needs to store her products in a better way and give her clients a better quality and service. This will help her to increase significantly her sales and incomes.

Blanca says that her greatest desire is to keep her business growing and in a future transform it into a supermarket, one in which the customers can find everything they need. With this she hopes to improve the profitability of her business and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator.

loans.name: José Misael

texts.es:
José de 27 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, está acompañado y  su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y en ocasiones, vende  pescado en el mercado. Ellos tienen una hija, por quien se esfuerzan día a día por sacar adelante y darle el cuidado necesario.

José trabaja como motorista de transporte de carga, en una empresa ubicada en la ciudad. Tiene una trayectoria de 2 años laborando para esta empresa, afortunadamente le va muy bien y disfruta mucho su trabajo. Él se ha dedicado a diferentes tipos de empleos en tiempos pasados, pero es en este último donde él se siente más a gusto. 
 
José se levanta desde muy temprano para dirigirse a su trabajo, viaja 20 minutos en motocicleta y regresa a su casa al atardecer.

Él necesita mucho del crédito, pues desea construir una galera para crianza de cerdos en el patio de su casa, así su esposa no tendría que viajar hasta la ciudad y únicamente se dedicaría al cuido de su hija y en la crianza de los cerdos.

Su sueño más anhelado, es seguir trabajando para la empresa de transporte, también con esfuerzo y dedicación, continuar ampliando su casa, para poder heredarla a su hija y tenga un hogar digno.
texts.en:
José 27 years old, has a high school education. He is married and has a daughter, for whom he and his wife make sacrifices day after day to help her get ahead and to take good care of her. José's wife attends to the housework full-time except when, on occasion, she sells fish at the market.

José works as a truck driver for a company located in the city. He has been working for this company for two years. Fortunately, things are going well for him and he enjoys his job. In the past, José has worked in a variety of settings, but he likes this post the best of all of them.

José gets up very early in the morning to go to work, traveling 20 minutes on his motorcycle, and returns home at sunset.

He really needs this loan because he wishes to build a pigpen on the patio of his house. That way, his wife would not have to travel all the way to the city and she would only have to take care of their daughter and raise the pigs.  

His biggest dream is to continue working for the transportation company and, with dedication and sacrifice, continue expanding his house so that he can live in dignity and have the house to leave as an inheritance for his daughter.

loans.use: to build a pigpen.

loans.name: Julio César

texts.es:
Julio es un joven emprendedor y activo, que a sus 20 años de edad, se dedica a atender su propio negocio, un club de nutrición en el que asesora a las personas en cuanto al cuidado de la salud y la sana alimentación, la idea surgió cuando tuvo que enfrentarse a muchas dificultades debido a que sufría de obesidad y gracias a los productos que hoy vende, logró salir adelante; con esto vio la oportunidad de hacer una labor social, ayudándole a otras personas para mejorar la salud, dando su testimonio de vida. La ventaja de su negocio es que puede trabajar desde la comodidad de su casa, allí ofrece diversos productos nutricionales de una marca muy reconocida a nivel mundial, y gracias a ello logra generar ingresos para aportar a la economía de su familia y para reinvertir en su negocio.
El crédito solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de surtido al por mayor (malteadas, suplementos dietarios, multivitamínicos, entre otros), esto le permitirá expandir su mercado a diferentes municipio del departamento y así podrá seguir ayudando a mejorar la calidad de vida de otros seres humanos, en la misma medida que genera ingresos.
Julio manifiesta que su mayor propósito es continuar con su actividad, pero desea ampliar su cobertura en todo el departamento y crear conciencia en las personas de tener una vida saludable; esto le dará la satisfacción del deber cumplido y podrá mejorar no sólo su calidad de vida, sino la de las personas con las que tiene contacto.
texts.en:
Julio is an active and entrepreneurial young man who, at twenty years of age, runs his own business, a nutrition club where he advises people on healthy living and eating well. The idea came to him when he had to face many challenges due to suffering from obesity, and thanks to the products he sells today, he has managed to improve his life. From this he saw the opportunity to do a social service, helping others to improve their health, sharing his own life story. The advantage of his business is that he can work from the comfort of his own home, where he offers various nutritional products from a brand that is very well-known worldwide. Thanks to it he has managed to generate income to support his family financially and to reinvest in his business.

The loan he requests will be invested in purchasing wholesale supplies (malt powders, dietary supplements, multivitamins, among others). This will allow him to expand his market to different cities in the area, so he can continue helping to improve the quality of life of other human beings, and at the same time earn income.

Julio says that his biggest goal is to continue with his business, but he hopes to increase his exposure to the entire area of Medellín and to create awareness of healthy living in people. This will give him the satisfaction of having achieved something, and he can not only improve his quality of life, but all those he comes in contact with.

loans.use: to buy wholesale supplies (malt powders, dietary supplements, multivitamins, among  others)

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Ella es maria y desea con esmero  poder continuar los estudios de enfermería, se encuentra muy  agradecida  ya que la ayuda que kiva le brindo fue de mucho beneficio, así que se encuentra satisfecha por el apoyo que le dieron el semestre pasado. Ella quiere que le sigan colaborando ojala mucho mas. Pues el esfuerzo por poder pagar el semestre es demasiado grande ya que casi el dinero no alcanza,  pues no tiene los recursos suficientes para pagar la carrera, estará muy agradecida con ustedes si le siguieran brindando ese apoyo tan excelente como el que ustedes le brindan a los estudiantes, quiere seguir adelante y seguir estudiando, tiene grandes propósitos en la vida que quiere continuar cumpliendo para llegar muy lejos. Pero sabe que no es fácil y es necesario seguir contando con personas de gran corazón. 
Si se le brindase esta oportunidad de un apoyo financiero luchara por no ser buena, si no por ser la mejor pero sobre todo con mucha dedicación, esfuerzo, empeño y amor. Ella les agradecerá de corazón, el  poder continuar adelante y seguir estudiando para llegar muy lejos.
Ella quiere estar primero que todo satisfecha con ella misma y que la madre se sienta orgullosa también de ella, nadie dijo que la vida fuera fácil pero tocando puertas, con que se abra una sola es suficiente y ella estará satisfecha y agradecida por la colaboración prestada.
texts.en:
She is Maria and wishes to continue with her studies at the nursery school. She is really thankful for all the help that Kiva has given her since it was of great benefit in the past semester. She would like to keep receiving this help, hopefully a lot more, since the effort she has to make to pay for the semester is too much for her. She doesn’t have enough money to pay for her studies by herself and will be greatly thankful to Kiva lenders for all the help they can provide her. She wants to get ahead and continue with her studies. She has big goals and wants to continue achieving them to go far in life, but she knows it is not an easy way and is necessary to have the support of people with big hearts. 

If she could have this financial aid, she would fight not for being good, but for being the best through a lot of dedication, hard work and love. She would be really thankful for the opportunity to keep moving forward and continue her studies to go far in life.

Above all she wants to be satisfied with herself and make her mother proud. No one said life would be easy but by knocking on doors, even if just one responds and is opened, it will be enough, and she will be satisfied and thankful for all the help given to her.  

.

loans.use: to pay the tuition of one semester.

loans.name: Angie Nathaly

texts.es:
Ella es angie nathaly, es estudiante de auxiliar de enfermería, decidió estudiar esta profesión para ser una de las mejores carreras en el campo de la medicina, en la cual ella se puede desempeñar en lo que mas le gusta que es poder ayudar y dar una manos a las personas que lo necesitan.
Uno de los grandes sueños y metas que desde niña ha tenido es el de ser una gran profesional y ahora que se encuentra en el campo de la medicina, no solamente se conforma con ser una auxiliar de enfermería si no que continuara con los estudios hasta convertirse en una gran profesional. 
Ella le agradece a kiva y campo alto por darle la oportunidad de poder financiar y tener una mejor facilidad de pago en el valor de las cuotas.
texts.en:
This is Angie Nathaly. She is studying to be a nurses’ aide. She decided to study this profession in order to be in one of the best career paths in the field of medicine and do what she most enjoys, which is being able to help and give a hand to people who need it.

One of the biggest dreams and goals she has had since she was a little girl is to have a good career and now that she is in the field of medicine, she is not only contenting herself with being a nurses’ aide but she will continue with her studies until she becomes a great professional in her field.

She is grateful to Kiva and Campo Alto for giving her the opportunity of financing her studies and being able to pay her fees with greater ease.

loans.use: to pay her fees for a semester

loans.name: María

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Del Carmen se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla, ciudad de clima fresco y con muchos atractivos turísticos propios de la zona.
En este lugar vive la señora María,  tiene 62 años de edad, está casada y  de esta relación tiene 6 hijos  mayores de edad, uno  de ellos aun viven con ella, su esposo es comerciante. 
Doña María junto con su esposo se dedican a la venta de pescado, compran el pescado en Manta y luego lo envían a Quito, su hijo que vive en esa ciudad es el encargado de recibir y vender el pescado, tienen este negocio  más de 20 años el cual es la fuente de ingresos de su familia.
Ella está repitiendo el crédito pues los créditos le ayudan mucho, ya que  las ganancias le permitieron pagar gastos de médicos y medicinas que tuvo ya que está un poco enferma. Este crédito es para comprar pescado. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde el inicio  y le gusta porque con los créditos ha podido sacar adelante  a sus hijos. Su sueño es comprar un carro.
texts.en:
The María Del Carmen communal bank meets every fifteen days in the Montecristi Canton where the famous straw hats come from. It’s a city with a cold climate and many natural tourist attractions. 

María, 62, lives here. She’s married and has six adult children, one of whom still lives with her. Her husband is a merchant. 

María and her husband sell fish for a living, which they buy in Manta and then send to Quito. Their son, who lives there, receives and sells the fish. They have been in this business more than 20 years and it is the main source of income for the family.

She is taking out a loan again as the loans help her a lot, the profits enable her to pay for medical costs and medicines which were incurred as she is a little bit sick.

This loan will be used to buy fish. She’s been in the communal bank since the start and likes it because thanks to the loans, she has been able to get her children ahead. Her dream is to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Cruz María

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Del Carmen se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla, ciudad de clima fresco y con muchos atractivos turísticos propios de la zona.
En este lugar vive la señora Cruz, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 14 y 9 años que están estudiando  el mayor en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo es chofer. 
Doña Cruz es una muy buena ama de casa que se dedica al comercio, vende ropa, zapatos y productos Yanbal, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta por toda la ciudad, deja a crédito y  cobra cada 8 días, tiene más de 15 años dedicada a este negocio que le ha ayudado a salir adelante.
Ella está repitiendo el crédito ya que con el crédito anterior mejoro su negocio y sus ganancias le sirvieron de mucho para comprar ropa y zapatos a sus hijos y gastos que tuvo en las escuelas de ellos. Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos y productos Yanbal. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 14 años y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Su sueño es tener un gran bazar.
texts.en:
The María Del Carmen communal bank meets every fifteen days in the Montecristi Canton where the famous straw hats come from. It’s a city with a cold climate and many natural tourist attractions.

This is the place where Cruz, 38, lives. She is married and has two children aged 14 and 9 years attending school, the eldest in secondary school and the youngest in elementary school. Her husband is a driver. 

Cruz is a very good housewife who sells clothes, shoes and Yanbal products, which she sells door to door throughout the city. She leaves a credit and charges every 8 days. She has been in this business for more than 15 years and it has helped her to get ahead.

She is getting another loan because the previous loan improved her business and her profits have helped her to buy clothes and shoes for her children and to pay for the costs of both of their schools.

This loan is to buy clothes, shoes and Yanbal products. She has been in the communal bank 14 years and likes it because of the help the loans provide. Her dream is to have a big store.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes and Yanbal products.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used buy more fruits and vegetables. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, house hold and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for her to purchase more fruits and vegetables needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Evelyn hopes to expand her business and be able to prepare for the future. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for a variety of fruits and vegetables needed in her business.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is widowed with three children. Pacita is 60 years old and lives in Polao Tangub City.

Pacita has a sari-sari store to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 50,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase additional canned goods, detergents, sugar and other items for her sari-sari store.

Pacita has been a member of PMPC for three years.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, detergents, sugar and other items for her sari- sari store.

location.town: Tangub-P-7 Polao Tangub City  Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is a widow and resident of Polao, Tangub City, Philippines. She has two children. Starting with capitalization of 7,000 PHP, she opened a sari-sari (general store) and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefit given by the co-op. She became a member in 2013 and has taken out three loans. 

Now she is applying for 12,000 PHP to restock  her sari-sari business with sugar, canned goods, soft drinks and other items. In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart someday.

loans.use: to restock her sari-sari business with sugar, canned goods, soft drinks and other items.

location.town: Tangub-P-7 Polao Tangub City  Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her, which enabled her to buy more merchandise products needed in her direct selling business. It also helped in her variety store and in her children's education. The income from her business is assisting their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.
 
She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products needed in her business, such as clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics. More items to sell will result in a better profit. The profits from her business help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial improvement with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

In future, Miriam hopes to be more successful in business. She dreams of giving her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. This is also where she can draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and Word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is thirty-seven years old and is married to Renato, a father who works as a farmer. The couple is very thankful because they have been blessed with two children. To generate income, Mary Jane devotes herself to selling vegetables in the market. She has been in this business for four years and usually earns about PHP 400 a day. 

Mary Jane is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 17,000 to buy more vegetables such as eggplant, string beans and squash to sell. She believes that with the help of this loan, she can more improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables such as eggplant, string beans and squash to sell.

loans.name: Lorn

texts.en:
Lorn is married with three children. Lorn is 35 years old and lives in Damnak Trach village, a remote area of Bakan district, Pursat province. She is a farmer who has been growing rice for years to earn a living. Through her hardships, she is able to earn approximately KHR 28,000 per day now and aims to improve her income to provide her children with a better lifestyle.

This will be her first loan which she aims to use for sanitation improvement practices. She will build a hygienic latrine for the sake of her family members. This loan will allow her cover the overall costs of the construction. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Lorn is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine for the sake of her family members.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is married with 1 child.  Marieta is 54 years old and lives in Motosawa Dumalinao.

Marieta sells sweet potatoes to earn a living and has had this business for 2 years.  She has requested a loan to buy additional kilos of sweet potatoes to sell.  Marieta has been a member of PMPC for 1 year.  In the future,Marieta hopes to be come a sweet potato supplier in their Barangay.

loans.use: to buy additional kilos of sweet potatoes to sell

location.town: Pagadian - Motosawa, Dumalinao, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Jenevie

texts.en:
Jenevie is a hard-working person.She is a farmer and has been working for ten years. She is 31 years old and still a bachelor. She is focused on her business as a way of providing a better living standard for her parents and to improve her own financial stability. 

To make her goals reality, she is requesting a loan amount of PHP 15,000. She will use this amount of loan to purchase farm inputs such as insecticides and fertilizers to sustain the needs of her farm. She hopes that her loan requested will be approved.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as insecticides and fertilizers to use for farming.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is married with 2 children.  Tessie is 37 years old and lives in Canicapan,Clarin,Philippines.

Tessie is a farmer and grows rice crops to earn a living.  She has been doing this for 10 years.  She has requested a loan to purchase additional fertilizer.
Tessie has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.  In the future, Tessie hopes to financially support her immediate family members.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizer.

loans.name: Fanta

texts.fr:
Née vers 1979 à BAMAKO, FANTA vit avec ses 2 enfants et son époux dans une  famille nucléaire à N’TENTOU dans la ville de  Ouelessebougou (REGION DE KOULIKORO, République du MALI). 
FANTA n’a pas eu la chance de progresser à l’école, très vite elle s’est intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus.    
FANTA est à son premier  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter,  des tissus, wax réal  et des tasses. Elle s’approvisionne en marchandises au LOME, BURKINA FASO   et effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, à domicile,  au marché et dans les foires  environnantes à une clientèle composés d’hommes et de femmes. 
FANTA  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Fanta was born around 1979 in Bamako, she lives with her husband and two children in a nuclear family in N'Tentou, in the town of Ouelessebougou (Koulikoro region of the Republic of Mali).  Fanta did not have the opportunity to continue with her school studies, and began earning a living at a young age.

This will be Fanta's first loan with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, and it will be used to buy fabric, wax pagnes (traditional wrap-around clothing) and cups for resale.  She buys her supplies in Lome in Burkina Faso, and sells her products for cash or credit, from her home and at the local fairs and markets.  Her customers are both men and women.

Fanta expects to earn a monthly average of 75,000 francs CFA, which will be used to help her husband provide for the needs of their family, repay her loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy various products for resale.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is a hard-working mother who is engaged in making rice cakes and native cakes, which she offers to her local community to earn a living. According to her, she cooks daily and sells it in her village.

To keep her food vending business profitable, Nelia is seeking a loan of 3,000 PHP to allow her to buy glutinous rice and sugar to use for her food vending business. She hopes to get this amount of loan for the continuous smooth flow of her business. In addition, she wants to sustain her family's basic necessities and get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy glutinous rice and sugar to use for food vending business

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 43 years old and lives in Sto.nino Pagadian.  She is married with 1 child.
 
Rowena has a business thaat buys and sells shrimp, fish and squid and earns approximately 45 thousand PHP each month doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan to buy 120 kilos of squid, 100 kilos of shrimps,100 kilos of fish to sell.  Rowena has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.  In the future, Rowena hopes to become a distributor to different restaurants around the city.

loans.use: To buy 120 kilos of squid, 100 kilos of shrimps,100 kilos of fish

location.town: Pagadian-Purok Sandayong, Sto. Niño, Pagadian City

loans.name: Aurora Piedad

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Del Carmen se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla, ciudad de clima fresco y con muchos atractivos turísticos propios de la zona.
En este lugar vive la señora Aurora,  tiene 66 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció pero de esa relación tiene 7 hijos mayores de edad, una  de sus hijas aun viven con ella y aunque está casada.
Doña Aurora es una mujer muy luchadora que le he tocado sacar adelante a su familia  después de la muerte de su marido, ella vende ropa de todo tipo y  su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, sale todas las mañanas por la localidad ofreciendo sus prendas las mismas que deja a crédito y que cobra por semana o quincenas de acuerdo a lo que quieran sus clientes, lleva más de 10 años dedicada a esta profesión con  la cual sale adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa de todo tipo en especial ropa de playa que es lo que más vende en esta época. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten salir adelante. Su sueño es tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank “María del Carmen” meets fortnightly in the Montecristi canton, where the famous Panama hats are made. The city has a mild weather and a lot of touristic attractions.

Aurora lives here. She is 66 years old and became a widow some years ago. She had seven children that are all adults now. One of her daughters still lives with her, even though she is married.

Aurora is a fighter. She has had to work hard to get ahead with her family after her husband died. She sells all kinds of clothes, door to door. She leaves home every morning and sells her products around the community. She sells on credit and collects weekly or fortnightly, depending on what her customers want. She has been doing this for more than ten years and this is how she makes a living.

She is requesting a loan to buy all kinds of clothes, especially seasonal beach clothes, which are popular this time of the year. She is a member of this group since it began and likes to be part of it because the loans help her to get ahead. Her dream is to be healthy.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nasira

texts.en:
Nasira is a 31 year old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan.  She is a mother of three daughters and a son.  Her husband is sweeper in hospital and earns the lower income monthly.  Nasira has been providing tailoring services for 6 years; she contributes her income with her husband to manage the household. 

Nasira has to purchase  pieces of clothes, ribbons, needles, threads, etc for her tailoring business, but due to financial constraints she is not in a position to purchase these merchandises. Therefore she requested for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.  This loan will enable her to purchase these merchandises so that she can provide good services of tailoring and earn maximum profits.  She can also utilize the profit amount as savings.
Nasira is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy pieces of clothes, ribbons, needles, threads, etc for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Djibrael

texts.en:
Djibrael, a 54-year-old man is married to Henderina, a 51-year-old woman. They are blessed with five children: Emilia, 31; Robinson, 30; Jefri, 26, who are all married; Meldi, 23, who is a worker; and the last one is Vivin, 18, who is in college.

Djibrael is doing odd jobs and his wife is working as a civil servant. Altough he does not have not fixed income he always does his best to make money for his family, particularly for his daughter's education fees. 

At the moment he needs money to pay his daughter's registration fee at university. Therefore he applied for an individual loan of an amount of IDR 3,000,000.

loans.use: to pay his daughter's college registration fees.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is married with four children. Lydia is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Lydia is a farmer and breeds pigs to earn a living.She has been doing this for three years.

She has requested a loan to buy pigs. Lydia has been a member of PMPC for six years. in the future, Lydia hopes to have her own piggery.

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 59-year-old married woman from Polo, Dapitan City, who has one child. She has been a member of the Paglaum-MPC for almost seven years. 

Elizabeth owns and manages a small restaurant in front of their house, which is on a national road that many people pass through looking for places to eat. Due to the improvements to their city, many people travel in and out of the vicinity, so she has decided to expand her business to cook more dishes in order to draw more people to visit her eatery. 

To fund this project, she needs additional capital, so she has requested a loan from Paglaum-MPC.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is the mother of three sons and two daughters. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing the service of fruit selling for 20 years, and her son is also in the same profession.

Nasreen's husband has to purchase different kinds of fruits in bulk (i.e. bananas, apples, oranges, etc.) for reselling purposes but, due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to purchase these fruits for business purposes.

Therefore, Nasreen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to purchase these fruits for reselling purposes and that will be good for him to increase his daily sales and to earn maximum profit. This profit amount will be utilized by her to fulfill her family's needs.

Nasreen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fruits for reselling purposes

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en: Marivic, 48 years of age, is a mother of nine children. Every day her husband and some of her children catch fish in the river to sell within their locality. Marivic is not glad because they couldn't catch an abundant amount of fish. For this reason, Marivic is requesting a loan amount of PHP 5,000 as additional capital for her buy-and-sell fish business. This loan will be used to purchase a volume of fish to sell.

loans.use: to purchase a volume of fish for her fish selling business.

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen is a 43-year-old woman and the mother of a son. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a driver by profession, and he is only responsible to feed the entire family. Shaheen is also working and providing tailoring services; she also contributes her income with her husband to manage the household.

Shaheen has to purchase some items i.e cloth, ribbons, needles, thread, etc for her business purposes. But due to financial problems, she is not in a position to purchase these items. Therefore she decided to request a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. This loan will provide her assistance to make purchases for her business purposes, so that she can provide better services and earn the maximum profit that can be used as savings for her family's needs.

Shaheen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy pieces of cloth, ribbons, needles, thread, etc for her business purposes.

loans.name: Badenya Group

texts.fr:
BADENYA est un groupe de l’association SIGUIKADI de N’TENTOU. Il regroupe 4 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 27 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne  trois enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de riz et condiments l’image de KADIATOU qui est la deuxième  personne debout de la droite vers la gauche de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à N’TENTOU dans la préfecture de KATI (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire. 
KADIATOU, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 4 sacs de riz et divers condiments alimentaires.  Elle s’approvisionne sur place à OUELESSEBOUGOU auprès des demi-grossistes et vend ses produits à OUELESSEBOUGOU, au comptant, à crédit, à une clientèle de mixte.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 40.000FCFA somme qui lui  
permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
Badenya is a group in the Siguikadi Association of N'tentou.  There are four, women members of the group, and they know one another through family and neighbourhood ties.  The women are all married and have an average age of twenty seven, and an average of three children.  They live in large, traditional families in N'tentou, in the prefecture of Kati (Koulikoro region of the Republic of Mali). 

The group members have all run different businesses, such as the buying and selling of rice and other food ingredients for several years and there is a lot of demand for their goods.  In order to satisfy the growing demand from their customers, the group decided to work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their second group loan.    

Kadiatou (standing second from the right in the photo) buys and sells rice and other food ingredients.  She will use her loan to buy 4 bags of rice and various other food items.  She buys her supplies in Ouelessebougou from wholesalers, and resells them for cash or credit, to a mixed customer base.

Kadiatou expects to earn a monthly average of 40,000 francs CFA, which she will use to repay her loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy rice and other food ingredients for resale.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a 25-year-old hardworking housewife. She is the mother of a baby. 

Her husband wants to run a vegetable shop because he has not had a job for a long time. He wants to purchase a variety of fresh and seasonal vegetables from the field and sell it from his shop.

Now he has a newly opened shop for selling vegetables; he needs to purchase vegetables for his shop. 

So his wife Amina has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband purchase vegetables. In this way, he will be able to support his family. 

Amina prays for the success of her husband’s business. She is feeling relaxed and happy after taking the loan.

loans.use: To buy vegetables to set up a newly opened vegetable shop.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
This is Sofia, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Tomas, a farmer, and they have children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Sofia operates a piggery. She earns by selling live hogs to meat dealers. Sometimes they have the pigs slaughtered and sold in the market.  Aside from this, she also cooks breakfast meals for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 1,200 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 12,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy feed and additional hogs.

Sofia dreams of expanding her business, and hopes that all her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for feed and additional hogs needed in her business.

loans.name: Badenya Group

texts.fr:
BADENYA est un groupe de l’association KOTOGNONTALA de BAMANAKING. Il regroupe 4 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne trois enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles la  restauration à l’image de FATOU qui est la troisième personne debout de la gauche vers la droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles au BAMANAKING dans la  sous préfecture de OUELESSEBOUGOU (Région de KOULIKORO, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur premier  prêt solidaire. 
FATOU, qui est la présidente du groupe est très connue à  OUELESSEBOUGOU, excelle dans la vente des plats alimentaires. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des poissons, de l’atiéké, des céréales et des condiments pour faire des aliments.  Elle s’approvisionne à Ouelessebougou et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses aliments à  OUELESSEBOUGOU en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle mixte.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000FCFA somme qui lui  
permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
Badenya is a group in the Kotognontala Association of Bamanaking.  There are four, women members, who know one another through family and neighbourhood ties.  They are all married and have an average age of thirty-four, and an average of three children.  They have all run various businesses, such as restaurants, for several years and are very sought-after.  In order to satisfy the growing demands of their customers, the group decided to work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their first group loan.

Fatou (standing second from the right in the photo) is the group president and very well-known in Ouelessebougou for her food preparations.  She will use her loan to buy fish, attiéké (a dish made from fermented cassava couscous), cereals and condiments to prepare food.  She buys her provisions in Ouelessebougou, and locally, from wholesalers.  She sells her food in Ouelessebougou for cash or credit, to a mixed customer base.

Fatou expects to earn a monthly average of 20,000 francs CFA, which she will use to repay her loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Eligio

texts.en:
Eligio used his prior loan to buy the spare parts needed in his business. His loan helped not just in his business but also in the education of his children. His income from business is assisting in their everyday household expenditures. He and his wife are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

Eligio is requesting another loan for 8,000 PHP, which he will use to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of his jeep. The profits from his business will help him to sustain the family's daily needs and his children's educational expenses. 

Eligio hopes to have another unit of jeep and dreams that his children will finish their education. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and it's where he can also draw strength and inspiration from God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and maintain his jeep.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en: Concepcion is from the village of Lasam. She is 45 years old and is managing a piggery business as a source of income. Now, she is in need of additional capital, amounting to PHP 10,000 to buy feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her to raise pigs.She knows that sustaining her hogs with proper nutrition will enable her to gain better income and improve her way of living.She hopes to have continuous growth of her hog raising business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her to raise pigs

loans.name: Mercidita

texts.en:
Mercidita is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy the garden inputs and other supplies needed in her business. Her income from her business is assisting her everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs. She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing this loan to buy gardening materials such as wires and baskets, as well as supplies such as seeds and fertilizers needed in her business. Her profits from this business will definitely help her sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. Mercidita hopes to be more successful in business and dreams to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of their lives and business every week. There she draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet weekly. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and talk about microfinance.

loans.use: to pay for gardening materials such as wires and baskets, as well as supplies such as seeds and fertilizers needed in her business.

loans.name: Rosell Trinidad

texts.es: Don Rosell es originario de la ciudad de Estelí, casado. Tiene 57 años de edad. Es de oficio mecánico, se dedica al negocio de Taller de mecánica. Inicio su negocio hace varios años poco a poco lo fue aprendiendo y luego lo vio como fuente de ingreso, la cual le ha ayudado hasta el día de hoy. Su meta próxima es ofrecer a los clientes repuestos para sus vehículos, y el servicio de instalación de partes mecánicas. Solicita el crédito para comprar: Una bomba central de frenos. Estima que el crédito le ayudara a diversificar los productos que ofrece a sus clientes. Su plan futuro es darse a conocer para aumentar su clientela.
texts.en: Rosell is originally from the city of Esteli. He is 57 years old and is married. He is a mechanic and earns his living through his auto shop business. He started his business several years ago after gradually learning this work and seeing the opportunity to make a living through this work. This work has helped to this day. His next goal is to offer customers spare parts for their vehicles and expand the service of installing mechanical parts. He has applied for this loan to buy a new brake master cylinder. Rosell estimates that the loan will help him diversify the products he offers to his customers. His future plan is to become well-known and increase his clientele.

loans.use: to purchase new brake cylinders for his auto shop.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is a 46-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is the mother of two sons and a daughter. She lives with her family. 

Her husband provides tailoring services and wants to purchase different kinds of goods such as pieces of material, ribbons, needles, and thread  for his business. She is applying for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan because her husband does not have sufficient financial means to buy these items. This loan will enable her husband to purchase these items so that he can provide better services and earn more profit. He will use this profit to help the  family to make positive changes.

Tahira is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy pieces of material, ribbons, needles, and thread for her husband's business.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy fertilizer and farm inputs needed in her business. Her loan helped both her business and the education of her children. Her income from business helps to meet their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband work hard to provide for their family.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan. She will utilize the loan to buy gardening materials (wire and baskets) and supplies (seed and fertilizer) needed in her business. Her profits from his business will definitely help meet their daily needs and her children's education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Emelita dreams that her business will grow even more and hopes that her family is always in good condition. She meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of work.  She draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and farm supplies for her business.

loans.name: Gleceria

texts.en:
Gleceria previously accessed an 19,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, house hold and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 19,000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her child’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Gleceria dreams that her business will be a blessing to others too. She meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week, as well as to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es: Juan es un señor casado de 47 años quien tiene tres hijos un hombre y dos mujeres y viven en Sololá. Actualmente se dedica a la compraventa de frutas preparadas en bolsas, donde sale a ofrecer a las diferentes calles. Esta actividad lo viene realizando desde hace dos años ya que le genera ganancias aceptables y es así como puede cubrir los gastos familiares. El está solicitando un préstamo de Q 3,000.00 para capital de trabajo para la compraventa de frutas y de esta manera poder ampliar su negocio y ofrecerles una gran variedad de frutas a sus clientes, con la finalidad de mejorar sus ingresos. Su sueño es tener un local en donde pueda tener su negocio y brindarles un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Juan is a 47 year old married man with three children; a son and two daughters.  They live in Sololá.  Currently, he works buying and selling bagged, prepared fruits, which he sells on different streets.  He has been working in this business for two years because it generates an acceptable income, and allows him to cover his household expenses.  

He is seeking this loan of Q 3,000 to raise working capital for his fruit retail business, and in so doing, expand his business and offer a greater variety of fruit to his customers, with the final goal of improving his earnings.  His dream is to have is own retail space where he can have his business, and offer better service to his customers.

loans.use: purchase different types of fruit.

loans.name: Yeimi

texts.es: Se llama yeimi tiene 30 años vive en la ciudad de Bogotà, es madre soltera, manicurista a domicilio pero no es titulada, decidió iniciar estudios en campo alto  en la carrera técnica administración en salud para así tener un mejor futuro para ella y para la hija, como ya se hizo saber anteriormente por ser madre soltera tiene que cubrir con todos los gastos del hogar y no le alcanza para cubrir la mensualidad que campo alto requiere, ella quiere solicitar a kiva  la ayuda porque piensa que es indispensable  el estudio para el progreso,  aparte de esto la vocación es de prestar servicio al cliente y ayuda a la comunidad, por esto escogió esta carrera que va acorde con la personalidad y vocación.
texts.en: Yeimi is 30 years old and lives in the city of Bogotà. She is a single mother and a home manicurist, although she is not licensed. She has decided to begin her studies in Campo Alto in health administration in order to have a better future for herself and her daughter. As a single mother, it has been difficult to cover household expenses and she has not been able to cover the monthly tuition payment that Campo Alto requires. She requests this Kiva loan because she thinks it is essential to study to make progress. This work provides a service to the community so she chose this career according to her personality and her calling.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of tuition.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 39-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is the mother of three sons and a daughter. Her husband is a mechanic by profession, and he is the guardian of the entire family.

One of her sons has been running a general store for seven years. Parveen has applied to Kiva for a loan because her son wants to purchase different commodities like sugar, rice, tea, cooking oil etc., but due to financial constraints he is unable to afford this. This loan will help her son to purchase these commodities for business purposes, which will enable him to increase his daily sales and to earn maximum profit. This profit will also help them to meet the family's needs in the future. 

Parveen is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy some commodities like sugar, rice, tea and cooking oil for her son's business.

loans.name: Carmen Sofia

texts.es:
Carmen Sofia tiene 56 años de edad de estado civil unión libre vive con el esposo y con el hijo en la ciudad de Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la vrc 30 de julio, se encuentra ubicada en recinto zapotal nuevo, pertenece al cantón ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas.

Carmen Sofia  se dedica  a la agricultura a la siembra de arroz y maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, fertilizantes, abonos, ranger, insecticidas.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá superar el negocio.

Se enfrenta a desafíos cómo las plagas en los cultivos. El sueño es tener éxito en la vida para poder subsistir. En el tiempo libre le gusta viajar con la familia.
texts.en:
Carmen Sofia is 56 years old.  She is in a common-law marriage, and lives with her husband and their son in the city of Ventanas in the Los Ríos province.  She is a member of the 30 de Julio communal bank, which is located in the Zapotal Nuevo precinct, in the Ventanas canton.  Its members work in agriculture.  Carmen Sofia works in agriculture, planting rice and corn.  

She is seeking a loan to purchase supplies, fertilizers, manure, Ranger, and insecticide.  With the help of this loan, she will be able to improve her business.  She is faced with challenges like pest infestations in her crops.  Her dream is to succeed in life.  In her free time, she enjoys traveling with her family.

loans.use: purchase agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Sokkheng

texts.en:
Sokkheng is 27 years old and married with a small child. He and his wife work together to grow rice in their community in Battambang province. Farming is the sole source of his family’s income which definitely helps him meet their daily needs. Sokkheng has been a farmer for almost five years. 

He would like to borrow 1,000 USD to build a latrine for his family. This loan will allow him to cover the overall costs of the construction. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Sokkheng can focus on providing healthy living conditions, safeguard the health of his family, and protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a latrine for his family.

loans.name: Nazira

texts.en:
Nazira is a 38-year-old woman. Her residence is in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Nazira's husband is providing services, polishing newly-constructed floors. He polishes concrete and marble floors. For this purpose, he uses a floor-polishing machine. He has been providing these services for many years. 

A few days ago, his polishing machine became out-of-order due to continuous work. For this reason, he wants to buy a new machine, but he does not have enough savings. Therefore, Nazira requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy a new polishing machine and continue his services.

loans.use: to buy her husband a new floor-polishing machine for his business.

loans.name: Mauricia

texts.en:
Mauricia is a widow, with seven children. She is 64 years old and she lives in Lamao, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Mauricia operates her sari-sari store to earn a living and she has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 30,000 to restock her store with basic commodities.

Mauricia has been a regular member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities.

loans.name: Kubran

texts.en:
Kubran is 32; she is living with her spouse and six children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been selling fruits for many years. He sells seasonal fresh fruits from his shop in his community. Nowadays he is not feeling tranquil about his sales. In fact, he finds no new customers here. This is the reason he wants to move his business from one place to another; for this purpose he needed some cash.

Kubran feels proud of her husband and appreciates his efforts for his family. She is taking a loan for her husband’s business so that he will be able to move his enterprise to a new place and find more customers. 

Kubran wants to save the excess profit amount so she can utilize these savings for future sudden needs and for her children's education.

loans.use: To setup a new fruit shop in another place.

loans.name: Jameela

texts.en:
Jameela is a 51-year-old married woman.  She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her family consists of one daughter and three sons. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family. Jameela has been running a tailoring center for the past seven years and contributes her income with her husband's to manage the household.

Jameela wants to purchase different kinds of goods, e.g needles, machine oil, pieces of clothes in bulk, benches and sewing tables, etc. for her business purpose. But due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these goods. Therefore, she applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan so that she can purchase these goods to provide better tailoring facilities and earn a maximum profit. This loan will also help her to increase daily sales.

Jameela is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase different kinds of goods, e.g needles, machine oil, pieces of clothes in bulk, benches and sewing tables, etc.

loans.name: El Aguacate  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito El Aguacate está formado por 8 socias y 2 socios, quienes viven por el sector de Monay en Cuenca, este lugar se encuentra rodeado de vegetación, por el crecimiento poblacional es una mezcla de campo y ciudad, su gente se dedica a la crianza de animales o laboran en la ciudad ejerciendo diferentes actividades las que les permiten solventar los gastos de sus hogares, su reto es de entregarles a sus hijos un mejor futuro y mejores oportunidades de trabajo, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Lida, este es el primer crédito que está realizando en conjunto con sus amigas y compañeras del grupo de crédito, fue invitada a este grupo por una amiga.
La Señora. Lida tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 19, 18 y 13 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en una universidad de la ciudad, su segundo hijo estudia y trabaja para solventar los gastos de sus estudios, su tercera hija estudia en un colegio de la ciudad, su esposo labora como albañil, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
Doña Lidia desde hace 3 meses tiene su propio negocio, ella vende  variedad de comida como asados, tortillas de verde, morocho y más productos, a este negocio se dedica de lunes a sábados sin un horario fijo. El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de una carreta para vender salchipapas y así  ampliar su negocio. Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The El Aguacate lending group is made up of eight female members and two male members who live in the Monay en Cuenca sector.  This area is surrounded by vegetation.  Due to its growing population, it is a mix of city and countryside.  Its people mostly work in animal husbandry or in the city doing different activities that help them to afford their household expenses.  Their challenge is to provide their children with a better future and better job opportunities.  They still maintain the culture and traditions of their villages.  

One of the members of this group is Lidia.  This is the first loan that she has sought with her friends and partners in the lending group.  She was invited to the group by a friend.  Lidia is 39 years old, is married and has three children from her marriage aged 19, 18 and 13.  Her first daughter is studying in the city's college, her second son is also in college and works to cover the expenses of his education, and her third daughter is in high school in the city.  Her husband works as a mason.  They do not own their own home, and are currently renting.  For the past three months, Lidia has had her own business.  She sells a variety of food like grilled meat, green plantain tortillas, corn pudding, and more products.  She works in this business from Monday to Saturday with out fixed hours.

She will use the money from the own to purchase a cart to sell "salchipapas" (sliced sausages and french fries mixed together with a coleslaw on the side), and expand her business.  Her dream is to have her own home.

loans.use: purchase a cart.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
In order to earn a living, Jovelyn raises pigs in their backyard. She is 24 years old, married and lives in Bato, Plaridel, Mis. Occ. She's been raising pigs for 3 years.

Jovelyn joined PMPC in July, 2010 and enjoys the privileges of being a member of the Cooperative. Now she is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP. The loan is intended to purchase hog feed for her increasing number of pigs. Jovelyn deeply wishes to maintain a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase hog feed

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is a 68-year-old member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative from Baybay Panalsalan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is industriously caring for her fishing activities. She is married and has two children. She personally takes charge of the business, and the children work for them as support. The business is doing well.  

Juanita has humbly taught her children the techniques of how to enjoy business, and at the same time, make earnings from it. The ups and downs of the business are nothing but a normal situation for her. Sometimes, they have business losses; sometimes, a good return. She is a savvy businesswoman. 

Now Juanita sees a good opportunity to expand their business. She is requesting 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) from Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for capital to buy additional nets, fishing accessories and a pump boat engine. She deeply wishes for a decent and comfortable life for her family and for them to have businesses on their own.

loans.use: to purchase needed materials for fishing and a pump boat engine

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en: Melinda is 38 years old, married and blessed with five children. Raising hogs is her primary source of income. She has been in this business for almost four years. She wanted to have more pigs to raise, but she doesn't have enough capital to utilize. For this matter, she is asking for 6,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy piglets and a supply of hog feeds. She hopes that she can obtain the amount requested to further develop her business.

loans.use: to buy piglets and a supply of hog feeds.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita previously used a 20,000 PHP loan to buy ingredients to bake bread and for the maintenance of her oven. Her earnings were a big help with her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan. She will utilize the loan to buy ingredients to bake bread and maintain her oven. Her profits from his business will definitely help meet her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Lolita dreams that her business will last long and hopes to have a better living. She meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share life and business stories.  She draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for ingredients to bake bread and maintain her bakery's oven.

loans.name: Dan

texts.en: Dan is a permanent resident of Rwabarata in the Kiruhura district.  He is married with six children and four dependants from his brother who died five years ago. Being pushed by the need to survive and to support a big family, he started banana farming on a small scale on the land he got from his grandfather. This banana plantation was used as a source of food for the family and income for their survival. This business has grown, giving him an opportunity to support his family and dependants and also manage to construct a house for his family. He is requesting a loan of UGX 5,000,000 to complete his house.This will help him to house his large family conveniently. He is a hard-working man.

loans.use: To buy building materials

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary's restaurant is progressing, thanks to the kiva loan granted to her in the previous cycle. Her customers now enjoy cold drinks and her sales have increased.

She will use this loan to buy food items in bulk which will make it cheaper. Because her customer base has increased, her profits will also be higher. She hopes to expand and offer outside catering if she gets additional utensils. She is a hard working woman.

loans.use: to buy bulk food items and cooking utensils.

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe, age 52, is married and a resident of Sinaman, Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Norte. She operates a videoke business in her hometown. She also plans to re-open her little store to cater the needs of her videoke customers and provide basic commodities to her neighborhood. The store is her additional means of earning a living in support of her family needs. 

Fortunately, her area is located in a populous neighborhood, and so she makes promising daily sales. Maria Fe will keep running the store well even though there is increased competition from other stores. Maria Fe reached two years of being a member of Paglaum MPC. 

She applied for a loan of 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to pay for stock, particularly basic commiodities like rice, sugar, canned goods and other items. Expanding her inventory will mean additional income. She is a hardworking mother and wishes to sustain the store. In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart someday.

loans.use: to pay for basic commodities like rice, sugar and canned goods to cater to the needs of her videoke customers

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en: Analiza is 28-years-old and a hard working mother.  She manages a business of buying and selling bottles and selling snacks in the school canteen.  She has been doing her buying and selling business for four years and is able to earn about PHP 400-500 daily.  Analiza would like to increase her income in order to accommodate the necessities of her family.  In connection with her situation, she is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy more bottles and raw ingredients to make snacks for sale.  Hopefully, her loan request will be approved by the lenders.

loans.use: to buy more bottles and raw ingredients to make snacks to sell

loans.name: Gisela

texts.es:
Gisela, vive en casa de sus padres, en la zona de San martin de la ciudad de La Paz.esta soltera  y no tiene hijos, tiene un microbus con el cual genera sus ingresos para su mantencion.

El credito que solicita es para poner en buen estado el motor de su vehiculo y comprar algunos accesorios para que funcione mejor.

El sueño de Gisela es terminar de pagar su microbus lo mas antes posible y que sea de su propiedad
texts.en:
Gisela lives in her parents’ house in the San Martin area of the city of La Paz.  She is single, and she does not have children.  She has a microbus, which she uses to generate income for her support.

The loan that she is requesting is to get the motor of her vehicle in good condition and to buy some accessories so that it works better.

Gisela’s dream is to finish paying for her microbus as soon as possible so that it is her property.

loans.use: to buy items for her vehicle.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis vive en casa propia en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz, de profesion abogado.

El credito que solicita es para comprar un carrito de ventas para la venta de comida rapida en la calle y aumentar sus ingresos ya que actualmente trabaja como abogado de manera independiente pero sus ingresos son minimos y variables por lo tanto el quiere tener un ingresos fijo.

El sueño de Luis  es poder establecer su propio negocio y ayudar a su familia a tener un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Luis lives in his own house in the Tembladerani area of the city of La Paz.  He is a lawyer by profession.

The loan that he is requesting is to buy a sales cart for selling fast food on the street.  He will do this to increase his income.  He currently works as a lawyer independently, but his income is minimal and varied.  Therefore, he wants to have a fixed income.

Luis’s dream is to be able to establish his own business and to help his family to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a cart to sell fast food.

loans.name: Trabajando Para El Futuro Group

texts.es: Ana   de 50  años de edad soltera  y sin hijos, Ana   tiene un  pequeño negocio de venta de productos de belleza    ya hace unos  5  años. Ana  ha llegado a fidelizar  a sus clientes   el cual le ha generado ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar,  En el futuro le gustaría tener un local propio donde poder vender sus productos y obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en comprar más productos de belleza como (lápiz labial, perfumes, colonias, cosméticos etc.) y  así seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes   y así poder salir adelante. A la vez  Ana  y todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos   con Kiva  por el préstamo otorgado   y por la confianza que se  les ha sido brindada. Ana es la segunda de la mano derecha  se le distingue por su pantalón de color rojo,   Se despide  Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en:
Ana is 50 years old, single, and does not have children. Ana has a small business where she sells beauty products, which she has been doing for the past 5 years. She has built a loyal client base, which has allowed her to generate income to pay for household expenses.

In the future, she would like to have her own store where she can sell her products and earn more money. With this loan, she will invest in the purchase of more beauty products like lipstick, perfume, cologne, cosmetics, etc. This way, she will be able to continue meeting her customers' needs and moving forward.

Ana and all the group members are grateful to Kiva for this loan and for the confidence that they have provided. Ana is the second from the right in the photograph, wearing red pants. She says farewell, promising that she will meet all of her proposed goals.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products.

loans.name: Benalyn

texts.en: Benalyn has owned and operated a variety store for five years.  She is 37-years-old and married.  Benalyn would like to have continuous development of her business. That's the reason she is asking for a loan of PHP 18,000, which will be used to buy stock of groceries such as fish paste, vinegar and cooking oil for sale.  She knows that through her requested loan amount, she can earn greater profits, allowing her to get ahead in life and save some for educational purposes for her three children.

loans.use: to buy stock of groceries for her general store

loans.name: Tasleem

texts.en:
Tasleem is a 40-year-old, married woman. She is a mother of two daughters and a son. She lives with her family in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. 

Tasleem's husband has been providing tailoring services for past five years. He is solely responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family.

Tasleem has requested a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. Her husband wants to purchase different types of items (e.g., pieces of cloth, ribbons, needles, threads) for business purposes, but due to financial problems, he is unable to purchase these items. This loan will enable her husband to make purchases for business purposes, so that he can provide better tailoring services. This will also help her husband to increase the daily sales and to earn the maximum profit.

Tasleem is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy pieces of cloth, ribbons, needles, and thread for her husband's business.

loans.name: Cindy Julieth

texts.es:
Cindy es una mujer de 19 años de edad, nacida en Bogotá, hija de padres separados y la mayor de tres hermanos, Jonathan de 17 años de edad y Daniel de 15.
La mamá debió trabajar y ella quedo a cargo de los dos hermanos menores, el padre vivió con ellos durante los primeros años apoyando económica y anímica mente de todos; una vez separado el padre no volvió a ayudar a la familia, dejando toda responsabilidad en la madre, así que ella debió salir a trabajar y correr con todos los gastos del hogar.
Los tres estudiaron en colegio Distrital, Cindy se graduó del Colegio República de China, en el año 2012,  siempre deseo ser esteticista, con mucho esfuerzo la mamá y la abuela materna le pagaron la matrícula y primeros semestres en el Instituto Campo Alto, sin embargo, para el último pago no cuenta con más recursos económicos para continuar con los estudios; ya que la mamá es la única que cubre todos los gastos del hogar y de los tres hijos, recursos provenientes de una tienda que tiene en el barrio, la cual no le da los ingresos suficientes para cubrir este gasto teniendo otras prioridades como salud, alimentación, vestuario, vivienda, educación entre otros.
texts.en:
Cindy is a 19 year-old woman, born in Bogota and the daughter of separated parents.  She is the eldest of three children -  her brothers are Jonathan, 17,  and Daniel who is 15. Their mother had to work while Cindy looked after her younger brothers.  The father lived with them when they were young, providing financial and emotional support. Once separated, the father stopped helping the family leaving the mother as the sole provider, so she had to work and cover all the household expenses.

The three children studied at the district school and Cindy graduated from the Republica de China school in 2012. She has always wanted to be a beautician, and with great sacrifice her mother and maternal grandmother paid the tuition for the first semesters at Instituto Campo Alto. However, they do not have the money for the last payment so she can continue her studies. Her mother is the only one who covers the expenses for the household and the three children.  She earns money from a store she has in the neighborhood, but she doesn't make enough to cover Cindy's tuition because things such as health, food, clothing, housing, education, etc. must take priority.

loans.use: to pay for a semester's tuition.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina vive en anticretico en a zona de miraflores con su hijo menor, esta separada del esposo desde hace 15 años. Trabaja como secretaria en el Palacio Legislativo. Desde hace 5 años
 
El credito que solicita es para aumentar el anticretico de su vivienda, ya que estan a punto de hacerle desocupar.
 
El sueño de Cristina es poder comprar en un futuro con los ahorros de su anticretico su casita y darles estabilidad a sus hijos
texts.en:
Cristina lives in a rented home in a zone of Miraflores with her minor son. She is separated from her husband of 15 years. She has worked as a secretary in the Legislative Palace for 5 years.

The loan she is requesting is to invest in the system of "anti-credito" [a system by which the tenant pays a fixed sum considered a loan to the property owner which they receive back in full when the rental period is over] because she is almost at the point where she will be evicted.

Cristina's dream is to buy her own home with the savings she can build due to this "anti-credito" so that she can give her children stability.

loans.use: to pay rent on "anti-credito" which will allow her to avoid monthly rent payments and be able to save.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo vive en anticretico con su esposa e hija menor en la zona de San Martin de la ciudad de La Paz. Tiene un automovil con el cual trabaja en transporte libre todos los dias por mas de 10 hrs. Diarias.

El credito que solicita es para poner en buen estado el motor de su vehiculo ya que es su unca fuente de ingresos con la cual mantiene a su familia.
