El sueño de Ricardo es comprar su casita con los horros que tiene .
texts.en:
Ricardo lives in an anticretico (a type of rental housing situation common in Bolivia) with his wife and young daughter in the San Martin area in the city of La Paz. He has a car which he uses to transport people every day for more than 10 hours per day.

He will use the requested loan to repair his vehicle's motor, since it is his family's only source of income.

Ricardo's dream is to purchase a home with the savings that he has.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle's motor.

loans.name: Shagufta

texts.en: Shagufta is a young and kind 40 year-old woman. She is married and has two children. Her husband is very hardworking and loves his family very much. He is involved in his own business and therefore earns a regular income for the family. He makes and sells wooden sofas, and started this business over fifteen years ago. Today, he has many regular customers and also takes orders from other cities. This business yields a good income for him, but his family's needs are increasing day by day and he needs to earn more money. That is why he wants to buy more raw materials to make sofas to order, because this will allow him to earn more money. To make this possible, Shagufta has come to BRAC Pakistan for a loan to buy raw materials such as foam, clothing, wool, fibers, jute, etc. to use in making furniture. Shagufta hopes that this loan will prove beneficial and productive for her husband's business as well as for their family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make sofas to sell.

loans.name: Qurbonali

texts.ru: Этого мужчину зовут Курбонали. Он из села района Чилинкул. В Чилинкуле приятный климат, чистый воздух и неповторимая природа. Многое жители этого района, пользуясь благоприятным климатом родного места, занимаются сельскохозяйственными деятельностями. Курбонали решил не отставать от своих соседей земляков тоже хочет начать бизнес в сфере животноводства. Он собирается выращивать крупно рогатых скотов. Чтобы начать данный бизнес у него имеется коровник, не много опыта в этой сфере деятельности и начальный капитал. Но начального капитала не хватает, чтобы купить не обходимое количество скота и начать бизнес. По этой причине он обратился за помощью к Вам. Курбонали надеется, что вы ему поможете, и он осуществит свой план, что способствует улучшению финансового положения семьи.
texts.en: This man's name is Qurbonali.  He's from a village in the Jilikul region of Tajikistan.  Jilikul has a pleasant climate, clean air and unforgettable scenic areas.  Many residents of this area make use of its balmy weather for agriculture.  Qurbonali is no different, and is seeking to start up his own livestock-farming business.  He's preparing to raise cattle and already has a cow pen, some experience raising livestock and some initial money to get things up and running.  However, he doesn't have enough money to buy enough cattle to start his business.  As such, he's turned to you for help and is seeking a loan to buy cattle.  Qurbonali hopes that you'll help him bring his plans to fruition and, by doing so, help bolster his family's finances.

loans.use: buy cattle to start up a new livestock-farming business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, milk, and more for her store.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 33-year-old married man from a small village near Jenin City. He is the father of one son and one daughter.

For the past ten years, Ahmad has been working in his own store where he sells toys. It is a good business but Ahmad would like to improve it. Ahmad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more products for his toy store to sell and to expand his store. By taking this loan, Ahmad will be able to increase his sales and also his income. 

Ahmad appears in the photo in his store.

loans.use: to buy more products for his toy store to sell and to expand his store

loans.name: Rogers

texts.en: Rogers is a client of Ugafode Microfinance and has applied for a loan for UGX. 2,000,000. He runs a small shop where he sells women's clothing which he gets from the Nyamityobora Trading Center, and has been doing this for more than five years. The purpose of the loan is to finish the construction of a house for his family. David is an honest and very hard-working man but his activities are limited by the availability of capital. He intends to shift from a smaller shop to a bigger one in Mbarara town where he says turnover and profit margins are higher than where he is currently working. Here we see Rogers and his wife standing in front of their house, the one whey want to finish building.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Kosar

texts.en:
Kosar is a married woman and her age is 27 years old. She is the responsible mother of two sons and a daughter. Her husband is a driver by profession in a public sector organization. He is the only one responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family. Kosar has been running a beauty parlor for the past five years and also contributes her income with her husband's to manage the household.

Kosar has to purchase different types of cosmetics and other items (e.g. combs, nail cutter, polishes, hair colors, creams, etc.) for business purposes but due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these accessories for her business purposes. Therefore, she applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will provide her with assistance to purchase these accessories that will be fruitful for her and help her to earn maximum profit.  This profit amount will be used as savings to fulfill her family's needs.

Kosar is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different types of cosmetics and other items for business purposes

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel es una persona muy trabajadora vive en un su casa en alquiler en la zona de Nor Yungas (Pacallo) ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.  Se dedica principalmente al servicio de Garzon desempeñando funciones en el Hotel Rio Selva. El comienza sus actividades desde las 8 de la Mañana y termina a las 15:00 en la localidad de Nor yungas de la ciudad, El Sr. Daniel necesita el credito para la contruccion de uan bodega para almacenar su produccion y asi poder maximisar su produccion con mucha calidad y asi tener mejor ingresos.

El sueño del Sr. Daniel es poder tener mayores ingresos en base al sacrificio que hace su familia, y poder tener una vejez tranquila, espera  contar con un salario de vejez que le permita vivir mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Daniel is a very hardworking person who lives in a rented house in the Nor Yungas (Pacallo) neighbourhood in the city of La Paz. He earns his living as a waiter in the Rio Selva Hotel and works from 8 am to 3 pm.

Daniel is seeking a loan to build a small store where he can keep supplies and thus earn more money. His dreams are to have a greater income because of the sacrifices his family has made and to have a tranquil old age. He hopes to have an old age pension which will enable him to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to build and open his own store

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Fish selling and a transportation business have been Beatriz's business involvements. She has been involved in these kinds of businesses for almost three years.

Beatriz is 51 years old and is requesting a loan amounting to 11,000 PHP to buy fish, and some of the loan will be used for the repair and maintenance of her transportation business. She hopes that she can get the amount she requested to further develop both her fish vending and transportation businesses.

loans.use: to buy fish and for the repair and maintenance of her transportation business

loans.name: Anyela Daniela

texts.es:
Ella es anyela daniela les quiere contar desde cuando empezó la motivación por empezar esta carrera, todo comenzó mas o menos a las 6 o 7  años cuando salio del jardín, la mama siempre le ha cultivado la creatividad, a través de esta habilidad desarrollo una maravillosa pasión por el dibujo durante mucho tiempo y aun sigue evolucionando en una de las pasiones que ella tiene, con el pasar de los años vivió muy contenta y con una familia muy unida en un ambiente sano, los padres se casaron muy jóvenes y por consiguiente los hijos no se hicieron esperar, tuvieron cinco  hijos y ella es la del medio que tiene 18 años, el papa siempre les dio lo mejor, nunca falto nada, vivia en un mundo de lujos, pero le hacia falta lo mas importante un padre que fuera comprensivo, con el tiempo la brecha entre ellos fue mas grande al punto de dividir a la familia, ya solo era la madre y los hermanos saliendo adelante, el padre se desapareció durante 1 año, ella como pudo empezó a salir a flote, creció y comenzó a reflejarse la ausencia del padre, ya que las hermanas empezaron a tener problemas de todo tipo, se tuvieron que cambiar de ciudad pero la salud de la mama se deterioro, así que volvieron a bogota, el hermano de ella empezó a tiene problemas graves y serios y a raíz de eso ella desidio estudiar atención integral a la primera infancia, llegando a terminar el 2 semestre se enfermo de y duro 2 meses en cama y con ello se fue deteriorando al salud, tras un largo periodo de 1 año los padres decidieron colaborar le para poder pagar el semestre, pero antes de comenzar ella estaba trabajando en un jardín en el cual duro 3 meses y salio agotada, después de un tiempo la mama se fue a otra ciudad con la hermana a hacerse una cirugía de salud, ella en este momento vive con la hermana el padre no tiene la capacidad de ayudarla para poder pagar  el semestre, a si por eso ella solicita la ayuda a kiva, para que pueda por fin terminar el sueño que dejo a mitad por problemas de salud.

El propósito de ella es trabajar en una población vulnerable para poderle proporcionar por medio de la experiencia y educación un modelo nuevo para que noten y quieran un cambio como el que hace ella por medio de los estudios, mostrar otra realidad ajena ala que viven, llenar los vacíos emocionales, tratar esos conflictos de raíz y darle una eficaz y duradera solución, sabe que no es cambiar el mundo, pero es contribuir al crecimiento corporal, emocional y espiritual de quienes mas lo necesitan y reconocer que la realidad o es ajena a los demás.
texts.en:
This is Anyela Daniela.  She wants to tell you when she started to feel motivated to start this career. 

It all started when she was six or seven years old, more or less, when she finished kindergarten.  He mother always cultivated her creativity.  Through this ability, she developed a marvelous passion for drawing.  She has had that passion for a long time, and she it continues to be one of her passions.  As the years passed, she lived very happily with a united family in a healthy atmosphere.  

Her parents married when they were very young, and then they did not wait to have children.  They had five children, and she is, at 18 years of age, the middle child.  Her father always gave them the best, and she did not lack for anything.  She lived in a world of luxuries.  However, she did not have what is the most important, an understanding father.  In time, the breach between them got bigger, to the point of dividing the family.  Now, only the mother and the siblings were getting ahead.  The father disappeared for one year.  As much as she could, she started to rise from the depths.  She grew and started to reflect upon her father’s absence.  The sisters started to have all types of problems.  They had to change cities, but her mother’s health deteriorated.  That is why they returned to Bogota.

Her brother started to have serious problems.  Because of this, she decided to study comprehensive early childhood care.  As she came to the end of the second semester, she got sick.  She was in bed for two months, and her health was deteriorating.  After a long period of one year, her parents decided to collaborate in order to be able to pay for the semester.  However, before she started, she was working in a kindergarten for three months, which left her exhausted.   After a time, her mother left with her sister for another city in order to have surgery for her health.

She now lives with her father’s sister, who is not able to help her pay for the semester.  That is why she is requesting help from Kiva so that she is finally able to fulfill the dream that she left halfway through due to health problems.

Her plan is to work with a vulnerable population in order to be able to provide, through experience and education, a new model.  She wants to do this so that they see and desire a change, like she is doing through her studies.  She wants to show them a different reality that is far from what they are living.  She wants to fill the emotional voids, to treat conflicts at their root, and to give them an effective and lasting solution.

She knows that it is not changing the world, but it is contributing to the physical, emotional, and spiritual growth of those who most need it.  This can be a reality for those that need it.

loans.use: to pay to register for a semester.

loans.name: Jupie

texts.en:
As a way of generating income, Jupie engages in cooking and selling meals and snacks within her community. She is 29 years old and has three children. She aims to increase her income in order to support her husband in financing the education of her children and to cover all their household expenses.

Now, Jupie is asking for financial support, amounting to PHP 15,000, to buy raw ingredients to be cooked and sold in her local community, like pork, chicken, fish, vegetables, and barbecue sauce. She is hoping that her loan request will be granted in order to make her business profitable someday.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for her business, like pork, chicken, fish, vegetables, and barbecue sauce.

location.town: Brgy. Lamo,Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Japan

texts.en: Japan is a farmer from the village of Nyamitanga , which is located in the Mbarara district. He is married and the father of seven children, four of whom are in school. He started cattle farming at the early age of 12 because it was the main economic activity in his village. After the death of his father, he struggled to help his mother survive through cattle farming until he began his own business. Now he wants to start building a semi-permanent commercial building which will help him generate more income. He is requesting a loan for 5,000,000 Ugandan shillings to complete his house. This will give him a descent place for his family to live and will also elevate his status in society. In this photograph, we see Japan with his wife.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Hoeun

texts.en:
Hoeun, age 44, lives in a Phnom Penh suburb. He has been married since 1996 and has three children -- two sons and one daughter. His children are all in school.

Hoeun sells energy drinks. He carries his inventory by a motorbike that has an attached trailer (in photo). He sells in his village and the nearby villages. His wife buys bananas from fellow villagers and sells them in a market in Phnom Penh. She wants to buy more bananas for sale. Hence, Hoeun requests a loan in order to help his wife obtain capital.

loans.use: to enable his wife to buy more bananas for resale.

loans.name: Atipay Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “ATIPAY”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sara Rossana ella es conviviente y tiene 37 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de pinturas, la socia pinta pinturas de diferentes estilos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de pinturas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pinturas, pinceles y cartulinas.
 
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de calzados, negocio de venta de libros, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.




La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the Communal Bank "Atipay" which is located in the District of Cusco, Cusco Province, Department of Cusco.

Sra. Sara Rossana is 37 years old and in a common-law relationship. She has a business in which she sells paintings. Sara creates paintings of different styles. She works from 8:00 A.M. to 6:00 P.M. Sara has been in this business for five years and is doing very well. Her dream is to expand her business of selling paintings.

Sara is requesting a loan in order to buy paints, brushes, and paperboards. The other members have businesses in which they sell shoes, books, groceries, and food.

Sara is grateful to those who helped to fulfill her dream in this manner, so she promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy paints, brushes, and paperboards.

loans.name: Sokunthea

texts.en:
Sokunthea (pictured), 39, is single and lives in a suburb of Phnom Pen with her sister. She sells fish and vegetables in her local market. 

Sokunthea wants to expand her business so that she can earn extra income to support her standard of living. Hence, she decided to apply for a loan to help her working capital.

loans.use: to expand her business by buying more fish and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Ugiloy

texts.en: Ugiloy is an industrious woman who is married and has two children. She is a hard worker, and learned at a very early age how to make her country's national dresses. For the last six years, she has earned a living by making clothing. She manages her business well, provides good service and has many regular customers. Ugiloy manages her business alone while her husband works in Russia. She must to buy coal and firewood for cold February weather but has not have enough money now to do this. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 Somoni to buy coal, and is very grateful to have the support of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy coal and firewood for the winter season.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
A 64-year-old PMPC member named Alberto is happy tending his little store. He's from Bato, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao, Philippines, and is single. The store is his means of earning a living to support his own needs. Fortunately, his store is located in a populous neighborhood and so he makes promising daily sales. Alberto keeps on running the store well even though there is increased competition from other stores. Alberto believes that with PMPC's support as one family they will sustain and beat the competition.  

Alberto has reached his 12th year as a member of Paglaum MPC.  He has applied for a loan of PHP 25,000 for the store. Expanding his inventory will mean additional income. He has confidence that he can maintain the label of a member in good standing. He is a hardworking man and wishes to sustain the store, and from there he could be able to help his niece and nephew in their college education.

loans.use: to restock more inventory for his "sari-sari" store (general store) business

loans.name: Nisreen

texts.en:
Nisreen is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online. So, her husband appears in the photo. 

Nisreen is a 40-year-old, married woman from Rafah city. She is a mother with ten children, five sons and five daughters. All of them are attending schools. 

Nisreen's husband is an employee in a local firm where he gets a low wage. This wage is not enough to cover all the family's needs. He also works as a carpenter in his small workshop. He makes furniture, upon clients' requests. It is a good business and it helps the family to cover part of their expenses. 

Nisreen took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help her husband to buy more wood boards for his carpentry workshop. By taking this loan, Nisreen's husband will be able to increase his productivity and also his income.

loans.use: to help her husband to buy more wood boards for his carpentry workshop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of the taxis that he and his son drive.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is 39 years old and a responsible mother. 

She owns a butcher shop in the public market. She specifically offers pork, chicken, and beef. She knows that through having this kind of business, she is able to help her husband generate a better income and support the education of their two children. Brenda aims to have her butcher shop business be continuous.

With regards to her determination to improve her financial stability and way of living, she is asking for a loan of 50,000 PHP to buy more stock of pork, chicken, and beef to sell. 

She believes that someday she will be able improve the business through financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy more pork, chicken, and beef.

location.town: Brgy. San Antonio North, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina was born in 1975. She is a woman who always tries to work hard for the well-being of her family. She works hard because she is responsible for feeding three children. Her husband is a migrant.

She always wanted to have her own business. She began her business selling children clothes 10 years ago. Her husband helped her organize the business. Little by little, she developed her business. At first, she did not have a place to sell the clothing but now, she has her own business place. She successfully runs her own business. 

Madina wants to increase working capital and maximize profit. She is asking for a loan of 7,500 TJS to buy more children's clothes to sell for increasing her working capital. 

She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes.

loans.name: Mauro

texts.en:
Mauro is a 57-year-old father who has two children. Farming and motorcycle transport have been Mauro's business involvement. He is thankful because his generated income from his farming business goes toward their daily consumption and other household expenditures. 

To continuously earn better income, Mauro is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy new tires, gasoline, and other accessories needed for the maintenance of his motorcycle. He believes that this financial assistance will strengthen his business someday.

loans.use: to buy tires, gasoline, and other accessories needed for the maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy papayas, oranges, peaches, melons, pineapples, bananas, watermelons.

loans.name: Wassef

texts.en:
Wassef is a 26-year-old, single man from Lebanon. He started to work at a young age, to fulfill his needs and support his family. He is a talented blacksmith. He owns a repair shop, where he serves his customers in a very friendly and professional way.

Today, he is requesting to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas, s.a.l. He will use the loan to purchase new products that will enhance his repair services and remarkably improve his business. Wassef is aiming to move into a bigger shop, where he will welcome a wider range of clientele. To do so, he definitely requires benefiting from this loan, and more loans to come.

loans.use: to purchase new products to use in his blacksmith work

loans.name: Saruon

texts.en:
Saruon (in the photo) sells vegetables in her local market, while her husband is a village leader. She has six sons and five daughters. Seven of her children are married, one is a garment worker, two are goldsmiths, and another one still attends school.

Saruon’s family is living in a village approximately seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She wants to buy a motorbike, because she does not have a motorbike for her family to use.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for family transportation.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy shoes and clothes from South Africa to resell.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Alberto is thankful for the financial assistance extended to him as he was able to buy the needed spare parts for his jeepney. His loan helped not just in his business but also in the education of his children. His income from the business is assisting their everyday household expenditures. He and his wife are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

He would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for him to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their Jeepney unit. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Alberto hopes to have another jeepney unit and dreams to have a better living. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and the maintenance of his jeepney unit.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en: Sopheap, age 35, lives in a Phnom Penh suburb. She has been married since 2000 and has two sons, who are attending school. Sopheap is a garment worker, while her husband is a motor taxi driver. Unhappily, Sopheap’s husband’s motorbike is getting old and does not work well. She decided to apply for a loan to replace her husband's motorbike with a new one.

loans.use: To replace her husband's motorbike with a new one.

loans.name: Muyassar

texts.en:
Muyassar is 52 years old. She is a careful mother of five children. She is a widow, her husband having died eight years ago. After the death of her husband, she experienced many difficulties.

Muyassar has a medical education. She has worked for more than seven years in a local hospital, as a nurse. She knows her field well. Muyassar works hard to earn a living. Her son, Sanjar, helps her to earn money.

Muyassar is going to repair her house, because her house is old. This house was built with the great dedication of her father-in-law. Muyassar is asking for a loan of 7,500 Somoni, which she will use to buy building materials, such as cement and paint. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials for repairing her family's house, including cement and paint

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
This is Melinda, 34, and a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Rolando, a tricycle driver, and a mother to their children. She and her husband manage their own household. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Melinda oversees and owns operations of their tricycle transportation business. They have one tricycle unit that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. In her business, the regular customers are the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 8000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts, accessories, and also for the maintenance of their motorcycle.

Melinda hopes to expand her business, and dreams that all her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle unit.

loans.name: Nazareth Group (B)

texts.en:
“My happiness is immense” says 43-year-old Hoichin. She lives with her two kids, a boy and a girl. Her husband passed away a couple of years ago and life seemed to face an end for her. She and her son are pictured with their hand raised and she is featured as the profile member for the group. The group is composed of 10 women members who are tirelessly making an effort to support their kids' educations. They call themselves Nazareth (B) Group.

Hoichin is a weaver and she is also engaged in all possible income-generating activities. Sand sieving, farming, and vegetable selling are also her activities to make an income and support the family. With the help of the Kiva education loan, she will pay for her son's admission fees, textbooks, stationery, and other annual expenses for the year. She says that educating her kids is her main focus and will work very hard to repay the loan on time. The rest of the group members will also pay for their kids' education expenses and they all are grateful towards Kiva and thanks Kiva very much.

loans.use: To pay for admission fees, textbooks, stationery, and other expenses for the year.

loans.name: Utkir

texts.en: Utkir was born in 1993. He is a student in the third course of the Economics faculty at Tajikistan State University. Utkir is one of the successful and smart students. He often goes to the library and he likes to read books. His parents are workers who don't have money to pay for tuition. Utkir is asking for a loan of 1,000 USD to pay for tuition. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam is 26 years old. She lives in a village, across the Mekong and 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Her elderly mother is living with her. She has just one young daughter.

Sam is a construction worker, while her husband is a mason. Sam does not have a proper house to live in. There is only a shelter with a bed inside (as shown in the photo).

Living with this difficult condition, Sam decided to apply for a loan to make her living conditions become better. She will use the money from the loan to make a proper house to live in.

loans.use: To build a proper house to live in.

loans.name: Salomat

texts.en: Salomat is a hard-working woman. She is married and has four children. Salomat was one of the best pupils in school. After graduating school, she entered the Pedagogical University and successfully got a higher degree. Salomat works in a school. She likes her job. Her salary is not enough to improve her living condition. Salomat wants to repair her flat. She is asking for a loan of 3500 Somoni to buy building materials such as cement, wood, paints, etc. She awaits your support and in advance, thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement, wood, paints, etc. for repairing her house.

loans.name: Guljanat

texts.ru: Гулжанат 39 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Гулжанат - среднее образование, супруг работает распределителем орошаемой воды. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Гулжанат занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав 13 лет назад, с 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Гулжанат, на сегодняшний день имеется: 6 овец, 1 дойная корова, которых она ежедневно доит и реализует поставщикам молока,  имеет очень хороший доход, также имеется 2,0 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает: лук, тыкву, фасоль для реализации, также имеется 0,10 ГА земельной доли на огороде, на которой ежегодно выращивают клубнику, которая в сезон приносит около 8,000 сом (KGS). Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулжанат обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом на покупку семян фасоли для посевных работ и удобрений для обработки земли. Доходы от кредита Гулжанат планирует вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового помещения для скота.
texts.en: Guljanat is 39 years old, married and raising 2 children together with her husband. Guljanat has a secondary education. Her husband works as a distributor of irrigation water.  To provide the primary income for her family, Guljanat is involved in farming and animal husbandry, having started 13 years ago with 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, today her business contains 6 sheep and 1 dairy cow that she milks daily and sells milk to milk distributors, and has a very good income.  She also has a 2.0 hectare land plot, where she annually grows onions, pumpkins and beans for sale, and a .10 hectare land plot in her garden, where she grows strawberries that yield about 8,000 som (KGS) during the season. The aggregate monthly income amounts to 15,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Guljanat requested a loan from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy bean seeds for sowing and fertilizers for treating the land. Guljanat plans to invest the earnings from the loan into increasing domestic livestock quantities and saving money to build a new space for livestock.

loans.use: to buy bean seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en:
Uzma is a 38-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of two sons and a daughter. Her husband is an engineer in the airline industry and is the only one responsible for feeding her entire family. 

Uzma wants to start her own marriage bureau to increase their income. She needs different types of accessories and fixtures for her workplace but is currently not in a position to purchase these items.

She applied for a Kiva loan from field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will provide assistance for her to make purchases for her business. She can then enable herself to earn an income and contribute to meet her family's needs.

Uzma is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to start a marriage bureau.

loans.name: Sychan

texts.en:
Sychan now sells grocery items from her home. She lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh and has two young children, one son and one daughter. Her husband is a cell phone and walkie talkie repairman. 

Sychan is asking for a loan to buy a new motorbike because the old one is breaking down and uses more gasoline.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike.

loans.name: Huda

texts.en:
Huda is a 59-year-old married mother of one child who has been working in selling used clothes since 25 years ago. Huda is the sole breadwinner of her family, since her husband doesn't work.

Huda is well known in her region for the good quality of products she sells and the special prices she provides for her customers.
Her long experience in this domain provides her with the customers' attention and care.

Huda is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with a special-offer spring and summer collection that will attract new customers and increase her income.

This is Huda's second cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower; through her previous loan, she was capable of increasing her business capital and her family's socioeconomic situation.

Huda hopes to stay in good health to develop her business and provide her family with the necessary living needs.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with a special-offer spring and summer collection

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy building materials as cement, paints, etc., for repairing her house

loans.name: Masrur

texts.en: Masrur is a smart man. He was born in 1955. Masrur is divorced and has three children. He works in the Academy of Sciences of Tajikistan. Masrur has worked here more than 40 years. Masrur likes his job. He has worked hard for many years. Masrur wants to repair his flat because his flat has bad conditions. He is going to repair all rooms and the hall. He is asking for a loan of 600 USD to buy building materials, such as cement, wood, etc. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials, such as cement, wood, etc.

loans.name: Kassem

texts.en:
Kassem is a 31-year-old, Lebanese, single man. He has been involved in the construction field for the past 10 years. He is a freelancer, sticking by multiple construction projects and responding to many individual requests. Over the years, Kassem has been able to build a great experience in this domain. He has even hired four full-time workers, who help him accomplish the work.

Presently, Kassem is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. He will use the loan to purchase a stepladder and a winch, in order to facilitate the moving of harsh materials. Kassem is very optimistic and sure that these funds will certainly lend him a hand, to enlarge his work more and more.

loans.use: to purchase a stepladder and a winch

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn previously accessed a PHP 25,000 loan that she used to buy spare parts and accessories and to pay for the maintenance of her tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children, and in her personal, household, and business expenditures.
 
Marilyn would like to apply for another loan, in the amount of PHP 30,000, to buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of her tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the education of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marilyn dreams to be more successful in business and she hopes that all her children will finish their studies. Every week, she meets with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration, by studying the Word of God. 

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts, accessories, and maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal is a 40-year-old divorced mother of four children who has been working in selling clothes from her house to cover her needs and provide her children with the necessary standards of living.

Jamal is a hard worker with a very good reputation in her region, especially in her established business that's aimed at covering her needs and her beloved children, whom she adores most. She is working hard to provide them with the necessary living needs.

Jamal is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to register herself back in the university to complete her education, which she believes is the most important thing to acquire in order to develop her children's socioeconomic situation.

This is Jamal's fourth loan cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower. Her previous loans were invested in increasing her business capital and attracting new customers.

She is looking forward to enrolling back into the university, and hopes to make her beloved children's dreams come true.

loans.use: To complete her university studies in order to make sure that she and her beloved children will have a better future with a better income

loans.name: Mohamad Houssam

texts.en:
Mohamad Houssam is a 47-year-old married father of two children who has been working in selling chicken since four years ago.

Mohamad Houssam is a hard worker with a very good reputation in his domain, because of the good quality of products he sells, and special encouraging prices.

Mohamad Houssam is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary chicken spices and specialized requested tools for this reason, which will reflect positively on his family's social and financial situation.

Mohamad Houssam seeks perfection for his family, and hopes to provide them with the best education ever. He hopes to expand and develop his business as much as he can, through starting sandwich services in the future.

loans.use: To buy chicken spices and specialized tools

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.es:
Jhonny vive en compañia de su esposa y sus dos hijos  en la zona de Mallasilla de la ciudad de La Paz. Trabaja cmo costurero elabora prendas de vestir chalecos de cuerina y casimir, su esposa se dedica a la colocacion de dichas prendas en el mercado, Jhonny nos solicito el crédito para poder comprarse una maquina de cocer  y materia prima.

El sueño de Jhonny es que predomine la salud para toda su familia y dar un buen estudio a sus hijos,
texts.en:
Jhonny lives with his wife and two children in the District of Mallasilla in the city of La Paz. He works as a tailor and produces vests made of imitation leather and cashmere. His wife is in charge of displaying his products at the market.

Jhonny is requesting a loan in order to buy a sewing machine and raw materials. His dream is to keep his family's health a priority and to provide a good education for his children.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and raw materials.

loans.name: Majida

texts.en:
Majida is a 51-year-old, married mother of five children, for whom she has been the sole breadwinner for 18 years.

In 2003, Majida established her own business, which is specialized in pasting plastic and cardboard bags. She is a hard-working woman with special talents in her domain. Majida's relationships with nearby printing companies put her on the top list of people who do such a service.

Today, Majida is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, to buy necessary raw materials that will decrease her costs and increase her income.

Majida hopes to move to a larger shop to expect more requests.

loans.use: to buy necessary raw materials that will decrease her costs and increase her income.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina is married with four children, and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (her father). She has a business of a wholesale shop and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 2,500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, jerrycans of cooking oil, bags of rice, loaves of bread and trays of eggs.  

She works in a shop and sells on wholesale basis seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include transportation of commodities and ever increasing prices of commodities in Uganda. She is aspiring of owning a fully stocked wholesale shop and also to buy a plot of land and build a house. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of school fees. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and jerrycans of cooking oil to sell wholesale.

loans.name: Naftali

texts.en: Naftali is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be stable. He operates a retail business where he offers cleaning services. He does cleaning of motor vehicle seats. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in an area fit for the business and his primary customers are car dealers. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy stock of detergents and other materials for cleaning. His business goal is to be successful within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. This is his first loan with SMEP.

loans.use: buy stock of detergents and other materials for cleaning

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a married woman with 2 children. She describes herself as determined. 

Catherine operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are local residents. She will use the loan of 20,000 KES to buy a stock of clothes. Her business goal is to be a supplier of clothes within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP.

loans.use: to buy a stock of clothes.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a Ugandan male aged 26 years and is married with one child aged 3 years. He is a teacher by profession working with a local government of Kagadi Uganda and has spent 30 months in service. Joseph chose this profession because it is the only one that his parents could afford. He also earns from agriculture to supplement his small salary from teaching. 

While working as a Third grade teacher, he hopes to educate himself to a degree level and build a house for his family. Although he is challenged by low pay. Joseph wants a loan to buy iron sheets, doors, and windows for the construction of his house.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets, doors, and windows for the construction of his house.

loans.name: Alcides

texts.es: Alcides  tiene la edad de 64 años, es casado y vive con la esposa y una  hija  actualmente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de ganado  y cuando estén grandes venderlos y obtener una ganancia. El negocio del ganado le ayudará a el y a su familia. El espera que con este proyecto crezca y logre sus objetivos y así pueda en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Alcides is 64 years old and married. He currently lives with his wife and a daughter. He wishes to get the loan in order to purchase cattle, then when the animals are big enough he'll sell them and make a profit. The cattle business will be of help to him and his family. He hopes that with this project he'll make progress and achieve his goals. That way he'll someday provide his family with better living conditions and more financial stability. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR. He hadn't made loans with other state-owned banks before, but FUDECOSUR has provided the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for fattening.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 35-year-old married man who has been working in vehicle repairs, specializing in body work, for 16 years.

Youssef is starting an additional income business to improve his family's living and make sure that he can achieve a secured and stable future income business.

Today, he is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to pay off the purchase of a small bus he is buying to start an additional business in the transportation sector.

He hopes that he can develop this new business into a tourist company in the future.

loans.use: to pay off the purchase of a small bus he is buying to start an additional business.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 44-year-old divorced mother of one child who has run her grocery store for four years. This is her own source of income, which she is developing gradually to keep it a good source of income. Mariam is acquiring her third loan cycle from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to develop and increase her accessories and perfumes section with newly released special-offer products, especially for the coming Valentine's season.

Her previously acquired loans helped her a lot in developing her business, which she believes will help her a lot in providing her child with necessary living needs.

She will work hard to keep on developing her business through the opening of a specialized accessories, cosmetics, and perfumes shop.

loans.use: To increase her accessories and perfumes section with newly released special-offer products, especially for the coming Valentine's day season

loans.name: Balimaya Group

texts.fr:
BALIMAYA est un groupe de l’association KANKELE de BAMANAKING. Il regroupe 4 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne quatre enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de grain de néré à l’image de MINATA qui est la première  personne debout de la droite vers la gauche de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles au BAMANAKING dans la  préfecture Ouelessebougou  (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire. 
MINATA, qui excelle dans la vente de grain de néré  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 10 sacs de grains de néré.  Elle  s’approvisionne sur place à Ouelessebougou et vend ses produits à BAMAKO, au comptant, à crédit une clientèle mixte.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000FCFA somme qui lui  
permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
The BALIMAYA group is part of the KANKELE association of BAMANAKING. It consists of four married women who know one another as neighbors and through ties of kinship. They average 35 years of age and 4 children each, and they live in large traditional families in BAMANAKING, prefecture of Ouelessebougou (region of Koulikoro, Republic of Mali).

The group members have been engaged in small trade for several years and are in high demand in their respective activities. Minata buys and sells néré seeds. She appears in the photo standing first from the right,

To satisfy the growing needs of their customer base, they joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. This is their 5th group loan. 

MINATA plans to use her loan to buy 10 sacks of néré seeds. She buys her stock locally in Ouelessebougou and sells it in BAMAKO to a mixed clientele, for cash or on credit.

She hopes to earn a monthly profit of 20,000FCFA, which will allow her to repay her loan and to invest in her activity.

loans.use: to buy nere seeds for resale.

loans.name: Erika Natalia

texts.es:
Erika Natalia es una mujer que la vida le ha puesto muchos obstaculos para salir adelante al igual que a la familia.  
Todo comienza cuando el padre muere y la mama queda sola en la vida con ella y los tres hermanos sin ninguna posibilidad ni apoyo de ningún tipo, a la mama le toco luchar con todos trabajando en casa de familias en puestos informales de mil maneras .
Erika siendo la mayor ella se hacia cargo de los hermanos, estaba en 7 de bachillerato con gran dificultad iba a estudiar para luego regresar y hacer de comer a los hermanos y de paso cuidarlos.
Ya estando en décimo la mama tomo la desicion de sacarla de estudiar ya que no tenían ni para comer ni para los implemento de estudio.
Al igual que la mama ella empezó a trabajar en lo mismo en empleos informales y trabajos pesados para ayudarle a la familia.
La mama después de un tiempo empezó una relación con una persona con la que ella tenia muchos problemas, por lo tanto la convivencia se torno infernal, lo cual a ella le toco partir.
Afortunadamente ya contaba con 18 anos lo cual le permitía trabajar en cualquier cosa, se quedo sola pagando arriendo, motivada por las ganas de superación termino el bachillerato y se graduó.
Se gano una beca con las hermanas Adoratrices la aprovecho y culmino los estudios, ahora es técnica en confección, compro la maquina de coser y la fileteadora y con eso trabaja, pero como esta la situación ser independiente es muy difícil se necesita de un buen capital el cual ahora no posee.
 Ella antes había intentado estudiar hace 7 anos en Campo Alto  enfermería, pero no le alcanzaba la plata para pagar la pensión así que se retiro; después hizo el intento con admi en salud pero paso lo mismo con esta. 
Siempre le han gustado la ciencias de salud y a tratado de luchar para estudiar es lo que le gusta y lo que quiere para la vida, ahora trabaja como empleada en una empresa de confección.
En el 2013 empezó con servicios farmacéuticos, esta encantada y con sacrificio ya va en segundo semestre esta muy motivada y con muchas ganas de terminar para hacer una especialización en medicina alternativa.
Ella sueña con seguir estudiando para tener buenas ofertas laborales y viajar a otros paises llenarse de conocimiento para compartirlo con la sociedad y ante todo seguir ayudando a la mama y a al hermanito menor que toda la vida va a depender de la familia por la discapacidad, ella solo espera que la historia de vida sea útil para ser beneficiaria del convenio KIVA.
texts.en:
Erika Natalia is a woman whose life has put many obstacles in the way of her getting ahead.  The same is true for her family. 
It all started when her father died and her mother was left alone in life with Erika and her three siblings and no possibility of any type of help.  Her mother had to struggle with all of them by working in private homes in thousands of informal positions. 
Erika, being the oldest, took care of her siblings.  She was in 7th grade.  It was very difficult for her to go to school and later return home to feed and otherwise take care of her siblings.  
Once Erika was in 10th grade, her mother made the decision to take her out of school, as they didn't have money for food much less for school supplies. 
Just like her mother, Erika started working in informal jobs and hard labors to help her family. 
After a while, Erika's mother started a relationship with someone with whom she ended up having a lot of problems.  As such, living together turned hellish, and so she left. 
Fortunately, Erika was 18-years old by then and could work in any job.  She was paying rent by herself.  Motivated by her desire to improve her situation, she finished high school and graduated. 
She was awarded a scholarship by the Adoratrices sisters.  She took advantage of the scholarship to finish her schooling.  She is now a sewing technician.  She purchased a sewing machine and a surger and is able to work with them.  But since working independently is very difficult, she needs a decent amount of capital, which she doesn't have right now.  
Seven years ago, Erika had tried to go to school at Campo Alto to study nursing.  But she didn't have enough money to pay for her room and board, so she withdrew.  Later, she tried again with health administration, but ended up in the same situation. 
Erika has always liked health sciences, and she has tried with a lot of effort to study it; it's what she likes and what she wants to do with her life.  Right now, she works as an employee for a sewing company. 
In 2013 she started studying pharmaceutical services.  She just loves it and with much sacrifice, is already in her second semester.  She is very motivated and really hopes to finish her studies and specialize in alternative medicine. 
Erika's dreams are to keep studying so she can have good job opportunities and to travel to other countries to fill herself with knowledge and later share it with her community.  Most of all, she wants to keep helping her mother and her youngest brother, who is going to be dependent on his family his whole life due to a disability.  Erika only hopes that her life story is useful to benefit KIVA.

loans.use: to pay for a semester's tuition.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 57 years old and from Olkalou. She is married to Francis and they are blessed with three children aged 22, 18, and 12 years old.

She is a farmer who has been practicing mixed farming for the last 34 years, and to enable her buy a water storage tank so as to create more time to work on her farm, she has applied for her first loan of KES 20,400 from VisionFund Kenya.

Her monthly income right now is KES 10,000 and she hopes to use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to pay back her loan to VisionFund Kenya and to expand her farming activities. In the future, Mary hopes to buy a plot and construct rental houses.

loans.use: to buy a water storage tank

loans.name: Musema

texts.en: Musema is a 39-year-old married man. He has two children with ages 11 and 15 years. He describes himself to be persistent. He operates a retail business where he sells bread, beverages, washing soap, cooking oil, sugar, maize flour, and other items. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in a good location and his primary customers are of all ages. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital to add more stock. He will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more stock of bread, sugar, washing soap, cooking oil, and other items he sells. His business goal is to open two more shops in different locations within five years. He hopes that in the future he will be happy and self-dependent. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of KES 50,000 was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to invest back in the business.

loans.use: buy more stock of bread, sugar, washing soap, cooking oil, and other items he sells

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
DANAYA est un groupe de l’association BENKADI de DIANIKORO. Il regroupe 5 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne  cinq enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiments à l’image de DJENEBA qui est la première  personne debout de la droite vers la gauche de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à DIANIKORO dans la  préfecture de KATI (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a deux ans. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire. 
DJENEBA, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de condiment alimentaires de différentes sortes (poivre, tomate, oignon, choux, et cube maggi).  Elle s’approvisionne à OUELESSEBOUGOU auprès des grossistes  et vend ses articles à DIANIKORO, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 40.000FCFA somme qui lui  
permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
Danaya is a group of the Benkadi Association of Dianikoro. It is composed of five women who know each other as relatives and neighbors. On the average, they are 31 years old. Married, and with five children on the average, they are engaged in various business activities, such as buying and reselling condiments. This is what Djeneba does, for example. She is the first one standing from right to left in the photo. The group members live in traditional extended families in Dianikoro, in the Kati prefecture (Koulikoro region, the Republic of Mali).

They have been working as vendors for years and have a lot of customer following. With the goal of meeting growing demand, two years ago the group members have decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. They are on their third solidarity loan. Djeneba plans to use her loan to buy various food condiments (pepper, tomatoes, onions, cabbage and Maggi cube). She buys her stock from wholesalers in Ouelessebougou and sells in Dianikoro, retail, for cash and on credit, to a customer base composed of women and men.
She hopes to earn a monthly revenue of 40,000 West African francs, which will allow her to pay off her loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Altise

texts.en: The rent-to-own basis system used by Altise is going excellently and so fast. So she's coming to us to buy more stock so that she can always have goods available for her customers. She's interested in renting more kerosene stoves and solar desk lanterns.

loans.use: to purchase stock for a clean energy business

loans.name: Flavio Stalin

texts.es:
San Miguel de los Bancos el Cantón del Amor, un Cantón de clima cálido húmedo, el mismo cuenta varios sitios de descanso que son muy visitado por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, como tradición tenemos las fiestas del Cantón en las cuales se realizan bailes populares y la famosa quema del castillo, la gente en este Cantón es muy amable y tranquila con todos sus visitantes.
En este Cantón vive y trabaja Stalin un joven luchador de 20 años es soltero no tiene hijos, vive y trabaja con la mamá en una finca que tienen en el Recinto 23 de junio. Solicita el crédito para emprender en su propio negocio y al vivir en un Cantón donde la ganadería es la principal fuente de ingreso y ya que conoce de esta actividad, decidió emprender en el negocio de la ganadería actualmente trabaja un promedio de 8 horas diarias 
Con la inversión de este crédito espera que mejore su calidad de vida. Stalin agradece a fundación alternativa y a Kiva por la gran ayuda que le están brindando de iniciarse en su propio negocio.
texts.en:
The canton of San Miguel de los Bancos, known as the "Canton of Love", has a warm, humid climate and many leisure areas which are popular among domestic and foreign tourists. The area has a traditional festival with folk dances and the famous burning of a model castle. The people of this canton are very friendly and relaxed with their visitors.

Stalin lives and works in this canton. He is a hardworking 20-year-old man. He is single and does not have any children. He lives and works with his mother on a farm that they own in a community called "23 de junio" ("June 23rd"). He is applying for a loan to start his own business. Living in a canton where livestock is the main source of income, he is already familiar with this activity, so he decided to start his own livestock business. He currently works for about 8 hours per day.

By investing this loan, he hopes that he will improve his quality of life. Stalin is grateful to Fundación Alternativa and to Kiva for the great help which they are providing for him to start his own business.

loans.use: to start his own livestock business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and a weighing scale

loans.name: Kalsom

texts.en:
Kalsom is 43 years old and a married woman. She has been running a business of animal sales and purchase for many years. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up and sells them near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries). 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation; currently, she requested a loan of 50,000 rupees to purchase two more calves. She is in her fifth loan cycle with good repayment history.  

She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Motahar

texts.en:
Motahar is a 26-year-old who dreams of a comfortable life someday. He lives in Taiz, Yemen. His dream leads him to strive harder to earn an income. He has been operating his own business, selling different kinds of products such as toys, cosmetic materials, perfumes and other stationery in a shop. It provides enough income to cover his family's daily expenses. He has been in this business for one year, and he is aiming for a better income from it. His business has gradually grown and he has specialized in everything. 

Due to the current bad situation in Yemen, he is making less profit from his enterprise. So, he requested a loan of 100,000 Yemeni rials from AMB in order to buy additional products such as toys, perfumes and other stationery for his store that will increase his profit. With this loan, he will be able to develop his business and eventually obtain his dream.

loans.use: to buy additional products such as toys, perfumes and other stationery for his store

loans.name: Faby

texts.en: Faby uses his motorcycle to pick up his stock and go through the village to sell it easily. This helps him to get his stock moving faster. After receiving a full payment on his last one, he's coming back to us now to take out a new loan.

loans.use: to purchase stock for a clean energy business.

loans.name: Walter Guillermo

texts.es:
Walter es un joven emprendedor de 22 años mantiene una sólida relación en unión libre, él trabaja como albañil y la esposa en un restaurante, actualmente no tienen hijos, el viene de una familia humilde de bajos recursos sus padres se dedican a la agricultura no tenían muchas posibilidades por lo que el no pudo estudiar.
Walter  vive y trabaja en San Miguel de los Bancos el Cantón del Amor, un Cantón de clima cálido húmedo, el mismo cuenta varios sitios de descanso que son muy visitado por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, como tradición tenemos las fiestas del Cantón en las cuales se realizan bailes populares y la famosa quema del castillo la gente en este Cantón es muy amable y tranquila con todos sus visitantes.
Solicita este crédito para emprender su propio negocio en una pequeña granja de cerdos, aprendió de esta actividad cuando vivía con los papas en la finca, con esta inversión espera mejorar sus ingresos económicos y calidad de vida y pronto pensar en tener hijos. 
El joven Walter agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y la ayuda que le brindan para emprender en su negocio.
texts.en:
Walter, 22, is in a solid common-law marriage. He works as a construction worker and his spouse works in a restaurant. They do not have any children. He comes from a humble family with limited resources. His parents work in agriculture and did not have many opportunities, so he was not able to study.

Walter lives and works in San Miguel de los Bancos, known as the "Canton of Love". This canton has a warm, humid climate and various leisure areas which are popular among domestic and foreign tourists. The area has a traditional festival with folk dances and the famous burning of a model castle. The people of this canton are friendly and relaxed with their visitors.

Walter is applying for a loan to start his own business, a small pig farm. He learned about this business when he lived with his parents on the farm. With this investment, he hopes to improve his financial income and his quality of life and to think about having children soon.

Walter is grateful to Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for their support and the help which they are providing for him to start his own business.

loans.use: to start his own business, a pig farm.

loans.name: Auguste

texts.en: Auguste used to sell his stock in front of a big public market each Tuesday and Friday in his area that helped him to get access to have his stock sold faster. After fully repaying his last loan, now he's coming back to us to take out another one.

loans.use: To purchase stock for a clean energy business

loans.name: Sougra

texts.en:
Sougra is a 55-year-old married woman who has a business selling milk. She sells milk to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit. Sougra has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently, she is in her third loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees). This will allow her to purchase one more cow. Sougra is hopeful that this loan will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
El señor Luis de  26 años de edad , vive con su esposa, tiene un hijo  que depende de él, vive en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras.
Don Luis tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 07 años  a la venta de ropa interior, ropa de niños y sandalias, este negocio es atendido por la esposa y el sale a vender a la calle y trabaja en la portuaria. 
Don Luis es trabajador con muchas ganas de salir adelante, está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de  blúmeres, braseares, calcetines, sandalias, etc.  desea surtir un poco más el negocio, con el apoyo del crédito espera mejorar un poco su condición de vida, está muy contento de seguir trabajando con Prisma es un excelente cliente.
Don Luis su sueño es mejorar su casa y tener el mejor negocio de la zona.

San Lorenzo, Honduras- Enero del 2014
texts.en:
Luis is 26 years old and lives with his wife in the community of San Lorenzo, in the department of Valle in the southern part of Honduras.  He has one child who is dependent on him.  Luis has his own home and for the past seven years has worked selling underwear, children's clothing, and sandals. His wife tends to the business while he sells on the street and in the area around the port. 

Luis is a hard worker with a strong desire to get ahead.  He is requesting this loan so he can buy panties, bras, socks, sandals, etc. to stock up his business a bit more.  With the support of this loan he hopes to improve his living condition a little.  He is very pleased to continue working with Prisma and is an excellent client. Luis dreams of fixing up his house and having the best business in the area.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - January 2014

loans.use: to buy panties, bras, socks, sandals, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Alia

texts.en: Alia was born in 1980. She is a married lady, living in a rented house, in a sector in Jordan called Dairalla. She lives with her husband, who works serving in the military, and her three sons and daughters. She has been trying her best to support her husband in improving their living conditions, and covering their children’s needs by running her project, selling clothes at her house. Then she added accessories and cosmetic products to her project. She has been doing this for one year. She needs to expand more now by buying a larger quantity of accessories, and adding variety to them, in order to attract more customers and to raise her profits.  She doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more accessories and cosmetic products for her business

loans.name: Omar

texts.en: Omar is 28 years old. He lives with his wife in a sector of Jordan called Madaba. For the past six months, Omar has been running his own store where he sells home products, considering it a profitable project that might improve his living conditions. Now he needs to supply his store with a larger quantity of home products to attract more customers. But he doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, he has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to buy more home products for his store.

loans.name: Diamond Group (A)

texts.en:
Esther is a very loving mother. She has five daughters and a little boy. She and one of her daughters are pictured with their raised hands. Esther is the featured profile member for Diamond Group A. All the group members live in a village that is about 35 kms from the capital state of Manipur, also one of the northeastern states in India.

With the education loan, she will pay for her daughter’s admission fees, textbooks and stationery, uses and other annual expenses. The amused mother and happy Esther say, “I can’t believe this education loan for my daughter.” 

Esther’s husband teaches in a private school and earns a small amount of salary, which is insufficient to pay for all the expenses in the family. She also cannot take up any activity because she has six kids to take care of and fails to pay all their educational fees on time. 

The loan will help them be free from tension and will enable them to focus on their other kids. “This is such a blessing for the family,” says the mother. She says, “Thank you so much, Kiva, and you enlighten people’s life.” 

The rest of the other members will also pay for the educational fees, and they are all grateful.

loans.use: to pay for school admission, textbooks, stationery and annual examination fees for the year, and give a better future for the child.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is 32 and a mother of three children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan.

She owns a medical clinic in which she provides first aid services to patients. She has been practicing as a medical nurse in a hospital and now wants to start her own clinic on the basis of her experience. In the past, she has dealt with many cases of pregnancy and assisted on many successful operations. She is a very well-known nurse in her area and the ladies have full confidence in her abilities. 

Nazia wants to buy new beds so she can set up her clinic, in this way she can provide good services to her patients. She has requested a loan so that she can buy these beds. She hopes that the profit she makes will allow her to look after her children well.

loans.use: To buy beds for her clinic.

loans.name: Nemah

texts.en:
Nema was born in 1982. She is a married lady living in a sector in Jordan called Dairalla with her four sons and only daughter. Her husband works in a governmental entity. Nemah is trying her best to support her family financially by running her project of raising goats and selling their products that she started three years ago. 

She found it profitable and is now planning to expand it by buying a larger quantity of goats to raise her productivity and income but she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity of goats to raise her productivity

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 27-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has requested a loan for her husband’s green grocery business. Her husband sells seasonal vegetables from a cart; he purchases fresh vegetables in bulk and sells in local community with a cart. 

Nowadays, his cart has become out of order; its wheels have loosened their alignment, and the planks have lost their smoothness as well. He is unable to buy a new cart because he does not have the lump sum amount. Therefore, Razia requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner so that her husband can buy the four wheel cart. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a four-wheel cart for the green grocery.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma is 37-year-old married woman. Two years ago, she started her own business selling cloths. She buys cloths of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates, and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

She is requesting a 40,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) loan from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and she plans to spend the part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Emad

texts.en: Emad is 22 years old. He is living in a sector in Jordan called Irbid with his family, consisting of five sisters and his parents. His father is a plumber. Emad is studying for his Bachelor's, majoring in Mechanical Engineering. He is in his second year. Emad is planning to find a job that suits his study field after graduation in order to start supporting his family financially as they are facing a financial crisis. He wants to help them pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 21-year-old single Lebanese man. He has been working as an aluminum worker since 2011; he works on a freelance basis. He works on a lot of projects for many private companies and individuals, and he is very loyal and accomplishes his tasks proficiently. 

With his youth loan requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, Ahmad looks forward to buying the tools needed to ease his business operations, and be able to complete his work in less time. 

Ahmad says that he is in real need for the loan to expand his business, and to earn a higher revenue with the aim of becoming the proprietor of his own business as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy tools needed for his business.

loans.name: Maa Laxmi Group

texts.en:
Maa Laxmi Self Help Group (SHG) was formed in January 2014 and consists of fifteen rural poor women belonging to the below-poverty-line category. This group is located in a remote rural village named Turekela, in the Balangir district of Odisha, India. Vegetable cultivation and vending is the primary source of livelihood for most of the members of this group. 

Parbati is one of the members among them. The lady standing third from left in the back row with brinjal (eggplants) in her hand is Parbati. She is a very active lady of 31 years of age. She lives with her husband, two sons and two daughters.

Parbati has a vegetable cultivation farm of one hectare. She and her husband manage the farm. Her husband is an active and cheerful farmer. They produce vegetables like brinjal, cauliflower, carrots, cabbage, chilies, cucumbers, papaya, lady’s finger (okra), onions, etc. on the farm. She sells her products to the traders from the nearest town who come to take vegetables from her farm. 

Parbati says that she earns a minimum amount of 5,000 INR per month from this business. This is insufficient to meet the day-to-day expenses of her family as well as the farm expenses. Parbati wants to expand her business by taking a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. She will utilize the present loan to buy fertilizer and farm inputs like seeds and pesticides for her farm. She expects a good return from her business by expanding her cultivation. 

Parbati dreams to construct a house and purchase a water pump for a better irrigation facility for her farm. She also hopes to give her whole family a bright future through her hard work. 

The other fourteen members of this group are also involved in businesses like vegetable cultivation, general grocery shop, vegetable vending, and tailoring businesses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and farm inputs like seeds and pesticides for expanding her farming.

loans.name: Lassané

texts.fr: Nouveau partenaire de Nafa Naana pour la distribution de produits énergie (foyers améliorés, foyers à gaz et lampes solaires diverses), Lassané a un besoin financier de 265 150 FCFA pour commencer l’activité. Ce montant correspond à l’acquisition d’un premier stock de 13 foyers améliorés, 3 foyers à gaz et 12 lampes solaires. Lassané, âgé de 45 ans, marié et père de cinq enfants a ouvert sa quincaillerie depuis deux ans et veut associer la vente des produits énergie pour contribuer à la protection de l’environnement et également augmenter ses revenus financiers. Les revenus additionnels qui seront générés grâce à la vente des produits Nafa Naana lui permettront de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille dont tous les enfants vont à l’école. Lassané envisage de continuer son partenariat avec Nafa Naana pour atteindre son objectif d’améliorer ses revenus et ainsi sa vie.
