Il dit vouloir toujours être un ambassadeur pour la protection de l’environnement dans son quartier Barga de la ville de Ouagadougou et de permettre aux populations de réaliser des économies d’argent et de santé.
texts.en:
Mr. Lassané, a new partner of Nafa Naana for the distribution of energy-saving products (improved stoves, gas stoves, and a variety of solar lamps), has need of financing in the amount of 265,150 francs CFA to start his business. This amount corresponds to the acquisition of a stock of 13 improved stove, 3 gas stoves, and 12 solar lamps. 

Lassané is a 45-year-old married father of five. He opened his own hardware store two years ago and wants to include with it the sale of energy-saving products and also to increase his revenues. The additional revenues to be generated from selling Nafa Naana products will enable him to meet family needs, including all his children attending school. 

Lassané envisions continuing his partnership with Nafa Naana to achieve his goal of improving his revenues and thus his living conditions. He says he still wants to be an ambassador for environmental protection in his district of Barga, Ouagadougou City, and for enabling people to save money and to save on healthcare costs.

loans.use: to do commerce in improved stoves, solar lamps, and gas stoves

loans.name: Sayhuna

texts.en:
Sayhuna was born in 1995; she is single. She is a student in the second year at National Tajikistan University, and she studies well and is learning law. Sayhuna’s parents always wanted to see Sayhuna as a successful lawyer. Now, they are proud of their daughter.  

She must to pay for her tuition at the university, but she doesn't have the money. She is asking for a loan to pay for tuition. 

She awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay for tuition at the university

loans.name: Olga Marina

texts.es:
La señora Olga Marina de  38  años de edad, es casada,  tiene cuatro   hijos  que depende de ella, vive en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras.
Doña Olga Marina tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 01 año  a la elaboración  de tortilla, se levanta temprano todo los días a moler el maíz para vender las tortillas y esto le ha generado buenos y muchos clientes.
Doña Olga Marina está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra maíz y la leña, es su primer préstamo que solicita y con el apoyo del mismo desea prepararse  de leña y maíz, ya que está un poco barato ahorita y quiere aprovechar. Su sueño es mejorar su vivienda para este año.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – Enero del 2014
texts.en:
Olga Marina is 38 years old, married, and has four children who depend on her. She lives in the community of San Lorenzo, a valley in the south of Honduras. Olga Marina has her own house, and for a year she has worked making tortillas. She wakes up early every day to grind the corn to sell the tortillas, and this has provided her many good clients. Olga Marina is requesting the loan to buy corn and firewood. It is her first loan that she is requesting, and with its help, she wants to prepare herself with firewood and corn.  They're a little less expensive right now, and she wants to take advantage. Her dream is to improve her home this year. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras – January 2014

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a 28-year-old lady from the Kisumu region, which is found in the western part of Kenya. She is married and takes care of her family. She also takes care of four people in her family.

She operates a poultry farm, a business she has been doing for the last seven years; she generates a monthly income of KES. 10,000. 

She is applying for a loan for school fees from VisionFund Kenya. 

Her dream is to grow her business to support her family.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is a 35-year-old man and he has four children. He operates a retail business where he sells bread, beverages, washing soap, sugar and other items. He has been involved in this business for six years. 

His business is located in a rural area, and his primary customers are local residents. He will use the Kes 25,000 loan to buy more stock of bread, sugar, washing soap and  other items he sells. 

His business goal is to be able to assist the community within five years. 

He hopes that in the future, he will be independent. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM; his previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully. 

Elijah will use the anticipated profits to cater to his children needs.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bread, sugar, washing soap and other items to sell.

loans.name: Marlene Karina

texts.es:
Marlene es una señora de 28 años, tiene una niña de 5 años, juntas viven en casa arrendada en la ciudad de Santo Domingo, una zona con un clima agradable y  muy comercial.
Marlene es una señora muy trabajadora, desde hace 10 años se ha dedicado a la costura y ha prestado sus servicios a una empresa donde confeccionan camisas. Ahora Marlene quiere ponerse su propio taller, es por ello que acudió a Fundación Alternativa ya que por falta de capital no ha podido  comprarse las máquinas; ella cuenta con unos pequeños ahorros porque este ha sido su sueño hace mucho tiempo y poco a poco ha podido reunir ese dinero, pero aun así no es suficiente para comprar las máquinas necesaria para el taller.
A Marlene se le pudo ayudar con un crédito para emprender en su nuevo negocio. Está muy feliz y se siente muy agradecida con Fundación Alternativa y el proyecto Kiva ya que muchas instituciones no querían creer en su sueño y le cerraban las puertas. Con la Fundación ahora su sueño es una realidad pudo comprar sus tres máquinas y ya empezó a confeccionar las primeras prendas. Con esto ella podrá crecer profesionalmente y sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Marlene is a 28 year-old woman who has a 5 year-old daughter.  They live in a rented house in the city of Santo Domingo, a very commercial zone with a pleasant climate. Marlene is a very hard-working woman. She has been a seamstress for the past ten years and has provided her services to a company that makes shirts. 

Now Marlene wants to set up her own shop and has approached Fundacion Alternativa because she doesn't have the money to buy sewing machines. She has a small amount of money saved up because this has been her dream for a long time, and bit by bit she has been able to scrape together this money. But it is not enough to buy the necessary machines for the shop. A loan has helped Marlene start up her new business. She is very happy and feels very grateful to Fundacion Alternativa and Kiva because many other institutions didn't believe in her dream and closed their doors to her.  Now, with the Fundacion, her dream is a reality and she was able to buy three machines and has already begun to make her first pieces of clothing. This will allow her to grow professionally and raise her family.

loans.use: to buy sewing machines to set up her workshop.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a 24-year-old single man. He describes himself to be honest, faithful and God fearing. He operates a retail business where he sells bread, beverages, washing soap, cooking oil, sugar, maize flour and other items. His business is located in a good place and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough stock. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock for his store. His business goal is to expand within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more stock for his general store

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en: Jamila is 36-year-old married lady and has run a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked she requested a loan for Rs 40,000 which she will use to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Jamila wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en: Abida is 28-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. For the past four years, Abida has been running business selling milk. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family when her husband was the only bread earner at that point in time. With the passage of time her sales increased and also her income. Now she has one buffalo and 6 cows. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. She has some savings and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is in her 6th loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
Bilal is a 34-year-old married father of two children, who has been running a convenience store for four years. His business is his only source of income, which is why he is investing deeply in it. Bilal wants to make sure it will develop properly in a well managed way to ensure it will cover his beloved family's needs and achieve sustainability.

Bilal is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, to increase his business merchandise with special offer products that will increase his income and develop his business. This is his third loan cycle from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, which will be targeted in a well managed plan. Bilal's precious loans were invested in the same sector, and they had a positive impact on his family's socioeconomic situation. He hopes to expand his business in the future by opening a wholesale trade sector.

loans.use: To increase his business merchandise with special offer products

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 22-year-old single young man from Jenin city. He lives with his family in a small simple house. Ahmad opened his own business recently which is a small coffee shop. He sells soft drinks and sandwiches. It is a good business and the only one in his area. Ahmad would like to improve his coffee shop. Ahmad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to expand his coffee shop by adding more chairs and tables. This will increase his income. Ahmad would like to take a bigger loan in the future and open another coffee shop. Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to expand his coffee shop by adding more chairs and tables.

loans.name: Xiomara Jackeline

texts.es:
La señora Xiomara de  33 años de edad, vive con su esposo, tiene dos  hijos  que depende de ella, vive en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras.
Doña Xiomara tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 03 años  a la elaboración  de uniformes escolares,  faldas, vestidos, blusas y pantalones, también vende cosméticos, es una persona luchadora con deseos de salir adelante.
Doña Xiomara está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra telas, hilos, agujas, etc.   ya que viene la época escolar y tiene bastante trabajo  y es por tal razón que desea comprar la materia prima. Su sueño es mejorar su casa y tener el mejor taller de costura de  la zona.

San Lorenzo, Honduras- Enero del 2014
texts.en:
Xiomara is 33 years old and lives with her husband. She has 2 children who depend on her. Xiomara lives in the community and valley of San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras.

Xiomara has her own house and for the last 3 years has been dedicated to making school uniforms, skirts, dresses, blouses and pants. Xiomara also sells cosmetics. She is a hard-working person and desires to get ahead.

Xiomara is requesting a loan to purchase cloth, thread, needles, etc., since it is the school season and she has lots of work. For that reason, she wishes to buy primary materials. Her dream is to improve her house and have the best dressmaking shop in the zone.

San Lorenzo, Honduras (January 2014)

loans.use: buy cloth, thread, needles, etc., for her dressmaking business.

loans.name: Yazan

texts.en:
Yazan is a single young man from Jenin. He lives with his family in a small simple house. His father is an employee in the public sector, earning a small income. Yazan is a student in a local university, studying Development and Institutions Management. He is a very smart student who would like to finish his studies and find a job to help his family with part of their expenses. 

Yazan took a USD loan from FATEN to help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Yazan will be able to do his homework and read articles online.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
SABOUGNOUMA est un groupe de l’association BENKOLA de COULOU. Il regroupe 4 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne  cinq enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiment à l’image de DJENEBA qui est la deuxième personne debout de la droite vers la gauche de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à Ouelessebougou dans la  préfecture de KATI (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a trois ans. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire. 
DJENEBA, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à OUELESSBOUGOU, excelle dans la vente de condiments. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de condiments alimentaires de différentes sortes (poivre, tomate, oignon, choux, et gombo séché.).  Elle s’approvisionne à BAMAKO auprès des grossistes  et effectue ses ventes à OUELESSEBOUGOU, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 45.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
SABOUGNOUMA is a group of the association BENKOLA de COULOU. It is composed of four women who know one another through ties of kinship and community. The women average 32 years of age. Married and having five children on average, they run different businesses, such as commerce in condiments, just like DJENEBA, who is the second persons standing from the right in the photo. The women live in large traditional families in Ouelessebougou, in Préfecture de KATI (Région de Koulikoro) in the Republic of Mali. They have been in small-scale commerce for several years and are much in demand for their work. 

Concerned about satisfying the growing needs of their customers, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program three years ago. They are in their fifth solidarity loan. DJENEBA, the group's president, is well-known in OUELESSBOUGOU. She excels in selling condiments. She intends to use her loan to purchase different types (black pepper, tomatoes, onions, cabbages, and dried okra). She gets her supplies in BAMAKO from wholesalers, and she makes her sales retail to a customer base composed of men and women paying in cash or on credit, in OUELESSEBOUGOU. She is hoping for a monthly profit of 45,000 francs CFA that will enable her to pay back the loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase condiments

loans.name: Saeedi

texts.en:
Saeedi has successfully built her general store with the help of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She has 10 years of experience in this field, and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income.  She is a mother of six children, and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. 

She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 50,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. 

Saeedi is expecting a boost in her earnings, and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en: Sakina, age 53, is a married woman. She has been running a business of selling milk with her husband. She sells milk to many of their neighbors along with butter and cheese that she makes from the milk. She makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. She is the mother of six children and needs to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, clothing and health. In order to make huge profits, she requested for a loan of Rs 40,000 to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers. She hopes to have increase in the production capacity of milk which ultimately helps in generating more cash. She is in her 4th loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en: Nusrat is a 53-year-old married woman and has three children. She is a vigorous lady and, for the past two years, has been a running business selling clothes. Nusrat buys clothes of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. Nusrat is requesting a loan of 40,000 PKR loan from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of clothes in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. Nusrat expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and she plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.  She is in her 6th loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en: Farzana is 32 years old and a married woman and mother of four children. The man shown in the photo is Farzana’s husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Farzana has applied for a loan of Rs 50,000, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Farzana is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
DJIGUIYA est un groupe de l’association BENKADI de DIANIKORO. Il regroupe 5 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne quatre enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de galettes et de condiments à l’image de MARIAM qui est la personne assise de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à DIANIKORO dans la  sous préfecture de Ouelessebougou (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire. 
MARIAM, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des condiments alimentaires de qualité(aubergines tomates, concentrée de tomate et du Sounbala).  Elle s’approvisionne à OUELESSEBOUGOU auprès des grossistes  et vend ses condiments à DIANIKORO, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 15.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
DJIGUIYA is a group of the association BENKADI de DIANIKORO. It is composed of five women who know one another through ties of kinship and community. The women average 36 years of age. Married and having four children on average, they run different businesses, such as commerce in cakes and condiments, just like MARIAM, who is the person sitting in the photo. The women live in large traditional families in DIANIKORO, in Sub-Préfecture de Ouelessebougou (Région de Koulikoro) in the Republic of Mali. They have been in small-scale commerce for several years and are much in demand for their work. 

Concerned about satisfying the growing needs of their customers, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program three years ago. They are in their third solidarity loan. 

MARIAM intends to use her loan to purchase some quality condiments (eggplants, tomatoes, tomato paste, and 'sounbala'). She gets her supplies from wholesalers in OUELESSEBOUGOU, and she sells her condiments retail to a customer base composed of men and women in DIANIKORO. She is hoping for a monthly profit of 15,000 francs CFA that will enable her to pay back the loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase condiments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy needed products for the family grocery store.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en: Khalida is a 42-year-old married woman and runs a business selling milk with her husband. She has two buffaloes and sells their milk to many of their neighbors, along with butter and cheese that she makes from the milk. She looks after the buffaloes and performs the task of collecting milk from them while her husband sells it to different places on daily basis. She is happily doing it to support their family. She has two children and needs to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, clothing and education. In order to make huge profits, she requested a loan of Rs 40,000 to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers. She hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 20-year-old single young man from Rafah city. He lives with his parents in a small simple house. 

He is a student in a local university where he studies art; he also works as a graphic designer. He makes internal home designs and advertisements and sells them upon client request. It is a good job, and he can earn some money to help him cover his study expenses, and also to help his family. 

Mahmoud took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him buy a new laptop for his graphic design business. By taking this loan, Mahmoud will be able to improve the quality of his work. 

Mahmoud appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his graphic design business.

loans.name: Lindah

texts.en:
Lindah is 37-year-old lady from the Kisumu region, which is located in western Kenya. She supports five people in her family, and is a married mother.

She has a retail shop, a business she has been doing for the last seven years.  She generates a monthly income of KES.15,000. 

She has applied for a loan with Vision Fund Kenya, which she will use to add more stock like sugar, salt and cooking oil. She will use the anticipated income to plow back into the business.

Her dream is become a stable business lady and support her family.

loans.use: To increase the stock of sugar, salt and cooking oil

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Luz, tiene 60 años, casada, vive con el esposo en la casa propio en el barrio Tierra Blanca donde ya viven 60 años pertenece a Atuntaqui, zona donde la mayoría de personas se dedican a la confección y tienen talleres donde elaboran prendas de vestir de diferente tipo de diseños que ofrecen en la provincia y en otras.
Luz, es comerciante de granos ya viene trabajando desde hace años, en su puesto que tiene en el mercado Amazonas, vende granos como: melloco, tomate, papas, ocas y entre otros productos que todo los días compra para vender, las compras los realiza en la provincia y los ofrece a variedades de clientes, tiene habilidad para vender primero los lava hasta dejarlos bien limpios y es así como tiene bien llamativo los productos que ofrece en el mercado. Luz aprendió esta actividad por iniciativa propia desde los 14 años de edad que los papas le llevaban a los mercados a realizar ventas por cantidades pequeñas es así como hasta el día de hoy sigue ejerciendo esta actividad del comercio de granos, ella empieza sus ventas desde las 6 am hasta las 6pm en el mercado, con el crédito que está solicitando en Fundación Alternativa lo va invertir para seguir comprando más mercadería, granos y seguir ofreciendo a mas personas e incrementar su puesto de ventas. Luz agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a KIVA por la oportunidad brindada y apoyo para cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Luz is 60-years old.  She is married and lives with her husband in her own home in the Tierra Blanca neighborhood.  They have lived there for 60 years.  The neighborhood is a part of Atuntaqui, an area where the majority of the people make their livings in fabrications.  They have workshops where they make clothing of different designs that are offered for sale in the province and other areas. 
Luz sells root vegetables.  She has been in this line of work for years.  From her stall in the Amazonas market she sells root vegetables such as: tubers, tomatoes, potatoes, ocas and other products.  Each day she purchases the items that she will sell. She makes her purchases in the province and offers them for sale to a variety of customers.  Luz is skilled in selling her merchandise.  She washes the items until they are very clean, and that is how she ends up with such striking products for the market.  Luz learned the business on her own initiative when she was 14-years old.  Her parents brought her to the markets to make small sales, and that is how she is still selling root vegetables today.  Luz sells her vegetables from 6:00am until 6:00pm at the market.  The loan she is requesting from Fundación Alternativa she will invest in continuing to purchase more merchandise and grains and to continue selling to more people and expanding her sales stall.  Luz is grateful to Fundación Alternativa and to KIVA for the opportunity they have offered and for the help in reaching her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase more grains and merchandise and to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is a 43-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, clothing, and education.  

Along with her husband, she has been doing agriculture work for many years. She grows different vegetables and fruits, and sells them in the local market.  She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. 

In order to purchase different types of seeds along with the packs of insecticides and pesticides, Shahida applied a loan of Rs. 45,000. 

This would help her to grow more crops, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds along with the packs of insecticides and pesticides.

loans.name: Diamond Group (B)

texts.en:
Fifty-three-year old Lamlhing is a widow and lives in a village which is far from the capital town of Manipur, which is one of the northeastern states in India. She is the featured profile member for the Diamond group (B). She and her son are pictured with their hands raised. Her husband left when her son was only two-and-one-half years old.

She started looking after her three sons on her own. She feeds them, sends them to school and manages her household needs for their day-to-day lives with a small sum of monthly pension salary. The monthly pension salary is her main income, and it was left by her late husband.  

Lamlhing faces a lot of difficulties in managing her children’s basic needs like clothes, a balanced diet and especially education. She could not pay her son’s monthly tuition fees on time, and usually purchases used textbooks from seniors for the new session. This is the main reason why she wants to avail this educational loan to pay for the admission fees, textbooks, stationery and other annual expenses for the year, and repay the loan. 

She says, “Thank you so much, Kiva.” The rest of the group members will also pay for their children’s educational expenses.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s admission fees, textbooks, stationery and other annual expenses for the year.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en:
Mumtaz is a 41-year-old married lady who has run a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family.

To restock her store fully Mumtaz is applying for a 45,000 PKR loan through Kashf which she will use to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing rate of demand consistently.

Mumtaz wishes to use part of her profits to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and flour to sell

loans.name: Arshad

texts.en: Arshad is a 41-year-old vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years with her son who is also shown in the photo. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of Rs. 40,000 from the Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors with the packs of laces, zippers, and buttons. With this she can create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her 4th loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors with the packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, 37, is married and lives with his family in Kagadi, Uganda. He has four children who all attend school.

Joseph’s passion for farming led him to start growing pineapples and raising pigs at his home to earn a daily income. He has done so for over ten years and with his earnings has been able to buy and raise cattle.

Joseph is applying for a 2,250,000 UGX loan through HOFOKAM to buy pineapple seedlings and piglets. With his profits he will pay for school fees for his children, among other things. He dreams of buying a vehicle to help him transport his stock to the city and build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy pineapple seedlings and piglets.

loans.name: Mayra Alejandra

texts.es:
Ella es mayra alejandra tiene   20  años,  se graduó  del  colegio Juan lozano  y lozano  en  el  año 2011, el sueño  de ella era estudiar contabilidad empezó  a cotizar en  varias universidades e institutos   pero  algunos eran muy caros,  en  otros  no hay  flexibilidad   de horarios   y  en  otras no había forma de pago mensual,   ella decidió  aplazar   el   sueño  de estudiar  lo  que más le gustaba,  duro  6  meses   trabajando  como  cajera, luego se retiro para  poder estudiar   pero  no  le alcanzaba el dinero  para  pagar   la  universidad,  Mayra consiguió trabajo  en  call  center  en  el área de cartera     ella se dio  cuenta    que   si  quería ser alguien importante tenía que   estudiar, Mayra conoció a una   amiga que   estudiaba en la   INSTITUCIÓN DE EDUCACIÓN  SUPERIOR  LAS MERCEDES   y  dio muy   buenas referencia   de esta institución, Mayra fue   y   averiguo las formas  de pago, los convenios, los horarios  y   lo más importante que  no  era tan  costosa  y  no  cobraban intereses muy altos. Mayra ingreso  a estudiar en  agosto  del  2013  primer semestre de técnico  profesional  en   contabilidad financiera  en el cual se sintió muy  cómoda y   aprendió muchas cosas ya que  los profesores eran muy  buenos  y  explicaban muy bien,   actual mente   está en  segundo  semestre, ella está muy agradecida con la  INSTITUCIÓN  DE EDUCACIÓN  SUPERIOR  LAS MERCEDES  ya  que esta la ha llenado  de muchos  conocimientos   y  así mismo se han  abierto muchas puertas  laboral mente. 
Mayra   en  el momento  necesita el  convenio  con  kiva  ya que  lleva más de un  mes   sin empleo ,  ella vive sola   y  tienes otros  gastos  más importantes pero  a   la  vez no  quiere dejar  de   estudiar  ya que   que quiere   convertir   el  sueño en  realidad  y  a la  vez   no  quiere dejar   de estudiar   en  la INSTITUCIÓN  DE EDUCACIÓN  SUPERIOR   LAS MERCEDES  ya que le ha parecido una buena  oportunidad   de estudiar allí  por   la facilidad   de   pago  y los   horarios  que  se   adaptan.
texts.en:
This is Mayra Alejandra. She is 20 years old and graduated from Juan Iozano y Iozano in 2011. Her dream is to study Accounting. She began inquiring at several universities and institutions but some were very expensive, others didn`t have a flexible schedule, and the rest didn't have monthly payment options. She decided to postpone her dream of studying for 6 months, which she wanted most, to work as a bank teller. Later she left to be able to study but she didn’t have the sufficient money to pay for university. Mayra continued working in a call centre in the area of banking. She realized that if she wanted to be someone important she had to study. Mayra knew a friend who studied in INSTITUCIÓN DE EDUCACIÓN SUPERIOR LAS MERCEDES (Institution of Higher Education Las Mercedes) and gave her high recommendations of this institution. Mayra went and inquired about payment options, agreements, and the schedules and most importantly that it wasn’t very costly and that they didn’t charge very high interest rates. Mayra enrolled to study in August 2013, first semester of professional technical of Financial Accounting in which she felt very comfortable and learned many things as the professors were very good and explained very well. Now she is in second semester. She is very grateful to the INSTITUCIÓN DE EDUCACIÓN SUPERIOR LAS MERCEDES as they have given her much knowledge and have opened many doors for job opportunities. 

At the moment, Mayra needs a loan from Kiva as she hasn't been working for a month. She lives alone and has other important expenses. She doesn't want to leave her studies as she wants to turn her dream into reality and she doesn't want to stop studying at the INSTITUCIÓN DE EDUCACIÓN SUPERIOR LAS MERCEDES as it is a good opportunity to study there because of the easy payment option and the schedule.

loans.use: to pay for a school semester.

loans.name: Khursheed

texts.en: Khursheed is a 43-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. The man shown in the photo is Khursheed’s husband, who is a driver by profession. He has been driving a three-wheeled rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses. The rickshaw now requires proper maintenance to keep it functional; therefore, Khursheed has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle to help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Khursheed is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Zohra

texts.en:
Zohra is a 39-year-old married woman. She is a responsible mother of two children who would like to earn more money to cover her family’s daily expenditures.

For many years Zohra has sold cooking spices. She buys them in bulk from wholesale markets and then resells them in packets of various sizes. She is known for providing good quality spices in her area and earns enough to support a decent life.

Zohra is applying for a 50,000 PKR loan though Kashf to buy salt, red chilies, black pepper and turmeric in bulk. She is in her seventh loan cycle and has repaid her loans successfully. She wishes to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy salt, red chilies, black pepper and turmeric in bulk.

loans.name: Gulzira

texts.ru:
Эту 29-летнюю студентку из района Вахш зовут Гулзира. Она разведена и живет с родителями. Гулзира учится заочно во втором курсе Государственного университета города Кургантюбе в факультете "Информатика". Она прилежная, старательная студентка, успевает и в учебе и на работе. Одновременно на протяжении года Гулзира работает в отделе образования ведущим специалистом. 
В этом году Гулзира еще не оплатила за учебу, так как ее собственных средств не хватает. Единственное решение она видит в получении кредита. Гулзира надеется на финансовую поддержку. Этот кредит ей очень важен для продолжения учебы в ВУЗе.
texts.en:
This 29-year-old student from Vakhsh is called Gulzira. She is divorced and lives with her parents. Gulzira is studying Informatics via a distance course at Kurgan-Tyube State University. She is a hardworking, diligent student and succeeds in both work and school. During the year she also works as a leading specialist in the education department.

Gulzira has not paid this year's tuition yet because she does not have enough money. The only solution she can see is to obtain a loan. She hopes for financial support. This loan is very important so she can continue her studies at the university.

loans.use: to pay for her studies at the university

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy all the raw materials, including textiles, needed for her sewing workshop.

loans.name: Kache

texts.en:
Kache, 35 years old, is married and has 5 children. She describes herself to be trustful and faithful. Kache operates a retail business where she sells bread, beverages, washing soap, cooking oil, sugar, and other items. Her business is located in a convenient and strategic place and her primary customers are regular customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of storage facilities. 

Kache will use this KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of bread, sugar, washing soap and other items she sells. Her business goal is to have a big shop that can operate 24 hours/day within 5 years. Kache hopes that, in the future, she will open other branches. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Kache repaid her previous loan of KES 20,000 successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to open a big shop.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bread, sugar, washing soap and other items

loans.name: Martha Yolanda

texts.es:
La Señora. Martha forman parte del grupo de crédito La Paz, vive por la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se encuentra rodeada de montañas gracias a su geografía accidentada, desde Diciembre de 1999 es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, cuenta con bellos lugares para visitar y disfrutar de la naturaleza, es cuna de grandes artistas, escritores y deportistas, su gente es amable, gentil y aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
La Señora. Martha tiene 24 años de edad, vive en unión libre y ha concebido una hija de 7 años que está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad, su esposo labora en un taller de mecánica, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive arrendando. 
Doña María tiene un taller de relojería donde vende, arregla y da mantenimiento a relojes de todo tipo, se dedica a su negocio tiempo completo y labora de domingo a domingo, esta actividad la aprendió trabajando. Este es su segundo crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de relojes para su negocio. Su meta es culminar sus estudios del colegio y llegar a tener una profesión en la universidad.
texts.en:
Martha is a member of the La Paz lending group and lives in Cuenca.  This city is surrounded by mountains, thanks to its accidental geography.  It has been a World Heritage Site since December, 1999 and has beautiful places to visit and enjoy nature.  It’s the crib of artists, authors, and sports figures.  It’s people are friendly, gentle, and keep their cultures and traditions.

Martha is 24 years old, is in a common law marriage, and has a seven year old daughter who attends the local school.  Her husband works in a mechanic shop.  They live in a rented home.

Maria has a clock shop where she sells, repairs, and maintains clocks of all types.  She works full time seven days a week and learned this by working.  This is her second loan and will use the money to buy clocks.  Her goal is to finish high school and work at the university.

loans.use: to buy clocks.

loans.name: Kosiya

texts.en: Kosiya, 40 years old, is a Ugandan married male living in Kagadi, Uganda. He operates a motorcycle transport service commonly known as bodaboda and he also generates income from selling produce. Kosiya faces challenges of competition from similar businesses and high motorcycle costs related to the poor roads. He hopes to buy another motorcycle for transportation. Kosiya has asked for a loan to buy maize and ground nuts to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and ground nuts to sell .

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy, 28 years old, is from Nakuru. She is married to Paul and they are blessed with three children aged 8 years, 3 years and 2 months old.

Nancy has been running her business selling items such as bed sheets and curtains for the last five years. She has applied for her first loan of KES 12,500 from VisionFund Kenya to enable her to buy a water storage tank. This will ensure that she spends most of her time running her business, thereby ensuring increased income. 

Nancy's monthly income right now is KES 6,000. She intends to use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to repay her loan to VisionFund Kenya, to educate her children and to expand her business. In the future, she hopes to be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: To buy a water storage tank

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen, 39 years old, has 3 children whose ages range from 10 to 26 years. She describes herself to be creative. For the past 10 years, Hellen has operated a retail business selling clothes. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are the general public. Hellen describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds to buy more stock. She will use this KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Hellen's business goal is to be successful within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will have improved standards of living. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi is a 20-year-old single young man from Jenin city. He lives with his family in a small house in the city. His father works as an employee in a local firm where he earns a very low income. Fadi has a small bakery store in the city. It is a good business but needs a lot of improvement.
 
Fadi took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new dough mixer for his bakery. This will increase his production and his income. Fadi would like to take a bigger loan in the future to expand his bakery store. 

Fadi appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new dough mixer for his bakery.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a 72-year-old married woman. She has two children who are 35 and 52 years old. She describes herself to be disciplined and humble. She operates a retail business where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for 30 years. Her business is located in a vibrant area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of funds. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more stock of fish. This is her seventh loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish

loans.name: Nazareth Group (A)

texts.en:
“I am so happy with Kiva and WSDS for this education loan,” says Vahjalhing delightfully. The joy it brings to the family, especially the parents, is immense, shares Vahjalhing, who is also the featured borrower for the group. She and her son are pictured with raised hands.
 
Vahjalhing lost her husband and she is a widow.  She weaves and generates income to feed her kids and manage other expenses. The income is insufficient to provide all the required educational materials. Her son is bright and focuses on his academic performance and achievement. The school head used to let him sit for the annual examination in the previous year, since she could not pay the monthly and annual examination fees on time.
With the help of the Kiva education loan, she will pay for her son's admission fees, textbooks & stationary and other annual expenses for the year. She hopes that this will bring a sense of confidence to her son and will enable her to avoid asking for money from moneylenders at high interest rates to pay for school expenses. She thanks Kiva and WSDS for the education loan support and for giving them a chance to give a better future for their kids, 
and says she will always remain grateful.

The rest of the group members will also pay for admission fees, textbooks & stationary and other necessary annual expenses. They are all thankful and wish to continue their relationship with Kiva and WSDS.

loans.use: To pay for admission fees, textbooks & other school expenses for the year.

loans.name: Raed

texts.en:
Raed is a 42-year-old married man from Gaza city. He is a father of three sons and one daughter. For the past eight years, Raed has been working as a farmer on his own land where he plants seasonal fruits and vegetables and sells them to the local traders. He uses greenhouses to insure he has good quality products. 

Raed took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy seeds, seedlings and fertilizers for his farm. By taking this loan, Raed will be able to improve his land and increase his productivity. 

Raed appears in the photo in his land

loans.use: to buy seeds, seedlings and fertilizers for his farm.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a married father of five children living in Kagadi, Uganda. He operates a mobile shop that sells shoes in nearby markets, and he also earns income from growing crops. His main challenges are seasonal changes and customers who don't pay on time.

Patrick intends to use this loan to buy more shoes to sell. He plans to construct a residential house, educate his children and expand his business into new market areas.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his grandson's school expenses.

loans.name: Gyoye

texts.en: Gyoye is a 30-year-old married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be innovative. He operates a retail business where he sells water. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be competition from other sellers. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more water storage containers so that he will be able to store more water to sell. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business further.

loans.use: to buy more water containers

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is a Ugandan woman aged 30 years.  She is married with three children and operates a boutique of second-hand clothes in Kagadi town to earn a living. She also does farming as her side source of income with the aim of looking after her family. She hopes to buy land for agriculture in future and educate her children to university despite being challenged by seasonal customers and high trading license fees.

 Robina intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Enedina Laury

texts.es:
San Miguel de los Bancos el Cantón del Amor lleno de gente amable y trabajadora un Cantón de clima cálido húmedo se encuentra ubicado al noroccidente dela provincia de Pichincha, el mismo que es muy visitado por turistas nacionales y extranjero a disfrutar de la gran variedad de flora y fauna silvestre uno de los lugares más visitado en la Parroquia de Mindo ahí contamos con muchas hosterías y hoteles de muy buena calidad en esta Parroquia vive y tiene el negocio la señora Enedina una mujer luchadora de 45 años es casada tiene una hija. 
Ella se dedica al negocio de la crianza de cerdos aprendió de esta actividad desde muy niña junto con sus padres ya que fue criada en una finca y ahí los papas tenían una pequeña granja de cerdos, trabaja un promedio de 10 horas diarias entre el negocio y el empleo que tiene en un hotel del sector. Solicita el préstamo para invertirlo en el negocio con el arreglará las chancheras y comprará más cerdos, con esta inversión espera mejorar su calidad de vida y obtener un mayor y mejor ingreso económico. 
La señora Enedina agradece a Fundación  Alternativa y a Kiva por el gran apoyo que le están brindando a ella y su familia.
texts.en:
San Miguel de los Bancos, also called the "Canton of Love", is filled with people who are friendly and hardworking.  It is a canton with a warm humid climate located in the northwest part of Pichincha Province.  It is heavily visited by both domestic and foreign tourists, who come to enjoy the great variety of wildlife.  One of the places most visited is the parish of Mindo, where there are very good quality inns and hotels.  

This is the parish in which Señora Enedina, a courageous woman, age 45, lives and has her business. She is married, and she has one daughter. Her business is raising pigs, an occupation that she learned from her parents when she was very young, as she was raised on a ranch where they had a small pig farm.  She works an average of ten hours daily, between the business and her job in an area hotel.

She is seeking a loan in order to invest it in the business; with it she will repair the pig pens and purchase more pigs. With this investment she hopes to improve her quality of life and earn more income. Señora Enedina thanks Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for the great support that they are providing for her and her family.

loans.use: to repair the pig pens and purchase more pigs.

loans.name: Bijaya Group

texts.en:
Saraswati  is the leader of a group that hails from M. Rampur village of Kalahandi district of Odisha, India. She is a married woman of 29 years of age.  The member standing third from the left in the front line with raised hand is Saraswati. She has done vegetable vending with the help of her husband for the last four years. Saraswati has a family of three members consisting of her husband and a daughter about four years old. Saraswati, along with eleven other members from her village formed a self-help group and applied for a loan from Mahashakti Foundation for expansion of their existing business. It is the first time the group will take a loan from MSF.

Out of their small income they are maintaining their family in a low profile. At present the monthly income of Saraswati is Rs.5,000 but still it is not sufficient to cater for the needs of her family. After learning the business procedure and such, she wants to increase the volume of her business. Now she wants a loan to purchase vegetables like brinjal, tomatoes, green chili, curly flower, bananas, drum sticks, cucumbers, pumpkins, etc. In future she wants to establish herself as a wholesaler of vegetables in her locality.  

The other 11 members of the group are Jasoda, Kantilata, Surya, Kumudini, Sabita, Tripura, Sashmita, jhunu, Sanjukta, Aruni and Kumari and they also want a loan for the development of their existing businesses such as betel shop, puffed rice, salon, fruit shop, seasonal business and vegetable vending.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables like brinjal, tomatoes, green chili, curly flower, bananas, drum sticks, cucumbers, pumpkins, etc

loans.name: Franco Dario

texts.es:
San Miguel de los Bancos el Cantón del Amor, un Cantón de clima cálido húmedo, el mismo cuenta varios sitios de descanso que son muy visitado por turistas nacionales y extranjeros se encuentra ubicado al noroccidente de la provincia de Pichincha muy cercano al mismo se encuentra el recinto pueblo nuevo las tradiciones del recinto son las festividades que cada año se realizan en honor a la virgen y el divino niño. 
En este recinto vive y tiene el negocio Franco, un joven luchador de 21 años el mantiene una sólida relación en unión libre actualmente no tienen hijos pero la esposa está embarazada ya pronto tendrán el primer hijo y su más grande deseo es darle una vida digna y con buenas oportunidades para su futuro; la esposa no trabaja pero le ayuda en el negocio que juntos lo crearon y día a día lo están sacando adelante. 
Tienen un negocio de comidas rápidas como son pinchos y maduros con queso asados a este negocio le dedican unas 6 horas diarias solo en las tardes este préstamo lo invertirán en adecuaciones del negocio para ofrecer un mejor servicio a los clientes, con esta inversión esperan mejorar sus ingresos económicos ya que podrán atraer más clientela. 
El joven Franco agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
San Miguel de los Bancos, the canton of love, is a canton with a warm climate. It has a number of vacation spots that are visited often by national and foreign tourists. It is located to the northwest of the province of Pichincha, very close to the same. The precinct of Pueblo Nuevo is located there; the precinct's traditions include the festivities each year in honor of the Virgin and the Divine Child. 

Franco lives and has his business in this precinct. He is a striving, 21-year-old young man who maintains a solid relationship in a common-law marriage. They do not currently have children but his wife is pregnant so they will have their first child soon. His greatest desire is to give his child a dignified life with good opportunities for the future. His wife is not working but she helps him with the business that they started together. They are getting ahead day by day. 

They have a business selling fast food like roasted meat skewers and sweet plantains with cheese. They dedicate six hours per day to this business, only in the afternoons. They will invest this loan in making adjustments to the business to offer a better service to their customers. They hope to improve their financial earnings with this investment, as they will be able to attract more customers.

Franco thanks Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for the support and the opportunity provided.

loans.use: to make adjustments to the business and to offer a better service to his customers.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent, 23 years old, is married and has two children, aged 7 years and 6 months, whom she supports. She has a grocery business located in Mjanaheri. Millicent has been in this business for three years and she earns a monthly income of KES 4,500.

This is Millicent's first loan. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to purchase vegetables and fruits to sell to her customers. Millicent was introduced to VISIONFUND KENYA by the Visionfund officer. She will use the profit to expand the business. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to expand her business and to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and fruits to sell to her customers

loans.name: Edison Israel

texts.es:
Edison, está casado tiene un hijo viven en el sector de Pucara Bajo, perteneciente a San Roque, tiene 24 años viven en casa propia que con esfuerzo lo realizaron, tiene un taller de servicio de maquilado a algunos clientes, maquila chompas, camisetas, licras, blusas, abrigos y otros. Vive en un sector agrícola donde la mayoría de personas se dedican a los sembríos zona de personas indígenas que hasta hoy día mantienen costumbres de cooperativismo entre ellos ayuda que se dan en todo momento cultura que no se ha perdido.
Edison, tiene experiencia por que años atrás trabajaba de empleado en un taller de costura en la ciudad de Atuntaqui donde obtuvo experiencia la que hoy viene ejerciendo en su propio taller que conformo con su esposa que también tiene experiencia en corte y confección porque en el colegio estudio esa actividad y los decidieron poner este negocio que a la presente fecha les va muy bien tiene clientes que llegan a dejar sus prendas para que les de el servicio de maquilado hay días que por el trabajo se desvelan para poder terminar el trabajo que tienen no tiene horario pero lo normal en sus horas de trabajo son de 10 horas, Edison se esfuerza todo los días para brindar todo lo mejor en su hogar y en su taller demostrando responsabilidad y cumplimiento en las tareas que les deja los clientes. Edison solicta el crédito para mejoramiento y ampliación de la vivienda y compra de materiales de construcción y poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Edison agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a KIVA por el apoyo y la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
Edison is married and has one child. They live in the Pucara Bajo area of San Roque. He is 24 years old and his hard work has allowed him to own the house where he lives. He has a sewing shop serving several customers: he assembles sweaters, t-shirts, tights, blouses, coats, and other items. He lives in a mainly agricultural area where most people work in local farms. Cooperation is customary among the indigenous people who live here. They always help each other and make sure their culture is not lost.

Edison has experience because years ago he used to work in a sewing shop in the city of Atuntaqui. There he gained the experience that enabled him to open his own shop. He set it up alongside his wife, who also has dressmaking experience because she learned the craft in school. They both decided to start this business and so far it is going very well. They have customers who come and drop off their items to be assembled. Some days they work very late in order to finish a job. They don't have a fixed schedule but their usual work day is ten hours. Edison works hard every day in order to provide for his family and to show customers his responsibility and reliability at work in his shop. 

Edison is requesting this loan to improve and expand his home and purchase construction materials so that he can offer his customers better service. Edison is grateful to Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for their support and the opportunity they are offering.

loans.use: to improve and expand his home and purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Dzame

texts.en: Dzame is a 30-year-old married woman who has two children. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a business where she transports customers using her motorcycle. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy spare parts, fuel and to expand her transport business. Her business goal is to own a taxi within five years. She will use the anticipated profits to buy another motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, fuel and expand her transport business

loans.name: Maqtari Group

texts.en:
The Maqtari group consists of four women who live in Hodeidah, Yemen. They have applied for a loan of 80,000 Yemeni Riel from AMB. 

Mariem, the group leader, is 37 years old and married. She has been working as a vendor selling food (chip fryer). She started her business with a small amount of capital and would now like to increase her sales volume. Mariem would like to spend her time selling more products in order to increase her profit and raise her children well. She has requested a second loan in order to purchase more stock, such as potatoes, cooking oil and flour, to use for her business. She hopes to expand her business to live comfortably with her family. She thanks Kiva lenders for funding her first loan.

loans.use: to purchase more stock, such as potatoes, cooking oil and flour, to use in her business

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
San Miguel de los Bancos el Cantón del Amor, un Cantón de clima cálido húmedo, el mismo cuenta varios sitios de descanso que son muy visitado por turistas nacionales y extranjeros se encuentra ubicado al noroccidente de la provincia de Pichincha aledaños a este Cantón tenemos varios recinto uno de ellos es el Recinto los Andes en el mismo tienen como tradición las festividades del Recinto que se realizan cada año lo festejan realizando deporte organizan encuentro deportivos invitando a todos los Recinto cercanos a este y también realizan baile popular para las entregas de premios a los ganadores de los encuentros deportivos.  
En este recinto vive tiene el negocio José un joven luchador de 23 años es casado tienen 2 hijas la primera de ellas tiene 5 años y la ultima tiene 3; el junto con su esposa se dedican a la ganadería a la producción de leche como fuente única de ingresos  para solventar todos los gastos y necesidades de su familia, aprendieron de esta actividad desde niños junto con sus padres ya que fueron criados en una fincas netamente ganaderas a esta actividad le dedican un promedio de 8 horas diarias José tuvo muchas dificultades en su vida como lo fue la falta de recursos lo que le impidió estudiar solo tiene primaria hoy en día se esfuerza para que sus hijas tengan lo que el no pudo. Este préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de más vacas productoras de leche para incrementar sus ingresos. 
José Agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el gran apoyo y la oportunidad brindada a él y su familia.
texts.en:
San Miguel is from the banks of the town of Amor, a town with a warm humid climate. It has several resting places that are highly visited by domestic and foreign tourists. It is located in the northwest of the province of Pichincha. Near this town they have several complexes. One of them is the Andes Campus that has a tradition of festivities each year, where they celebrate by playing sports they organize by inviting the surrounding towns. They also perform folk dances for the winners of the sporting events.

José lives in this town and has a business. José is a struggling 23 year-old youth. He is married and has two daughters. The eldest is 5 years old, the youngest is 3 years old. He, together with his wife, are in dairy production for a living as their only source of income to meet the expenses and needs of their family. They learned this trade from a young age together with their parents. They were raised on purely cattle raising farms doing this activity on average 8 hours a day. José had many difficulties in his life due to lack of resources that kept him from going to school. He only has his primary education and struggles today so that his daughters have what he did not. He will invest this loan in the purchase of more dairy cows to increase his income.
José is grateful to the Alternative Foundation and Kiva for the great support and the opportunity provided to himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy more dairy cows.

loans.name: Maria Emilia

texts.es:
La señora María de 65 años de edad es soltera, no tiene  hijos  que dependen de ella,  vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 13  años  al negocio de venta  ropa interior.
Doña María su venta es de forma ambulante también vende en las afueras del mercado nuevo de San Lorenzo, es una persona trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante.
Doña María está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de blúmeres, calcetines, braseares, etc. ya que tiene demanda y con el apoyo de este préstamo  pretende mejorar sus ingresos y de esa manera mejorar su calidad de vida.
 Doña María su sueño es mejorar  su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Enero del 2014
texts.en:
María is 65 years old and single. She does not have children who depend on her. She lives in a community of San Lorenzo in southern Honduras. She has a house of her own and has made a living from a business selling underwear for the last thirteen years. María sells her products in an itinerant fashion. She also sells her wares on the outskirts of the new market in San Lorenzo. She is a hard-working person with the desire to get ahead.

María is asking for the loan to buy underpants, socks, bras, etc., as she has a demand for these products. With the support of this loan she aims to improve her earnings and thus improve her quality of life. María's dream is to improve her house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - January 2014

loans.use: to buy underpants, socks, bras, etc., for her business

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from nine to sixteen years. She describes herself as honest and visionary. She operates a retail business where she sells groceries and potato chips. She has been involved in this business for 17 years. Her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as the lack of funds to buy more stock. 

Josephine will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a machine for processing potato chips. Her business goal is to have enough stock which will enable her fetch more profits within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will own a piece of land. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy a machine for processing potato chips

loans.name: Amal's Group

texts.en:
Amal is a member of this group from Iraq. Amal is 38 years old and single. She is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate additional income and help meet the financial needs of her family.
She has eight years of experience with her home-based sewing business. She sews dresses and shirts for women and children and fixes old clothes. Her customers are very thankful for her work quality.
She requested this loan to buy a new sewing machine and renovate her workplace. She is aiming to develop her business and increase her profits so that she may open a bigger business space and continue assisting her family with the additional income.
The story of Amal and her business is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona helping economic development clients.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and renovate her workplace.

loans.name: Nazareth (C) Group

texts.en:
A resident of a village in Manipur, which is one of the northeastern states in India, Lamtin is the featured profile member for the Nazareth (C) Group. She and her daughter are pictured with their hand raised. She is a widow and manages her expenses from her husband's small monthly pension.

Lamtin shares that “it is indeed a pleasure and opportunity for [a] single mother to avail this loan." Depending on meager income is difficult when you have other basic necessities to take care of. The headache of monthly fees is increased when annual exams are to be held. Paying the monthly fees on a regular basis is difficult for Lamtin. At the beginning of the year, she usually gets money from money lenders with high interest rates so that the kids don’t miss the session, which usually prevents her ability to pay the monthly fees again.

With the assistance of the Kiva education loan, Lamtin will pay for the annual expenses, textbooks, stationery, and admission fees. This is the first time that she will be able to provide all the materials required for the whole year, and she thanks Kiva for the help. The rest of the group members will also pay for their childrens' school expenses and says they are deeply honored and happy for this loan.

loans.use: to provide study materials and other necessary expenses for her daughter in pursuing her schooling, and give her a better future.

loans.name: Haragouri Group

texts.en:
Babita is a 24-year-old lady who lives in a small town called Bhatel of Kalahandi District, Odisha, India. She is the group leader of a 12-member group. Her family is comprised of three members, Babita, her husband, and a daughter of one year of age. The member sitting third from left in the front line with raised hand is the featured member, Babita. 

Babita has had a fish business with the support of her husband for the last five years in her locality. Her husband also supports her in purchasing and selling fish in the local market. She is a very active lady who wants to earn some extra income with her own efforts. At present her family income is about Rs.5,500 per month which is not sufficient to maintain her family.  It is the first time the group will access a loan from MSF. From the loan Babita will purchase a stock of fish for wholesaling.  

Regarding the other 11 members of the group, Chandrika, Manjari, Maina, Nira, Tilotamma,  Rebati, Mami, Dipanjali, Sushama, Ratra and Meena  also want a loan for the development of their existing businesses such as a bicycle parts and repair  shop, goat raising, a dried fish business, cloth shop, grocery shop, and vegetable vending.

loans.use: purchase a stock of fish for wholesaling

loans.name: Najah

texts.en:
Najah was born in 1961. She is married and a mother of three living in a sector of Jordan called Southern Ghour. Najah has been running her beauty salon for five years. She started her project selling a small amount of cosmetic products. Then she decided to expand it by opening her own beauty salon as she took a course in hair dressing. 

Now Najah needs to buy a skin cleaning machine and to purchase more cosmetic products in order to attract more customers and to raise her profit. However, she doesn't have enough capital to do so on her own. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy a skin cleaning machine and more cosmetic products for her salon

loans.name: Dancan

texts.en:
Dancan is a male Ugandan aged 20 years. He is single and lives in Kagadi, Uganda. He operates a motorcycle transport business to earn daily income alongside farming and produce-selling. He started this business to eradicate the poverty that had struck his family. He has hopes of expanding his business and buying land to construct a good residential house, but he is challenged by inadequate capital to fulfill his plans. 

Duncan is asking for a loan to buy a motorcycle for his transportation business.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy is married with children, and all of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business selling charcoal and has been in this business for a few years. 

Cissy has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She generates additional income from poultry farming. She works at the market six days out of every week and sells on both retail and wholesale. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to sell on wholesale only and to educate her children up to university. 

Cissy decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of the low interest charged and the offering of bridge loans. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is a 35-year-old married woman who has three children. She describes herself to be a determined and efficient person.

For the past five years Teresia has operated a beauty salon where she offers hairdressing services. Her salon is in a good spot in the marketplace, and she has regular customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of capital.

This will be Teresia’s second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully. She is now applying for a 50,000 KES loan to buy hair weaves, hair chemicals and other beauty products for use in her salon. Her business goal is to expand within five years.

Teresia’s ambition is to successfully expand her salon within five years. She will use her anticipated profits to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy hair weaves, hair chemicals and other beauty products

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha is 20 years old. She is a single lady living in a rented house in a sector of Jordan called Baqaa with her five siblings and her parents. Her father is a retired man who currently works as a bus driver, and her mother works at a governmental entity. 

Maha is a university student majoring in English Literature. She is in her third year and is planning to work in her field of study after graduation to start helping her parents financially. However, she doesn't have enough money to pay for her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Waad

texts.en:
Waad is twenty years old. He lives in a sector in Jordan called Irbid with his older brother and his parents. He is a second-year university student majoring in Finance.

Waad is planning to work in his field of study after graduation to start helping his family financially, but he doesn't have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester’s fees. Because of this he has applied for a 523 JOD loan through National Microfinance Bank to cover his tuition.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester's fees

loans.name: Maria Erlinda

texts.es:
La señora María de 71  años de edad, no  tiene hijos que dependan de ella, es madre soltera, tiene  casa propia, vive  en la comunidad  de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras.
Doña María se dedica desde hace muchos años  a la venta de abarrotería como ser: carnes, pollo, embutidos, granos básicos, lácteos,  detergentes, jabón, vende jugos, refrescos, etc. Es un cliente que ha luchado durante varios años casi toda su vida se ha dedicado  al comercio.
Doña María  también renta apartamentos es una persona trabajadora, está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de café, azúcar, frijoles, agua, jugos, aceite, pan,  refrescos, etc. con el apoyo de este préstamo  pretende mejorar sus ingresos, está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma es su cuarto préstamo que solicita y desea que su negocio crezca y también desea mejorar más su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Enero del 2014.
texts.en:
María is 71 years old. She is a single mother with no children depending on her. She has her own home and lives in the community of San Lorenzo, Valle, in southern Honduras. 

María has devoted many years to the sale of grocery items such as meat, chicken, sausages, basic grains, dairy products, detergents, soaps, juices, soft drinks, etc. She is a client who has struggled for many years as almost all of her life she has worked in commerce.

María also rents apartments. She is a hard working person. She is asking for a loan in order to buy coffee, sugar, beans, water, juices, oil, bread, soft drinks, etc. With the help of this loan she hopes to gain a higher income. She is very happy to continue with Prisma. This is her fourth loan and she hopes that her business grows and she also wants to improve her house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - January 2014

loans.use: to buy coffee, sugar, beans, water, juices, oil, bread, soft drinks, etc., for her business

loans.name: Banco Mujer Mujeres De Excelencia Group

texts.es:
Mariana  es una de las integrantes de Banco Mujer Mujeres de Excelencia, tiene 31 años, una hija menor de edad estudiante de primaria, ella es una mujer sola, ya que hace menos de un año murió su compañero y padre de su hija, en un trágico accidente. Pese a que esta atravesando momentos tan difíciles, no le impide trabajar y seguir luchando para salir adelante con su hija, que ahora están solas, y sin el ingreso económico que aportaba su compañero. Mariana como un ejemplo de lucha y positivismo está dedicada y su parcela donde desarrolla la cría y engorde de ganado lechero, cerdos de engorde, además de tener algunas hortalizas sembradas en las 4 hectáreas de terreno con las que cuenta.  Este financiamiento lo va a invertir en la compra de terneros y un cerdos, siendo la quinta solicitud de crédito que realiza, y los anteriores ha sido de gran ayuda para ella, ya que logró convertir su propiedad en una finca muy productiva y que ahora es la única fuente de ingresos para cubrir todo los gastos de ella y su hija. Mariana anhela continuar trabajando en su finca y hacerla más productiva, para tener estabilidad económica, además que su hija siga estudiando, sus sueños son muchos pero actualmente esas son sus prioridades. 
Junto a Mariana integran el grupo 4 socias más que van a invertir en actividades agropecuarias.
texts.en:
Mariana is one of the members of the "Mujeres de Excelencia" communal bank. She is 31 and a young daughter goes to primary school. She is a woman on her own, as less than a year ago, her companion, the father of her daughter, died in a tragic accident. Despite the fact she is going through difficult times, it doesn't prevent her from working and continuing to strive so that she and her daughter can get ahead in life. And now they are on their own, and without the income that her companion brought in.

Mariana is an example of striving and positive thinking and is devoted to the parcel of land where she carries out the raising and fattening of the milk cattle and the fattening of the pigs. In addition, she has some vegetables planted in the 4 hectares of land that she has. 

She is going to use this loan to purchase calves and a pig, this being the fifth loan request that she is making. The earlier ones were a great help to her, as she managed to convert her property into a very productive farm, which is now the only source of income to cover all the expenses for her and her daughter. 

Mariana wishes to continue working on her farm and making it more productive so that she can have economic stability. She also wants her daughter to continue going to school. She has many dreams, but at the moment, those are her priorities. 

Along with Mariana, the group is made up of four other members, who are going to invest in agricultural activities.

loans.use: To buy calves and a pig, as well as feed.

loans.name: Al-Farah Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Farah and consists of four ladies who live in Hodeidah, Yemen. The group has applied for a loan of 180,000 Yemeni Riel from AMB. 

Abtesam is 33 years old and a married woman who lives comfortably with three of her children in Hodeidah, Yemen. She is a hardworking hairdresser with strong ambitions to move forward in life and to be happy. She serves her customers with a very friendly and amenable manner to be able to increase her customer base. She describes her business as profitable, as it provides her with good earnings, and she is able to sell all her products. 

Due to her desire to generate her more income, she requested a loan from AMB to invest in buying a variety of cosmetic creams, shampoo, make-up, artificial hair and combs to use for her business.
