In the future, she dreams that her business will continue to provide income in order to help her family with the household income.

loans.use: to invest in buying a variety of cosmetic creams, shampoo, make-up, artificial hair and combs to use for her business.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a single mother of five children; two of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (old parents). 

She has a business of selling used clothes and has been in this business for eight years. She has applied for a loan of 1,700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO, partly to buy more bales of used clothes and also to buy cement for building rental rooms.  

She works at the market seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She is aspiring of owning a delivery van to ease in transportation and also to open up a retail shop. 

She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of the low interest charged. She resides in the family house, and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes and also to buy cement for building rental rooms.

loans.name: Massaran

texts.fr:
Née le 08/05/1982 à NOSSOMBOUGOU, cercle de KOLOKANI, MASSARAN vit avec ses 6 enfants chez son époux dans une famille nucléaire  à N’TENTOU dans la ville de  Ouelessebougou (REGION DE KOULIKORO, République du MALI). 
MASSARAN n’a pas eu la chance de progresser à l’école, très vite elle s’est intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa  grande sœur qui faisait le commerce d’articles divers. MASSARAN, après des années d’expériences  avec cette dernière, opta pour  les mêmes activités à savoir le commerce  d’articles divers.    
MASSARAN est à son premier  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter des produits alimentaires (céréales, huiles, lait en poudre et gingembre) et effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, à domicile, au marché et dans les foires  environnantes à une clientèle composés d’hommes et de femmes. 
MASSARAN espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en: Born on May 8, 1982 in Nossombougou, the district of Kolokani, Massaran lives with her husband and six children in a nuclear family in N'tentou, the town of Ouelessebougou (Koulikoro Region, the Republic of Mali). Massaran did not have a chance to go on with her studies. Early on she got involved in making a living, learning from her older sister, who used to work as a vendor selling miscellaneous articles. After several years of working with her sister, Massaran decided to go into the same business on her own. She is on her first loan with Soro Yiriwaso. Her loan will be used to buy food items (cereals, vegetable oil, milk powder and ginger). She sells retail, for cash and in credit, out of her home, at the local marketplace and on market days in the region, to a mixed clientele. Massaran hopes to earn a monthly income of 40,000 West African francs, which will be used to help her husband  with household expenses, repay her loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Nzai

texts.en:
Nzai is a 30-year-old man. He is married with four children, aged 9, 7, 5 and 3 years old, whom he supports. 

This is his first loan of KES 10,000. He was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by the VisionFund officer. He sells water, and his business is located at Marereni. He has been in this business for two years and earns a monthly income of KES 7,150.

He is planning to use the loan to purchase a plastic tank for his business. He will use the profit to expand the business. 

His hopes and dreams for the future are to expand his business and educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase a plastic tank for his business.

loans.name: Senia Yamileth

texts.es:
Senia de 35 años de edad,  es madre soltera de dos hijos, no tiene pareja, el mayor de sus hijos está estudiando educación media, vive con ellos su madre. Senia se dedica a comprar productos de primera necesidad, para luego ponerlos a la venta en su casa. También elabora antojitos, como tostadas y las sale a  vender y así realizar su pequeño negocio y obtener su ganancia.

El préstamo lo utilizara para la compra de productos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, sal, harina, entre otros productos.

Desea ampliar su negocio, para ver si obtiene más ganancias ayudar a sus hijos en el futuro, como hasta ahora.
texts.en:
Senia is 35 years old. She is a single mother of two children who live with her. Her oldest child has just started school. Senia makes a living by buying staple foods to sell from her home. She also makes snack like tostadas, which she goes out to sell. That is how she runs her small business and earns her income. 

Senia will use this loan to buy products such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, salt, flour, and other products. 

She wants to expand her business in order to see if she can obtain more income to help her children in the future as she has to this day.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, salt, flour, and other products.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 65 years old, single, and has five children. She describes herself as competent and creative. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes to sell, which she has been doing for 12 years. Her business is located in an area with many potential customers and her primary customers are her regular customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be seasonal changes. 

Elizabeth is requesting a loan from SMEP DTM for 20,000 KES, which she will use to buy fabric, threads, and other tailoring materials. Her business goal is to expand and be very profitable within five years. In the future, she hopes that she will have a stable business capable of earning more profits.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, threads, and other tailoring materials

loans.name: Geraldine Magalli

texts.es:
Geraldine Magalli tiene 45 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Pucará, una zona de calor donde la mayoría de población se dedica a la agricultura especialmente cultivo de arroz, frutales, cafeto y comercialización de los mismos, también se dedican a la ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica con la ayuda de su esposo a la agricultura, posee cultivos de arroz, junto a su familia se dedican a esta actividad desde hace 10 años, Geraldine ha solicitado un préstamo de 4 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos y adicionales para su cultivo de arroz y de esta manera tener una producción oportuna para ofrecer a sus clientes, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Geraldine Magalli is 45 years old. She lives together with her husband and their children in the district of Pucará, a warm zone where the majority of the population dedicates themselves to farming, especially to growing rice, fruit, and coffee; as well as selling these products. Many people also raise livestock. This district is located in the province of Jaén, which belongs to the Cajamarca region, in the Sierra Norte of Perú. 

Geraldine Magalli works, with the help of her husband, in agriculture. She has rice crops that her family has helped her to take care of for the past 10 years. Geraldine has requested a loan of 4,000 new Soles in order to buy fertilizers and other items to help cultivate her rice. In this way, she will have a good production to offer to her clients, generating more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other items for her rice crops.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Mujeres De Excelencia Group

texts.es:
Doña Janori es la lideresa del grupo Banco Mujer Mujeres de Excelencia, un grupo con mucha trayectoria y excelente conducta de pago. Compuesto por 5 socias que se dedican a las actividades agropecuarias.  
Doña Janori es casada por segunda vez, su primer esposo falleció estando ambos muy jóvenes, ella quedo con 4 niños pequeños en aquel entonces, pese a eso, y gracias a su valentía y dedicación sacó a sus hijos adelante, trabajo muy duro para darles el estudio, y lo sigue haciendo con su hijo menor del su segundo matrimonio. Con 56 años, y algunos problemas de salud ella no deja su actividad, se dedica a la cría y desarrollo de ganado lechero y vacuno, además en su parcela también tiene cultivo de hortalizas, tanto ella como su esposo trabajan con esmero en esa finca. Doña Yanori ya ha recibido 4 créditos anteriormente y han sido de gran ayuda para poder sus adquirir los animales y darle el cuido necesario a sus tierras. Esta nueva inversión será para la compra de terneros, y sus alimentos, así como otros insumos necesarios para el desarrollo del animal. Sus metas a corto y mediano plazo son mejorar sus condiciones de salud , tener la oportunidad de acceder a servicios de salud privado para mejorar su calidad de vida y seguir pagando los estudios de su hijo menor que inicia la secundaria, ya que sus hijos mayores ya concluyeron sus estudios  profesionales en sus diferentes aéreas.
texts.en:
Janori is the leader of the Banco Mujer Mujeres de Excelencia group. It is a group with a good trajectory and good payment behavior. It is made up of 5 members who work in different ranching and livestock activities. 
  
Janori is married for the second time. Her first husband died when they were both very young. She was left with 4 small children at that time. Despite this, and thanks to her bravery and dedication, she got her children ahead. She worked very hard to give them an education, and she continues to do so with her youngest son from her second marriage. At 56 years old, and with some health problems, she hasn't stopped her activity. She works raising and developing beef and dairy cattle. On her land parcel, she also grows vegetables. Both she and her husband work hard at the farm. Yanori has already received four loans before and they have been a big help to be able to acquire her animals and give her land the care it needs. This new investment will be to buy calves and their feed, as well as other materials necessary for the development of the animal. Her short and medium term goals are to improve her health, have the chance to access private health services to improve her quality of life, and keep paying for her youngest son's education. He is starting secondary school and her older children already finished their professional educations in different areas.

loans.use: to buy calves, their feed, and other materials necessary for the development of the animal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 27 year old married man. He has two children, aged five and two. He describes himself as innovative. He operates a business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a conducive environment and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be poor roads. He will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy motorcycle spare parts and fuel for his motorcycle. His business goal is to have other businesses within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be the greatest employer. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. A previous loan of KES 10,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts and fuel

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.es:
Gabriel es un hombre trabajador y servicial; que desde los 8 años de edad comenzó a trabajar, pues su familia no contaba con los recursos económicos para dar el sustento diario. A medida que fue creciendo en medio de las adversidades, siempre tenía en mente las ganas de salir adelante y luchaba para lograrlo. Actualmente, a sus 55 años de edad y con más de 47 años de experiencia en el campo del comercio ambulante, es propietario de su propio negocio que se encuentra ubicado en el centro de la ciudad, allí trabaja todos los días vendiendo bermudas, medias, camisetas, entre otros artículos y, de esta forma genera los recursos suficientes para aportar a la economía familiar.
El crédito solicitado será invertido en la compra de mercancía al por mayor (medias, camisas, camisetas, sudaderas, entre otros), así podrá satisfacer la demanda que incrementa en la temporada escolar y así mejorar las ventas y los ingresos que percibe.
Gabriel expresa la satisfacción que siente al realizar su actividad, pues le gusta estar en contacto con la gente, al mismo tiempo que genera los recursos para el sustento y lo único que desea es poder continuar con su labor hasta que Dios y su cuerpo lo permitan, mejorando poco a poco su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gabriel is a hardworking and attentive man. He started to work when he was 8 years old. His family didn't have the financial resources for their daily support. As he grew up amidst adversity he always wanted to get ahead and he fought to achieve this. Right now, at 55, and with more than 47 years of experience as a street vendor, he is the owner of his own business that is located in the city center. He works there every day selling bermuda shorts, socks, t-shirts and other items. In this way, he generates enough resources to contribute to the family finances.  

The loan he has asked for will be invested in buying merchandise wholesale (socks, shirts, t-shirts, sweatshirts, and more). This way, he will be able to meet the demand that increases in the school year and improve his sales and income.  

Gabriel says he feels satisfied when he does his activity, because he likes to be in contact with people. At the same time, he generates resources for support. The only thing he wants is to be able to continue as long as God and his body allow him, improving his quality of life little by little every day.

loans.use: to buy merchandise wholesale (socks, shirts, t-shirts, sweatshirts, and more).

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah is widowed with four children and two of her children go to school. She resides in her own house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.  She has a business of selling green bananas and has been in this business for six years. 

She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas. She works at the market seven days out of every week and sells on retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves.  

She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to build rental rooms. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because they are honest.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine  is married with four children and all her children go to school. She has a business selling tomatoes and has been in this business for 5 years. She has applied for a loan of UGX 1500000 to buy more boxes of tomatoes.  She generates additional income from rental houses. She sells at the market and has two people also who move door to door selling tomatoes and also work from home.  She sells both wholesale and retail seven days a week.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She is aspiring of buying a plot of land and start growing tomatoes and also to educate her children up to university. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees, paying for utility bills and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of tomatoes

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is a 28-year-old married woman. She has 2 children ages 7 and 9 years. She describes herself to be time conscious. She operates a restaurant where she sells cooked food. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are daily customers. She describes her biggest business challenge as the lack of capital. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy ingredients for making food to sell. Her business goal is to have an improved business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will create employment. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. A previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy ingredients for making food to sell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a 62-year-old married woman. She has 2 children aged 26 and 28 years. She describes herself to be creative. She operates a farm where she grows bananas to sell and also keeps dairy cows which produce milk to sell. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs and animal feed. Her business goal is to produce more products within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will achieve her goals. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy farm inputs and animal feed

loans.name: Eseza

texts.en:
Eseza is married with five children, all of whom go to school. She resides in a rented house; the family has no access to electricity or piped water. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees. 

Eseza has been in the charcoal selling business for 8 years. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She works at the market seven days a week and sells on a wholesale basis. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She aspires to own a delivery van to make transportation easier, and also to educate her children up to university level.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a married woman. She has 2 children aged 2 and 9. She describes herself as being God fearing. She operates a retail business where she sells spare parts for motor vehicles. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in an area with a ready market and her primary customers are local people who own motor vehicles. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds to buy more stock. She will use her KES 100,000 loan to buy more spare parts. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler of motorcycle spare parts within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 50,000 was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: buy more spare parts

loans.name: Harout

texts.en: Harout was born in 1974. He is married and a father of 4 living in a rented house in a sector in Jordan called Karak. Harout has been covering his family needs by running his vehicle repairs workshop which is his only source of income. Now he is wants to improve his workshop and to buy new vehicle parts for it. But he doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to improve his workshop and buy vehicle parts

loans.name: 09.02.7 Phú Sơn 3 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thắng has a service business shipping goods. She is requesting a loan to buy small taxi lorry to shipping goods.

Thắng is 40 years old and she is married with two children. She is the group leader of the 09.02.7 Phú Sơn 3 solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with her two dependents

In 2012, Thắng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thắng has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thắng has been involved in this business for five years and the main hardship she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thắng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to buy small taxi lorry to shipping goods

loans.name: Abdulbaqy

texts.en: Abdulbaqy is a 36 year-old married man who lives in Taiz,Yemen.  He has been running his own little business, a restaurant, for many years. His business is located in the middle of town and he is looking to increase the range of products he offers to his customers so that it becomes more pleasant for them to eat and drink in his business. He benefited from the first loan and intends to expand his business more. So, he took out second  loan of 200,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more products such as tables, chairs, foods and soft drinks for his business. In the future, he plans to expand his business and offer better services for his clients so that he can improve his living conditions. He thanks kiva lenders for financing him the first loan.

loans.use: to purchase more products such as tables, chairs, foods and soft drinks for his business.

loans.name: Yeng Ngoun's Group

texts.en:
Yeng, 52, is married and lives with her family in a village of the Ponhea Krek district, Cambodia. She has two sons to take care of, one of whom is too young for school while another one is in school. To make a living, she has been farming rice and growing cassava for years. The current business earns her family about 36,000 KHR per day. 

She has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back her previous loan. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to pay for land fees. She hopes to continue to grow cassava and rice, and sell them for a good price.

loans.use: to pay for land fees

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is single and has one child. She is 35 years old and lives in Poblacion 4, Clarin, Philippines.

Maricel is a farmer and grows banana crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for eight years. She has requested a loan to buy 25 sacks of fertilizers and other insecticides.

Maricel has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to save for consumption.

loans.use: to buy 25 sacks of fertilizers and other insecticides

loans.name: Revelita

texts.en:
Revelita is 45 years old and lives in Molave Zamboanga del Sur. She is married with three children.

Revelita has a pharmacy business and earns approximately PHP 15,000 each month doing this type of work. 

She has a requested a loan to pay for restocking medicines such as paracetamol, vitamins, etc..

Revelita has been a member of PMPC for four years. 

In the future, Revelita hopes to improve her business and build another pharmacy in other place.  This will help her, and will work well for the future of her children.

loans.use: to pay for restocking of medicines such as paracetamol, vitamins, etc..

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her tuition fee

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fee

loans.name: Senghou

texts.en:
Senghou, 32, is married living with her family in a village of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has one son. For the last 14 years, Senghou and her husband have been farming rice and working as garment workers. Together, they can earn about 45,000KHR per day from the current business. 

Senghou has been with VisionFund one cycle and completely paid back the past loan. She is now applying for a loan. Senghou is going to use her portion to pay for land fee for growing rice. She hopes to earn more crops so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to pay for land fee for growing rice

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Pacifica

texts.en:
Pacifica is a married woman and has two children. She describes herself as courageous. Pacifica operates a grocery store where she sells fruits. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a competitive area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge as lack of funds to buy more stock. 

Pacifica will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of fruits. Her business goal is to be reliable within five years. She hopes that in the future, her family will benefit from the business. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
This is Zenaida, 58, resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is married and she has children. She, together with her children, manage their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 
 
Zenaida operates a junk shop. Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines, and while waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic, paper and other materials. They sell these to junk shops for a little profit. Junk shops then stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries like factories and others of the like. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP12, 000 loan. She will be incorporating the loan on her current revolving fund used to buy recyclable materials from collectors.
 
Zenaida dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes to have a better living. She meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.
 
* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for recyclable materials from collectors.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fee

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more products for her business. Her loan also helped in the education of her children while her income from business is assisting their everyday household income. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs. 

She would like to apply for another 19,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marife dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is well-known for being a helpful and religious woman. She is earning a living by engaging in a piggery business. She has swine for the production of said business. She is 61 years old, single, and living in San Apolinario, Tangub City.

Helen is seeking a PHP 25,000 loan. She would like to use the loan to purchase house materials, for a house renovation. This is a regular loan. In her two previous loans, Helen has never had a delinquency. She is very diligent and loves accuracy, which only adds to the effective management of her activities.

loans.use: to buy house materials for a house renovation

location.town: San Apolinario, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Martín Emilio

texts.es:
Martín proviene de una familia campesina humilde, que se gana la vida labrando la tierra, cultivando diversos productos para generar recursos económicos. Aprendió todas las actividades del campo desde muy joven, gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre y sus hermanos mayores; esto le ha dado la experiencia y el conocimiento necesario para ser productivo de manera independiente, pues ahora posee un cultivo de café, cuya cosecha es recolectada y vendida en el mercado del pueblo donde reside, así ha generado los recursos suficientes para solventar los gastos del hogar durante los últimos 20 años.
Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para continuar con su labor y fortalecer sus cultivos, con el dinero comprará insumos agrícolas al por mayor (insecticidas, abonos, larvicidas, fertilizantes, entre otros), esto le ayudará a cuidar sus cultivos para lograr tener una cosecha mucho más productiva, lo que se reflejará en el incremento de sus ventas y la rentabilidad del negocio.
Martín posee terreno suficiente en la finca, por lo que sigue trabajando arduamente para lograr cumplir su objetivo de incrementar sus cultivos de café y así mejorar el margen de utilidades que recibe, abriendo paso para mejorar las condiciones de vida y el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Martín comes from a poor rural family that makes a living farming the land, growing a variety of products to bring in an income. He learned all about agricultural work from his father and older siblings when he was a boy; this has given him the experience and knowledge he needs to be an independent farmer. He has a coffee crop that he harvests and sells in the market of the town where he lives. His labor has enabled him to earn enough money to live on for the last 20 years.
He is currently applying for a loan to continue his work and improve his crops. He will use the money to buy agricultural supplies (insecticides, larvicides, fertilizers, etc.) at wholesale. That will help him take care of his crops and have a much better harvest, which will be reflected in increased sales and profitability.
Martín has enough land on the farm, so he is still working hard to achieve his goal of expanding his coffee crops and thereby increasing his profits, making it possible to offer his family a higher standard of living and increased well-being.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies (insecticides, larvicides, fertilizers, etc.) at wholesale.

loans.name: Adejanira Del Socorro

texts.es: Adejanira mayor de edad, con unión libre, y con un hijo menor de edad bajo su responsabilidad, originaría de uno de los municipios de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, Adejanira se caracteriza por ser una persona honesta, trabajadora y responsable con sus obligaciones, ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, perfumes y artículos para el hogar como:ropa, zapatos, productos plásticos, además los fines de semana destaza cerdos, también vende recargas; cuenta con clientes fijos y eventuales, los cuales da al contado y al crédito recuperando semanal o quincenal. Sus compras las realiza en mercados y comarcas de este municipio de Chinandega. Adejanira desde muy temprano comienza su jornada diaria el cual es de forma ambulante y en su casa de habitación, El objetivo de este financiamiento es para invertir en la compra de mercadería en general como: cosméticos, ropa, maquillajes entre otros.
texts.en: Adejanira is adult and lives with her life partner and one young son whom she is responsible for. She is from one of the Chinandega villages in the western part of the country. Adejanira is an honest, hardworking, conscientious person who fulfills her obligations. She sells cosmetics, perfumes, and domestic goods such as clothing, shoes, and plastic products. On the weekends she also butchers pigs and sells phone cards. She has regular and occasional clients, and they can pay cash or purchase on credit with a weekly or biweekly repayment schedule. She buys her merchandise in the markets around Chinandega. Adejanira starts her workday very early. She works on the street and out of her one-room house. With this loan, she plans to invest in buying more merchandise such as beauty products, clothing, and makeup.

loans.use: to invest in working capital such as plastic goods, cosmetics, clothing, and so on.

loans.name: Antony

texts.en: Antony is a 25-year-old man, single with no children whom he supports. This is his third loan of Ksh. 50,000. He was introduced to Visionfund Kenya by a Visionfund officer. He has a clothing shop,he has been in this business for three years and he earns a monthly income of Ksh. 20,000. He’s planning to use the loan to purchase new clothes to sell to his customers.  He will use the profit to buy a plot of land. His hope and dream for the future is to build rental houses.

loans.use: To purchase new clothes to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Miriam De Jesús

texts.es:
Miriam es una mujer emprendedora y activa, siempre ha luchado por el bienestar de sus padres y sus dos hijos. Durante su vida productiva se ha desempeñado en el área comercial, pues ha tenido sus propios negocios, entre ellos, tienda de abarrotes y cría de cerdos. Hoy en día se dedica de lleno a la cría y comercialización de cerdos, tiene las cocheras ubicadas en la casa donde reside, trabaja sola todos los días y esto le ha generado los recursos suficientes para sustentar las necesidades básicas del hogar y para educar a sus hijos.
Miriam ha encontrado en el crédito, una alternativa de apoyo para salir adelante, es por ello que solicita su sexto ciclo con el que comprará una cerda de cría y concentrado para alimentar los animales, esto le permitirá aumentar su producción y alimentar a los animales para luego vender los lechones  a un mejor precio, generando las utilidades necesarias para mejorar las condiciones de vida familiar, pues su principal propósito es luchar para que sus hijos sean profesionales y se forjen un futuro próspero y exitoso.
texts.en:
Miriam is an active, enterprising woman who has always fought for the well-being of her parents and her two children. She has had her own businesses, including a grocery store and a business raising pigs. Today she devotes herself exclusively to raising and selling pigs. She has the pens at her home and works every day by herself. She has been able to bring in enough money to provide her family's basic necessities and send her children to school.
These loans offer Miriam a means of support that helps her move forward in life. She is on her sixth loan cycle and will use the loan to buy a breeding sow and feed for the animals. This will allow her to increase the number of animals she has and feed them so that she can sell the piglets at a higher price. Increasing her income will enable her to improve her family's living conditions, and her main goal is to work hard so that her children can have good careers and prosperous, successful futures.

loans.use: to buy a breeding sow and feed for her animals.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 49 years old and a single mother of three children aged 25, 20 and 16 years old. She does farming in Kangundo where she grows cash crops such as maize, beans and vegetables to sell. She also has a grocery business beside her farming activity. 

She will be using this loan to buy seedlings and fertilizers for use in her farm to improve the harvest. She will use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to repay the loan and also save more.

This is her third loan term with VisionFund Kenya and her hopes in future are to build her own house and give her children the best education.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers for use in her farm to improve the harvest

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is 22 years old and was born into a family of 13. She is getting married next year. Constance is a successful entrepreneur who has been operating her own Zoona mobile money transfer business since January 2011 in the town of Chingola, Zambia.

Currently, Constance employs eight other people to work in the day-to-day operations of her business; she hopes to employ more people in the future as her business grows. Constance takes pride in her Zoona business and strives to create an atmosphere that is welcoming to her customers and keeps them coming back. She enjoys the opportunity that comes with being responsible for the success of her business. With Zoona’s platform, Constance says her business has the competitive advantage of being cheap, fast, and easier to use compared to other competitors. 

Upon receiving the loan, Constance plans to increase her working capital float to grow her mobile money business to serve more customers in her community who need financial services. Constance believes the increase in her working capital will bring additional profit and growth to her business. 

She is hopeful that as her business expands, it will enable her to finish her education, as she has enrolled part-time in school. Constance is thankful to the Kiva lenders for their continued support.

loans.use: to increase her working capital so that she can grow her mobile money transfer business.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey, a married man with eight children, operates a retail shop in the city outskirts. He ventured into selling daily household items because they were affordable. Also, there were many customers because residents in the area were travelling long distances to buy similar items. He supplements his income by selling bananas. However he faces a challenge of limited capital to stock all the items needed by his customers. He is hard working and resilient and appreciates the support of Kiva lenders through UGAFODE..

loans.use: To buy items to sell in his retail shop

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a long-time client of the UGAFODE Rukungiri branch. He is married with five children and two dependents who are orphans. He drives a taxi as his primary source of income and is a hard-working man.

So far Michael has received two loans from UGAFODE, which have enabled him to start building a small school. He is requesting this loan this to continue with the construction of the school and hopefully supplement his income when it is complete and operational. 
Michael has been able to build this school with the assistance of two previous loans from UGAFODE. He encourages the organization to continue supporting low-income earners because it has improved the living standards of many active poor Ugandans, especially in his home area. 
He is hopeful that when the school is complete he will be able to provide education to his community at a low cost, therefore contributing to the development of his home area.

loans.use: to buy more building materials for construction of his school

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy is 40 years old and lives in the town of Bugembe in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past seven years, Cissy has been working hard to manage her restaurant, which sells water, sodas, beers, juice, and cooking oil. 

To help expand the business, Cissy has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more water, sodas, beers, juice, and cooking oil, and will help Cissy to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her young siblings. Cissy hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business. 

Cissy is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Grace  who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more water, sodas, beers, juice, and cooking oil

loans.name: Aggrey

texts.en:
Aggrey is a 52-year-old man Kisumu county, married to Rose, who is a businesslady in the same county. They have two children, ages 17 and 12. 

He sells household goods like basins, buckets, etc a business he has done for the past 13 years, earning a monthly income of KES. 35,000.

He is taking his third loan of KES. 50,000 with VisionFund Kenya, which he intends to use to expand his business and to educate his children. The anticipated proceeds will be used to pay the loan, and add more share to VisionFund Kenya.  His dream is to bring up a stable family.

loans.use: to buy more bags to sell and use pay for his children school fees.

loans.name: Simeon

texts.en: Simeon is a 22-year-old man, with one 2-year-old child who he supports. This is his second loan of 20,000 KES and he was introduced to Visionfund Kenya by a Visionfund officer. Simeon has a motorcycle and a grocery business and he has been in this business for two years, earning a monthly income of 6,550 KES. He is planning to use this loan to buy vegetables and fruits to sell to his customers and the profit to expand his grocery business. His hopes and dreams for the future are to expand his business and educate his children.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and fruits to sell to his customers

loans.name: Arafat

texts.en:
Arafat is 31 years old. He is single and lives in Taiz, Yemen. He has been selling phone accessories, stereos and cosmetic materials, and has been involved in this kind of business since five years ago. 

He would like to ask for financial assistance so that he can meet the demands of his clients. Therefore, he took a second loan of 200,000 YER (Yemen rials) from Alamal Bank, which he will use to purchase phone accessories, stereos, perfumes and cosmetic materials to sell to his customers and to develop services for his business. He thanks Kiva lenders for financing the first loan.

loans.use: to purchase phone accessories, stereos, perfumes and cosmetic materials to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Gilvaz

texts.en:
Gilvas is a new client of UGAFODE Microfinance and a business man dealing in wine. He started making and selling wine in 2008 with high hopes that it would earn him enough income to cater for the needs of his family. He is a father of two children aged six and ten and he hopes to provide them both with a quality education using the profit he makes in the wine business. Gilvas also earns a salary from the school where he teaches. This forms his other source of income. 

Gilvas's wine business is located in a rural area, Igambiro, Katenga in Ruhinda-Mitooma District. His clients are mainly the wine traders of Bushenyi district. Gilvas also does banana farming to supplement his income and would like to use the loan to buy manure and mulch for his banana plantation so that the plantation can yield better bananas. Lack of capital is Gilvas’ main challenge but with the UGAFODE loan of 1,500,000 UGX, he hopes it will no longer be a challenge; he will grow the business to greater levels in the near future.

loans.use: To buy manure and mulches

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Apollo

texts.en:
Apollo is married with children and hails from Kizinga B, a part of Buyanja town parish in Buyanja, which is located in central-western Uganda. He is pictured here on the right with his wife and the UGAFODE Credit Officer.

Apollo grows coffee, bananas, tomatoes, beans and other cereals. Some of his challenges have been crop diseases, price fluctuations and limited capital.

Long a client with UGAFODE, Apollo is applying for an 800,000 UGX loan to give him the means to hire laborers, buy seeds, fight banana wilt and increase his crop production, among other things. He hopes that with increased production he will be able to buy more land and engage in real commercial agriculture.

loans.use: to hire laborers, buy seed, fight banana wilt and increase his crop production

loans.name: Walter Enrique

texts.es:
Walter, es casado, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 14 y 12 años de edad, aprendió de su padre a comercializar ganado y aves de corral, es algo que realiza desde muy joven, ya tiene 10 años de hacerlo de manera independiente.
Invertirá el crédito en la compra de ganado para engordarlo y luego venderlo a sus clientes, espera aumentar los ingresos y cancelar su deuda adquirida, pues así tendrá la facilidad de mejorar la vida familiar.
Sueña con llegar a tener una ganadería que sea más rentable para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Walter is married and lives with his wife and two children ages 14 and 12. From his father he learned to trade livestock and poultry, and it is something he has done from a young age. Now he has been doing it independently for 10 years.

He will invest the loan in buying cattle to fatten and then sell to his clients. He hopes to increase his income and pay off the acquired debt, and so it will be easy for him to improve his family life. He dreams of one day having a livestock raising business that would be more profitable, so he will continue working.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es:
José Santos tiene 62 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Cayalti, una comunidad que se caracteriza por sus valles ya que esta cerca a Zaña, su población se dedica a la agriocultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica al servicio de mantenimiento y soldadura de maquinaria pesada desde hace más de 15 años, tiene clientela en la zona, José ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de materiales para seguir realizando su trabajo y de esta manera poder atender a más clientes.
texts.en:
José Santos is 62 years old and lives together with his wife and children in the district of Cayalti, a community that is characterized by its valleys since it is close to Zaña. The inhabitants make a living in agriculture, commerce and cattle ranching. The district is located in the Chiclayo province, which is in Lambayeque region in the northern coast of Peru.

He has worked on the maintenance and soldering of heavy machinery since he was 15 years old. He has a clientele in the zone. José has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 2,000 nuevos soles to buy materials to continue doing his work and in this manner be able to serve to more customers.

loans.use: to buy soldering materials

loans.name: Luciana Martir

texts.es:
Luciana, es una persona dedicada a la venta de verduras y frutas,en determinados días de la semana elabora pan, ella es viuda, tiene dos hijos los cuales la apoyan en el negocio, su puesto está ubicado en el mercado municipal de su localidad, lo atiende de 5:00 a.m. hasta las 3:00 p.m., por el momento su negocio no representa ningún riesgo.
Invertirá el crédito en la compra de frutas y verduras, para mejorar la variedad de sus productos, así como también comprara algunas tablas para acomodar mejor su venta, le ayudará a fortalecer su negocio y atraer a más clientes.
Sueña con tener una mejor economía para instalar otra venta de frutas y verduras en su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Luciana is a person who works selling fruit and vegetables. On certain days of the week she makes bread. She is a widow and has two children, who help her with her business. She has a space in the municipal market of her town, which she attends to from 5:00 AM until 3:00 PM. There is currently no risk to her business.

She will invest the loan in the purchase of fruit and vegetables, to improve the variety of her products, and also in the purchase of some flat pieces of wood to better display her merchandise, which will help her to strengthen her business and attract more clients. She dreams of having a better economic situation so that she could also begin selling fruit and vegetables out of her home.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Jose Reyneri

texts.es:
José, se ha decidido por un nuevo crédito porque necesita capital para comprar insumos agrícolas para cultivar maíz y frijol, le ayudara a fortalecer el negocio una vez más.
Con la inversión anterior pudo tener una cosecha más abundante y de mucha calidad permitiéndole mejorar las circunstancias familiares y cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en: José has decided to request a new loan because he needs capital to buy agricultural supplies to cultivate corn and beans. The loan will help him to strengthen his business once again. With the prior investment he was able to have a more abundant and high quality harvest, permitting him to improve his family circumstances and to comply with his payment terms.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es:
Feliciana tiene 55 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Buenos Aires desde hace más de 20 años, una comunidad que se caracteriza por su clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morrope, que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella tiene una tienda en la casa de su suegra, donde ofrece venta de abarrotes y ropa por pedido, es una mujer emprendedora que junto a su esposo se esfuerza en la labor que realizan, están terminando de construir su casita para trasladarse a vive junto a su hijo.

Feliciana ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para darle los últimos acabados de su vivienda y cercar su corral para tener mayor seguridad donde vivir.
texts.en:
Feliciana is 55 years old and has lived with her husband and children in the district of Buenos Aires for more than 20 years. This community has a warm climate and its people work in agriculture, trade, and livestock production. It is located in the province of Morrope, which is part of the Piura region on the north coast of Peru.

She runs a store out of her mother-in-law's house, where she sells groceries and clothing on order. She is an entrepreneurial woman who, together with her husband, dedicates herself to her work. They are finishing building their little house, to move and live there with their son.

Feliciana has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 1000 PEN, to finish the last bits of construction on her house and to fence off her yard so that they can have a safer place to live.

loans.use: to do the final pieces of construction of her house and to fence off her yard, so she can be safer

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis tiene 55 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijo en su casa propia en el distrito de Buenos Aires, su población se dedica a la crianza de ganado, comercio y ventas de todo tipo, dicho distrito pertenece a la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la carga de hormigón y madera, desde hace 4 años la comercialización lo realiza a los constructores de la zona por lo que cuenta con clientela considerable, la carga del hormigón lo realiza de la extracción del río cercano a su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo de 4 000 nuevos soles para adquirir un caballo para la carga de sus materiales ya que las construcciones de viviendas son en los meses de enero a julio y de esta manera poder atender de manera oportuna la demanda de este material en esta época.
texts.en:
Luis is 55 years old and lives together with his wife and son in his own house in the district of Buenos Aires, whose inhabitants make a living through cattle ranching, commerce and sales of all types. This district belongs to Chiclayo province, which is in Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

He has made a living transporting concrete and wood for four years. He sells his services to constructors in the area and counts on a considerable clientele. He carries out the transportation of concrete from the river close to his district. 

He has requested a loan of 4,000 nuevos soles to acquire a horse for the transportation of his materials. Since housing construction largely occurs in the months of January to July, the loan will allow him to opportunely serve the demand for building material in this season.

loans.use: to buy a horse to transport construction materials

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 49 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada a dos horas de la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella tiene un restaurante donde se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace 15 años, por lo que tiene una clientela considerable por el exquisito sabor de sus platos preparados, Juanita como la conocen ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para la compra mesas y sillas para equipar a su restaurant y poder atender de una manera agradable a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Juana, 49, lives with her husband and children in the Oyotún area.  This area is two hours from the Chiclayo province, and belongs to the Lambayeque region on the northwestern coast of Peru.  Here, the people work in agriculture, commerce and livestock.

She has a restaurant where she has been selling food for 15 years.  As a result, she has a large customer base, thanks also to the delicious and tasty food that she offers.  ‘Juanita’, as she is known by the regulars, is asking for a loan of 500 nuevos soles to buy tables and chairs to furnish her restaurant and be able to serve her customers in a pleasant atmosphere.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs for the restaurant.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
Wilfredo tiene 42 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el caserío Ñuruñupe del distrito de San Felipe, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente a los cultivos de arroz, frutales y cafeto, comercio de los mismo y ganadería, ubicado en la Provincia de Jaén, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica junto a su esposa a la crianza y comercio de ganado vacuno, porcino, caprino, desde hace 10 años el comercio lo realiza en el Puerto Chiple que es el lugar donde se realizan las ventas de ganado menor y mayor, tmabien posee cultivos de pan llevar, son una familia emprendedora.

Wilfredo ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 200 nuevos soles para la compra de ganado vacuno menor para posteriormente ofrecerlo a un mayor precio a sus clientes, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Wilfredo, 42, lives with his wife and children in Ñuruñupe, San Felipe.  In this small village, the people work mostly in agriculture, especially growing rice, fruit trees and coffee plants.  The village is located in the Province of Jaén, in the Cajamarca region in the northern highlands of Peru.

Together with his wife, Wifredo takes care of livestock such as cattle, pigs and goats; a job he has been doing for ten years.  He sells in Puerto Chiple, the place where livestock is bought and sold.  In addition, he also offers staple foods which he grows.  They are a entrepreneurial family.

Wilfredo is asking for a loan of 1,200 nuevos soles to buy cattle, which he intends to sell on for a profit and in doing so, generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Lilian Azucena

texts.es:
La  señora Liliam  es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive  con su esposo e  hijos en el  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es  la venta   de ropa nueva  y servicio  de molino desde hace más de 6  años. 
Doña Liliam el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de camisas, blusas,  pantalones, calzonetas, etc. Con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más producto que ofrecer y atender mejor  a sus clientes. 
Doña Liliam espera cubrir las necesidades  que tiene y mejorar un poco su calidad  de vida y la de su familia. En unos años espera que su negocio siga  creciendo  y se convierta en una de  las pulperías más grande y reconocido de la zona y que sus hijos  se conviertan en personas de bien.


Choluteca, Honduras  – Enero   del   2014
texts.en:
Liliam is a responsible, hard-working and honest person.  She lives with her husband and children in the south of Honduras.  She sells new clothes and offers a milling service; which she has been doing for more than six years.

Liliam needs this loan to buy shirts, blouses, pants, shorts, etc.  With this loan she hopes to increase sales, as a result of having more products to offer and provide for her clients.

She hopes to be able to make ends meet and improve her quality of life and that of the family.  In the next few years, she would like to see her business continue to grow and become one of the most famous stores in the area.  Also, she wants her children to grow up to be decent and honest people.

loans.use: to buy shirts, blouses, pants, shorts, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Maria Elsi

texts.es:
María, se ha decidido por un nuevo crédito para comprar la materia prima necesaria para el negocio en está ocasión lo utilizara para comprar maíz, leña,  harina, quesillo, aceite, aderezos y bebidas, pues con el inicio del año escolar las venta de pupusas aumenta.
Con el crédito anterior pudo surtir el inventario lo suficiente para cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes, la venta de ropa le ayudo a tener ingresos extras,  ha podido cubrir los gastos de los estudios de sus hijas, de las cuales una ya hizo la apertura de su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Maria has decided to ask for a new loan to buy raw material which she needs for her business.  On this occasion, she will buy corn, firewood, flour, fresh cheese, oil, dressings and drinks; all of which are important because as the school year starts, the sales of stuffed tortillas increase.

With the last loan, she was able to stock up enough to satisfy her customer demand.  Clothes sales helped her to generate some extra income, which has allowed her to pay for her daughters’ studies.  One of them has now, as a result, opened up her own business.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, flour, fresh cheese, oil, dressings and drinks.

loans.name: Abel

texts.es:
Abel tiene 57 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Buenos Aires , una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon, que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza de ganado, también se dedican al cultivo de plátano, con la ayuda de su esposa tiene una bodeguita donde ofrecen productos de primera necesidad leche, huevos, arroz, azúcar entre otros, son una familia unida y emprendedora, Abel ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono para su cultivo de plátano y una segunda parte para la compra de variedad de abarrotes para ofrece a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Abel, 57, lives with his wife and children in Buenos Aires, in the Province of Morropon; which belongs to the Piura region on the northern coast of Peru.  Here, people mainly work in agriculture, commerce and livestock.

Abel raises livestock and also grows banana plants.  In addition, with the help of his wife, he also has a small grocery store where he sells everyday products such as milk, eggs, rice and sugar among others.  They are a united family and they are very business-minded.  

He is asking for a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles to buy compost to grow banana plants and also to buy a variety of groceries to offer his customers.

loans.use: to buy compost to grow bananas.

loans.name: Minata

texts.fr:
Née vers 1978 à NTENTOU,  MINATA vit avec ses quatre enfants et son époux dans une  famille traditionnelle dans la commune rurale de SELINGUE (région de SIKASSO). 
MINATA n’a pas eut la chance d’aller à l école,  très vite s’est  intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat vente des habits d’enfants et autres, MINATA est à son premier  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter, une quantité  importante d’habits auprès des grossistes à BAMAKO. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, à domicile, dans le marché SELINGUE et environnement à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
MINATA  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 65.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Born in 1978 in Ntentou, Minata lives with her four children and her husband in a traditional family in the rural community of Selingue (in the Sikasso region.) Minata did not have the chance to go to school, and quickly became interested in earning money, specifically through the purchase and sale of both children's and other clothing.

Minata is on her first loan with Soro Yiriwaso which she will use to purchase clothing in bulk from wholesalers in Bamako. She makes her sales for cash and credit at retail from her home and at the markets of Selingue and its surroundings. She sells to a customer base made up of both men and women. 

Minata hope to earn a monthly profit of 65,000 francs CFA which she will use to help her husband provide for their family's needs, to repay the loan, and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Michel

texts.fr:
Michel est un jeune de 28 ans qui a ouvert une quincaillerie pour vendre du matériel destiné à la construction de bâtiments. Son activité a vu le jour il y a six ans et Michel tire toutes ses ressources financières à travers la vente de ciment, portails, tôles, matériel de construction. L’histoire du partenariat entre Michel et Nafa Naana remonte en octobre 2013 où il a été démarché par un animateur de Nafa Naana pour voir la possibilité d’associer la vente de produits énergie tels que les foyers améliorés, les foyers à gaz et les lampes solaires. Amoureux des questions liées à la protection de l’environnement, après une formation dispensée par Nafa Naana sur la gestion, il décide d’acheter 13 foyers améliorés, 3 foyers à gaz et 12 lampes solaires qu’il vendra dans sa quincaillerie située dans le quartier Tengandogo de la ville de Ouagadougou capitale du Burkina Faso. Cependant, Michel est confronté à un problème de trésorerie qui ne lui permet pas de payer la somme de 265 150 FCFA qui correspond au montant de la facture. Pourtant les revenus générés par l’activité lui permettront de faire face aux dépenses de sa famille composée de sa femme et un enfant.
Les clients de son quartier et environnent bénéficieront de cette activité suite la diminution de la consommation en bois de chauffe dûe à l’utilisation des foyers améliorés et foyers à gaz. Ils auront en plus la possibilité d’éclairer leur maison grâce à l’utilisation des lampes solaires au détriment des lampes tempêtes ou lampes à piles qui sont des polluants de l’environnement.
texts.en:
Michel is a young 28-year-old man who opened a hardware store in order to sell supplies for building construction. His business is six years old and Michel had committed all of his financial resources to the sale of cement, gates, sheet metal, and construction materials. 

The partnership between Michel and Nafa Naana began in October 2013 when a Nafa Naana sponsor suggested the sale of energy products like improved stoves, gas stoves, and solar lamps. Being environmentally-conscious, after receiving some operational training from Nafa Naana, Michel decided to purchase 13 improved stoves, 3 gas stoves, and 12 solar lamps, which he would sell in his hardware store located in the Tengandogo neighborhood of the city of Ouagadougou, the capital of Burkina Faso.

As a result, Michel is faced with the financial issue of not being able to pay the bill of 265,150 francs CFA. Nevertheless, the profits generated by this business will allow him to provide for the expenses of his family, namely his wife and child. 

The customers in Michel's neighborhood will benefit from this business by decreasing their consumption of firewood from using improved stoves and gas stoves. They will additionally have the ability to light their homes thanks to the use of solar lamps instead of hurricane lamps or battery-powered lamps which a worse for the environment.

loans.use: to purchase and resell improved stoves, solar lamps, and gas stoves

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself as hopeful. He operates a welding business where he makes metallic items including tables and chairs, as well as offering other welding services. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in an area with potential and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. He will use this 60,000 KES loan to buy metal bars, sheets and other welding materials. His business goal is to be successful within five years. He will use the anticipated profits to improve his living standards and also expand his business.

loans.use: to buy metal bars, sheets and other welding materials.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a 38-year-old married woman. She has two children aged three years and six years. She describes herself as confident. She operates a beauty salon where she offers hair dressing services. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in an urban area and her primary customers are small scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of a permanent place for doing business. She will use the KES 25,000 loan to buy cosmetics and other beauty products for use in the salon. Her business goal is to excel within five years. She hopes that in the future, her life will be different. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and other beauty products

loans.name: Jack

texts.en: Jack is a 25-year-old married man. He has six children. He describes himself to be caring. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his tuk-tuk. He has been involved in this business for five years. His primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insecurity. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy spare parts for his tuk tuk. This will enable him to conduct his business smoothly. His business goal is to have a bus transport business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be happy. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his tuk-tuk.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les six femmes du groupe Benkadi sont mariées majoritairement  dans des ménages polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Benzana dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce de bois de chauffe et de mil. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3eme cycle du prêt solidaire. 
Madame Mariam (femme assise au bout à droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de galette dans le village de Benzana et environ. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 4 sacs de mil pour la satisfaction du besoin de sa clientèle. La galette qu’elle confectionne est vendue au comptant à la maison et au marché à une clientèle mixte. Madame Mariam espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20 000FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé dans la prise en charge des petits  besoins des enfants et aider aussi son mari.
texts.en:
Most of the six women in the Benkadi Group are married in polygamous families.  They are thirty-five years old, on average and have four children.  The women live in the village of Benzana, in the region of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  They know one another through neighbour, family and business links.

The members of the group are all small traders, buying and selling firewood and millet.  In order to increase their working capital, they work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, and this will be their third group loan.

Mariam (sitting on the right of the photo) is a successful seller of millet cakes in, and around, the village of Benzana.  She will use her loan to buy four sacks of millet to meet the demands of her customers.  She sells the cakes that she makes for cash, from her house or at the market, to a mixed clientele.

Mariam expects to earn a monthly average of 20,000 francs CFA, this will be used to help provide for her children and also help her husband.

loans.use: to buy millet to make cakes for sale.

loans.name: Fotemaban Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  femmes du groupe Fotemaban sont toutes mariées dans des ménages polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 40 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Benzana dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce de mil et de bois. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3eme cycle du prêt solidaire. 
Madame Djeliya (3ème femme debout de la droite vers la gauche dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de bois de chauffe dans le village de Benzana et environ. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  5 chargements de charrette en bois de chauffe pour  faire face à la demande des besoins de sa clientèle. La vente se fait au comptant à la maison et à Ségou à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. Madame Djeliya espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 10.000FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour les frais de scolarisation des enfants et aider aussi son mari.
texts.en:
The four women of the Fotemaban Group are all married in polygamous families.  They are forty years old, on average, and have five children.  The women live in the village of Benzana, in the Ségou region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  They know one another through neighbour, family and business links. 

The members of the group are small traders, buying and selling millet and wood.  In order to improve their working capital, the women work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, and this will be their third group loan.

Djeliya (standing second from the left in the photo) is a successful seller of firewood in, and around, the village of Benzana.  She will use her loan to buy five barrow-loads of firewood, to meet the demands of her customers.  She sells the wood for cash, from her home and in Ségou, to both men and women.  Djeliya expects to earn a monthly average of 10,000 francs CFA, and she will use her earnings to pay for the school fees of her children, and to help her husband.

loans.use: to buy firewood for resale.

loans.name: Tosheka Group

texts.fr: La Cliente  Regine est une brave commerçante, dynamique, entrepreneur depuis 10 ans est membre d’une Association d’Affaires « Tosheka», âgée de 58 ans, veuve et mère de 8 enfants, qui tous étudient. Elle est vendeuse de braises. Elle étale ses activités dans un marché central de la place. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son activité. Elle va acheter 12 sacs de braises. Elle bénéficia son premier capital par le truchement de sa famille biologique. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, en leur accordant de crédit sans garantie matérielle, pendant, ce moment post conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Regine is a courageous, dynamic entrepreneur with ten years' experience in selling charcoal.  She is a member of the business group 'Tosheka', and  is fifty-eight years old, widowed and mother to eight children, who all attend school. 

Regine sells her goods at a local market.  She has requested this loan in order to expand her business by buying twelve sacks of charcoal for resale.  Her first business capital was provided through her biological family.

In the future, she would like to improve her capital levels, and educate, clothe and feed her children.

Regine is grateful to the field partner, Hekima, for the support they offer to non-bankable, women entrepreneurs, with their non-guaranteed loans.  This is particularly important during the immediate post conflict period in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy 12 sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Susy Yamalie

texts.es:
Susy Yamalie tiene 23 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales como patos, gallinas, gallos, pollos, cerdos, desde hace más de 5 años, su esposo se dedica a las labores agricolas, tiene una hija que le acompaña en las labores que realiza, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y de esta manera, generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Susy Yamalie, 23, lives with her husband and her child in the district of Oyotún, where locals work in agriculture, commerce and with livestock. It is located two hours away from the city of Chiclayo, which belongs to Lambayeque, a region in the northern coast of Peru.

Susy Yamalie has been raising and selling animals such as ducks, hens, roosters, chickens and pigs for more than five years. Her husband works in agriculture. She has a daughter who stays by her side when she is working.

She has requested a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles [PEN] to buy balanced feed to fatten her animals and in this way generate a higher income for her family.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed to fatten her animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy natural medicine.

loans.name: Béatrice

texts.fr:
Béatrice domiciliée dans le quartier Karpala de la ville de Ouagadougou, est partenaire à Nafa Naana pour la distribution de produits énergie (foyers améliorés, foyers à gaz et lampes solaires) depuis l’année 2013. Elle a pu obtenir un prêt Kiva en 2013 qu’elle a utilisé comme fond de roulement durant l’année pour l’achat/vente des produits auprès de Nafa Naana. Béatrice a remboursé son premier prêt sans retard en respectant la durée de remboursement de six mois.
Rappelons qu’elle est âgée de 42 ans, mariée, mère de 3 enfants et participe aux dépenses de la famille.
Actuellement, Béatrice est confrontée à une augmentation de la demande des produits énergie, et elle voudrait augmenter ainsi son fond de roulement. Elle sollicite un  prêt d’un montant de 408 400 FCFA qui lui permettra d’augmenter son stock de 14 foyers améliorés, 8 foyers à gaz et 12 lampes solaires afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter. Elle pourra donc pérenniser son activité qui contribue fortement à la protection de l’environnement, à l’amélioration des revenus des ménages grâce aux économies réalisées en argent et en santé
texts.en:
Béatrice lives in the Karpala area of Ouagodougou, and has worked with Nafa Naana since 2013, to distribute energy efficient products (improved wood stoves, improved gas stoves and solar lamps).  In 2013, she obtained a Kiva loan which she used to launch her business, buying and selling Nafa Naana products.  Béatrice repaid her loan without delay and within the agreed repayment period of six months.

Béatrice is forty-two years old, married, has three children, and helps provide for the expenses of her family.  

She is currently faced with a rise in demand for energy efficient products, and would, therefore, like to increase her working capital.  She has requested a 408,400 franc CFA loan, which will enable her to increase her stock by 14 improved wood stoves, 8 improved gas stoves and 12 solar lamps.  This will allow her to satisfy the ever-increasing demand of her customers.  She will be able to continue her business activity, which is beneficial for the protection of the environment, and also beneficial for her customers due to the financial savings that are possible, and the improvement in their health.

loans.use: to resell improved gas stoves and improved woodstoves.

loans.name: Ana Eloisa

texts.es:
Ana, le gusta mucho las ventajas que tiene al hacer buen uso de los créditos, es por eso que está solicitando más capital para invertirlo en la compra de verduras y frutas, frescas, de calidad, para darlas un buen precio a sus clientes.
Con el crédito anterior Ana, compro la mercadería necesaria para fortalecer el negocio, tener a sus clientes satisfechos, mejorar sus ventas y tener una economía estable.
texts.en:
Ana likes the advantages of using the loans so she is requesting more capital to buy fresh, good-quality vegetables and fruits and sell them at a good price to her customers.

With the previous loan, Ana bought all she needed to strengthen her business, satisfy her customers, improve her sales and reach financial stability.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a 35 year old woman. She has 6 children. She describes herself to be industrious. She operates a retail business where she sells milk, bread, cooking fat, sugar and other items. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her business is located in a rural area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insecurity. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of milk, bread, cooking fat, sugar and other items. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more stock of milk, bread, cooking fat, sugar and other items.

loans.name: Ana Elsy

texts.es:
Ana, opta por otro crédito para fortalecer su negocio, en esta oportunidad comprara gas propano, maíz, leña y semilla de marañón por mayor para aprovechar la temporada y adquirirla a mejor precio.
El crédito anterior le dio los recursos económicos necesarios para fortalecer el inventario del negocio, con lo cual sus ventas aumentaron y sus ingresos son mejores, los cuales ha invertido en el pago de las cuotas y en cubrir los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Ana has decided to take out another loan in order to strengthen her business. On this occasion she will use it to buy propane gas, corn, firewood, and cashew seeds in bulk, in order to take advantage of the season and buy at a better price.

Ana's previous loan gave her enough capital to increase her stock. Her sales increased as a result, and her income is better. She invested this income in repaying her loan and covering household costs.

loans.use: to buy propane gas, corn, firewood, and cashew seeds in bulk.

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es:
