José, solicita  un nuevo crédito que utilizara en la compra de insumos agrícolas, pago de terreno en el que cultiva y en la recolección de la cosecha, espera entregar a tiempo su producto, mejorar la próxima cosecha y tener mejores ingresos.
EL crédito anterior le ayudo a tener una cosecha abundante, sin plagas y de mucha calidad, sus ventas aumentaron, sus ganancias han sido mejor y a podido cancelar sus deudas.
texts.en:
José is applying for another loan which he will use to buy farming supplies, to pay for land, and to bring in the harvest. He hopes to deliver his product on time, improve his next harvest and to have a higher income.

José's previous loan helped him to have an abundant harvest, free from diseases and of high quality. His sales and his profits increased and he was able to pay off his debts.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies, to pay for land, and to bring in the harvest.

loans.name: Aurolinda

texts.es:
Aurolinda tiene 36 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo, en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, que pertenece a las Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de animales menores desde hace 10 años, su esposo se dedica a las labores agrícolas, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de cerdos y alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y de esta manera ofrecer una mejor producción a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Aurolinda is 36 years old and lives with her husband in the Oyotún district, two hours from Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region of Peru's northern coast. The community here makes a living in farming, cattle raising, and running businesses.

Aurolinda has been making a living buying and selling young animals for ten years. Her husband works in farming. Aurolinda has applied for a loan of 2000 Nuevo Soles in order to buy pigs and feed to fatten up her animals. She can then offer better products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy feed to fatten up her animals.

loans.name: Fatimata

texts.fr:
Fatimata habite le quartier Pissy de la ville de Ouagadougou et y mène une activité d’achat/ vente de pagnes, de chaussure et de la layette pour bébés il y a six mois. Elle a 33 ans, est mariée et mère de deux enfants qui vont tous à l’école primaire. Elle veut profiter de sa clientèle composée de plus de femmes pour associer la vente de produits énergie (foyers améliorés, foyers à gaz et lampes solaires) afin de diversifier ses revenus pour améliorer son commerce et ses conditions de vie et celle de sa famille. Avec Nafa Naana, fournisseur de produits énergie, elle achètera 14 foyers améliorés, 3 foyers à gaz et 12 lampes solaires pour commencer l’activité de distribution. Nafa Naana est une entreprise sociale qui a pour mission de faciliter l’accès aux produits énergie pour améliorer les conditions de vie des populations au niveau du Burkina Faso. Elle dispose d’un réseau de distribution composés de boutiquiers, de femmes menant du petit commerce comme Fatimata. 

Le montant global de la facture est de 284 900 FCFA et Fatimata n’est pas à mesure de payer. Un prêt de ce montant lui permettra de démarrer l’activité afin de créer des revenus supplémentaires pour son commerce et de contribuer à la facilitation de la cuisine de ses coépouses du quartier, à l’amélioration de leur santé et à la protection de l’environnement
texts.en:
Fatimata lives in the Pissy district of the town of Ouagodougou and has been buying and selling "pagnes" (colorful pieces of fabric), shoes and babies' clothes for six months. She is 33 years old, married and mother to two children who are both at primary school. She would like to take advantage of her customer base, which is made up mainly of women, to sell energy products (enhanced fire burners, gas fires and solar lamps) so that she can diversify her income to improve her business, as well as her own and her family's living conditions. She will buy 14 enhanced fire burners, three gas fires and 12 solar lamps from Nafa Naana, an energy products' supplier, so that she can begin a retail business. Nafa Naana is a social company whose mission is to facilitate access to energy products in order to improve people's living conditions in Burkina Faso. It has a retail network of shop owners and women like Fatimata who have small businesses. 

The total amount of Fatimata's bill is 284,900FCFA, which she is unable to pay. A loan of this amount would enable her to begin her activity and generate additional income for her business and to contribute to her co-spouses' cooking, to the improvement of their health and the protection of the environment.

loans.use: to buy and resell 14 enhanced fire burners, three gas fires and 12 solar lamps.

loans.name: Luis Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 44 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposa se dedican a la venta de cuyes desde hace tres años, Miguel ocasionalmente realiza trabajos como maestro de construcción civil, son una familia que se esfuerza en la labor que realiza.

El ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de cuyes de raza para mejorar su producción de cuyes y de esta manera ofrecer a un mejor precio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Miguel is 44 years old and lives with his wife and children in the Cayaltí district, one hour away from the city of Chiclayo. Cayaltí is part of the Chiclayo province, in the Lambayeque region on Peru's northern coast. Here the people make a living in farming, raising cattle, and running businesses.

Alongside his wife, Miguel has been making a living selling guinea pigs for three years. Miguel occasionally does other jobs, such as building work. Miguel and his family put in a lot of effort in their work. 

Miguel has applied for a loan of 1000 Nuevo Soles in order to buy good quality guinea pigs in order to improve production. He can then offer his customers a better product.

loans.use: to buy good quality guinea pigs in order to improve production.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.fr:
Ibrahim est membre d’une association (ADPO) localisée dans le quartier Tampouy de la ville de Ouagadougou. Cette association dispose d’une convention avec Nafa Naana pour la distribution des produits énergie (foyers améliorés, foyers à gaz, lampes solaires) au sein de l’association. Ensuite, l’association a eu l’idée de mettre en place une boutique devant le siège pour permettre à tout le quartier de pouvoir accéder à ces produits qui réduisent la consommation en bois ou charbon de chauffe et qui protègent l’environnement suite à l’abandon des lampes tempête ou à piles polluants. 
Ibrahim, âgé de 44 ans et père de cinq enfants est le volontaire qui assurera la vente de ces produits économes devant la porte du local de l’association. Pour un début, Ibrahim, de commun accord avec l’association souhaite acheter 13 foyers améliorés, 3 foyers à gaz et 12 lampes solaires pour la vente. Le montant total de la facture délivrée par Nafa Naana s’élève à 265 125 FCFA. L’association n’étant pas à mesure de payer au comptant la facture, Ibrahim sollicite un prêt de ce montant pour pouvoir financer le démarrage de son activité. Il reconnait que cette activité contribuera à la protection de l’environnement, et lui permettra d’améliorer ses revenus et sa vie quotidienne en famille. Pour lui, ce n’est qu’un début car il envisage d’élargir sa gamme de produits et pérenniser l’activité
texts.en:
Ibrahim is a member of an association (ADPO) situated in the Tampouy district of the town of Ouagadougou. This association has an agreement with Nafa Naana to distribute energy products (energy efficient stoves, gas stoves, solar lamps) within the association. The association has subsequently had the idea of setting up a shop in front of its head office so that everyone in the district has access to these products which reduce the amount of wood or charcoal consumed and protect the environment, after the abandon of hurricane lamps and polluting batteries.

Ibrahim, who is 44 years old and father to five children, is the volunteer who sells these economic products in front of the association's office. To begin with, Ibrahim, in agreement with the association, would like to buy 13 energy efficient stoves, three gas stoves and 12 solar lamps to sell. The total amount of the bill he has from Nafa Naana is 265,125FCFA. Because the association cannot pay this bill in cash, Ibrahim is requesting a loan for this amount so he can fund the beginning of his business. He recognises that this business will contribute to the protection of the environment and will also allow him to increase his income and enhance his family's daily life. For him this is just a beginning because he is planning to expand the range of products he offers and make his business a lasting one.

loans.use: to buy and resell 13 energy efficient stoves, three gas stoves and 12 solar lamps.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be optimistic and hardworking. 

Dorothy operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in an urban and well populated area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenges to be theft and rain which affects business. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy an additional stock of clothes. 

Her business goal is to prosper within five years. She will use the anticipated profits to build a business stall.

loans.use: to buy an additional stock of clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock his business.

loans.name: Sarepta Group

texts.fr: La cliente Valérie est une commerçante, conseillère et membre du collectif d’affaires «Sarepta», entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 58 ans et mère de 5 enfants, qui tous étudient. Elle est vendeuse des divers produits d’alimentation. Elle installe sa marchandise dans une mini alimentation à son domicile dans un Quartier animé, où, elle a su gagner sa clientèle. Elle commença ses affaires avec le premier capital reçu de son mari. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Elle y a 6 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 3 sacs de farine de format,1 sac de sucre, 2 cartons du lait, 1 carton de vin, 3 cartons de jus, 2 cartons d’eau vive, 40 litres d’huile, etc. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie  fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des petits entrepreneurs exclus du système bancaire classique, surtout; pendant ce moment difficile post conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Valérie is a dynamic, entrepreneurial trader, a counsellor and a member of the business group 'Sarepta'.  She is fifty-eight years old and has five children who all attend school.  

She sells various food products from a small food shop in her busy local neighbourhood, and has built up a good customer base over her six years in business.  Valérie started her business with money provided by her husband, and has since worked with the field partner, Hekima.  

Valérie will use her loan to buy 3 sacks of wheatflour, 1 sack of sugar, 2 cartons of milk, 1 carton of wine, 3 cartons of juice, 2 cartons of fresh water and 40 litres of oil.  She hopes this will enable her to increase her working capital, and educate and feed her children.   

Finally, Valérie is very grateful to Hekima for encouraging the independence of small entrepreneurs who are excluded from the traditional banking system.  This is particularly important in this difficult, post-conflict time in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy 3 sacks of wheatflour,1 sack of sugar, 2 cartons of milk, 1 carton of wine, 3 cartons of juice, 2 cartons of fresh water and 40 litres of oil for resale.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is a 36-year-old married woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a retail business where she sells tea leaves. She also owns dairy cows which produce milk to sell. She has been involved in this business for 9 years. Her business is located in a rural area and her primary customers are small scale buyers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the dry season which reduces business performance. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more tea leaves. Her business goal is to be self sustaining within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will live a better life through her improved business. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. A previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more tea leaves.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Benkadi est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Médina Coura  qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 37 ans, sont mariées et au moins 3 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, des Habits, Légumes, Ustensiles de cuisine et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur Troisième prêt de groupe. 
Mariam debout en troisième position de la gauche vers la droite, est une vendeuse des ustensiles de cuisine : Marmites, Louches, Assiettes, Canaris Percés en aluminium etc. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des ustensiles. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché  et les vend au comptant à la maison et au marché à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Benkadi comptent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 120 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Mariam compte réaliser  140 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
Benkadi is a group of women from the Médina Coura neighbourhood.  They live in large traditional families with their husbands, children and other relatives.  The women are, on average, thirty-seven years old, married, and have at least three children.  They buy and sell various products such as clothing, vegetables and kitchen utensils.  To increase the size of their businesses, they work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, and this will be their third group loan.

Mariam (standing third from the left in the photo) sells kitchen utensils - cooking pots, ladles, dishes, aluminium colanders, etc. - and will use her loan to buy these items for resale.  She buys her supplies at the main market and sells them for cash, from her home and at the market, to a mixed clientele.

The other members of the group expect to earn a monthly average of 12,000 francs CFA each, but Mariam expects to earn 140,000 francs CFA.  They will use their earnings to repay their loans, provide for their personal expenses and increase their working capital.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils for resale.

loans.name: Jose Magdaleno

texts.es:
José, tiene una familia formada por 4 miembros, su compañera de vida, él y sus dos hijos de 13 y 16 años de edad, desde hace 25 años se dedica a la agricultura, es algo que aprendió de su padre, tiene un horario de trabajo de 8:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m.
Solicita capital para invertirlo en la compra de insecticidas, herbicidas, plaguicidas, abono y semilla, con lo que preparara la tierra y luego sembrar, espera aumentar su cosecha, mejorar su economía y cancelar su deuda.
Su objetivo es crecer en el área de cultivo para que su rentabilidad aumente y dar a sus hijos herramientas para que forjen un futuro con una educación superior de calidad.
texts.en:
José has a family consisting of 4 members: his partner, himself, and their two children, who are 13 and 16 years old. He has worked in agriculture for 25 years. He learnt this from his father and he works from 8:00 a. m. to 5:00 p. m. every day.

He asks for a loan to invest it in the purchase of insecticides, herbicides, pesticides, manure, and seeds. He needs these things to prepare the ground and to sow. He hopes to increase his harvest, to improve his financial situation, and to pay back his loan.

His goal is to improve his cultivation and by this to increase his profitability. He wants to give his children the tools to forge their own future with a high-quality education.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, herbicides, pesticides, manure, and seeds.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan, es casado, tienen 5 hijos, el vive junto a su familia, tiene la responsabilidad de trabajar muy duro para generar los ingresos  económicos con los que cubre los gastos familiares, su padre le enseño todo lo relacionado con la agricultura y lo apuesto en práctica desde hace  26 años, cultivo y venta de granos básicos también algunas legumbres, su horario es de 8:00 a.m. hasta las 5:00 p.m.
Invertirá en la compra de insumos agrícolas y pago de la recolección de la cosecha, espera acortar el tiempo en el que procesa sus productos, tener mayores ganancias con las cuales cubrirá sus compromisos económicos y mejorara su estilo de vida.
Espira a tener un negocio más rentable para aumentar los ingresos y con ello ofrecer a su familia un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Juan is married, he and his wife have 5 children and he lives together with his family. He has to work very hard in order to earn enough money to cover the expenses of the household. His father taught him everything related to agriculture and he has used his knowledge for 26 years. He plants and sells basic grains and also some legumes. He works form 8:00 a. m. to 5:00 p. m. every day.

He wants to invest in the purchase of agricultural supplies and to pay for help with the harvest. He hopes to shorten the time it takes to process his products and thus to increase his profit, which he will use to cover his financial obligations and to improve his living conditions.

He hopes to have a more profitable business in order to increase his income and by this to offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to pay for help with the harvest.

loans.name: Guillermo De La Cruz

texts.es:
Guillermo, vive en un ambiente familiar formado por su esposa y sus hijos, con el afán de tener los recursos económicos para cubrir las necesidades de su familia desde hace 6 años se dedica a cultivar maíz, como dificultad reconoce los cambios de clima.
Invertirá en el pago del arrendamiento de las tierras y compra de insumos agrícolas, con esta acción tendrá todo listo para efectuar la próxima siembra, le ayudara aumentar su producción y a tener granos de calidad para tener un aumento en sus ventas.
Su sueño es tener una mejor rentabilidad para comprar ganado y tener un negocio más fortalecido.
texts.en:
Guillermo lives with his family which consists of his wife and his children. With the aim of earning the income necessary to cover the expenses of the household, he has grown corn for 6 years. One of the problems he faces is the climate change.

He wants to invest the money in the lease for the land and in the purchase of agricultural supplies. By this he will have everything ready for the next planting. This will help him to increase his production, to get grains of a good quality and to increase in his sales.

It is his dream to increase his profits and by this to buy cattle and to have a stronger business.

loans.use: to pay for the lease for the land and to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Santos Samuel

texts.es:
Santos Samuel tiene 40 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el caserío de Huamachuco, una zona rural del distrito de Cañaris, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería ubicada en la Provincia de Ferreñafe que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica al cultivo de maíz desde hace 15 años, por lo que cuanta con experiencia en el rubro, junto a su esposa se esfuerzan en la labor que realizan, Santos ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono para su cultivo de maíz y pago de mano de obra de su cosecha y de esta manera tener una producción oportuna para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Santos Samuel is 40 years old. He lives with his wife and children in the village of Huamachuco in a rural area of the Cañaris district. This district is located in the province of Ferreñafe which belongs to the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru. The people there work mainly in agriculture, commerce and cattle raising. 

Santos has grown corn for 15 years and therefore has a lot of experience with this. He and his wife put a lot of effort into their work. Santos has asked for a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles to buy manure for his cultivation of corn and to pay for hired help for the harvest. By this he wants to be able to offer his products to his customers in a timely manner.

loans.use: to buy manure for his cultivation of corn.

loans.name: Jamiyla

texts.ru: Жамийле 38 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. Супруг и старшии сын работают в России в частной фирме по производству пластиковых окон и дверей, часть своей зарплаты высылают  в Кыргызстан. У Жамийлы - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Жамийла занимается животноводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Жамийлы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 40 овец. Все условия для содержания скота имеются. Корма и сено заготовлены. Жамийла также имеет земельный надел мерою 3,0 ГА, на котором ежегодно сажает фасоль для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жамийла обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота, также для увеличения ежемесячного дохода от продажи молочных продуктов. Доходы от кредита Жамийла планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового дома.
texts.en:
Jamiyla is 38 years old, married, and together with her husband is raising five children. Her husband and eldest son are working in Russia in a private firm for manufacturing plastic windows and doors, and part of their salaries are sent back to Kyrgyzstan. Jamiyla has a secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, Jamiyla raises livestock, having begun 20 years ago with a livestock purchase of 5,000 som KGS.

Thanks to her hard work, Jamiyla currently has on her homestead: one dairy cow and 40 sheep. They have all the conditions for tending livestock. The feed and hay are prepared. Jamiyla also has a plot of land measuring 3.0 hectares, on which annually she grows beans to sell. Monthly income amounts to 10,000 som (KGS). With the aim of further developing her homestead, Jamiyla applied to the bank Bai-Tushum for a loan - to buy cows for expanding her livestock count, and also to increase monthly income from the sale of dairy products.

Jamiyla plans to invest income from the loan in further propagation of the quantity of domestic animals, and plans to save money to build a new home.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her degree and postgraduate  courses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Makhira

texts.ru: Махира 54 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. Дочь замужем, старшии сын женат, самые младшие дети-школьники. У Махиры - высшее образование, работает преподавателем кыргызского языка и литературы в местной школе, имеет 20 летний педагогический стаж. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Махира занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 26 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Махиры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 теленок, 1 овца. Все условия для содержания скота имеются. Корма и сено заготовлены. Махира также имеет земельный надел мерою 2,80 ГА, на котором ежегодно сажает фасоль и клевер для внутрихозяйственного использования и реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 13,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Махира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота, также для увеличения ежемесячного дохода от продажи молочных продуктов. Доходы от кредита Махира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку бытовой техники.
texts.en:
Makhira is 54 years old, married, and together with her husband is raising four children. Her daughter and elder son are both married, and the younger children are in school. Makhira has a higher education. She works as a teacher of Kyrgyz language and literature in a local school, and has 20 years of pedagogical experience. As an additional source of income for her family, Makhira raises livestock and crops, having begun 26 years ago with a livestock purchase on 5,000 som KGS.

Thanks to her hard work, Makhira currently has on her homestead: one dairy cow, one calf, and one sheep. They have all the conditions for tending livestock. The feed and hay are prepared. Makhira also has a plot of land measuring 2.80 hectares, on which annually she grows beans and clover for on-farm use and sale. Monthly income amounts to 13,000 som (KGS). With the aim of further developing her homestead, Makhira applied to the bank Bai-Tushum for a loan - to purchase cows for expanding her livestock count, and also for increasing monthly income from the sale of dairy products.

Makhira plans to invest income from the loan in further propagation of the quantity of domestic animals, and plans to save money to buy appliances.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Kanchaiym

texts.ru: Канчайым 58 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 7 детей. Канчайым вместе с супругом гордятся своими детьми, так как они им дали достойное воспитание, дочери все замужем, с родителями проживает младший сын со своей супругой. У Канчайым - средне-специальное образование, окончила медицинское училище по специальности медсестра. Свою трудовую деятельность начала в 1973 году, работала в местной больнице медсестрой. Сейчас вместе с супругом на заслуженной пенсии. Канчайым оптимистично идет по жизни, знает конкретно чего хочет и добивается всего своими силами. Канчайым знает как правильно использовать и планировать денежные средства для достижения поставленных целей. Канчайым сидя на пенсии в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 4 года назад, с покупки скота на 30,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Канчайым, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 5 овец и 2 лошади. Для содержания скота имеются все условия: сарай для содержания скота, отгонные пастбища. Дойных коров содержит круглогодично дома, присматривают сами, а овец с марта по октябрь месяцы ежегодно выгоняет на пастбища чабану. Сено и корма для скота заготовлены в достаточном количестве, также имеет небольшой земельный надел мерою 2,50 ГА, на котором ежегодно сажает картофель и фасоль для внутрихозяйственного использования и реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 18,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Канчайым обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум"  за кредитом -на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Канчайым планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Kanchaiym is 58 years old, married, and together with her spouse is raising seven children. Kanchaiym and her husband are proud of their children, since they gave them a sufficient education, all their daughters are married, and their youngest son and his wife live with them.

Kanchaiym has a specialized secondary education, having graduated from medical school with a nursing specialization. Her work activity began in 1973 and she worked in a local hospital as a nurse. Now, along with her husband she is retired. Kanchaiym goes through life optimistically, knows concretely what she wants and achieves it all with her own strengths. Kanchaiym knows how to correctly use and budget monetary resources to achieve her goals. Kanchaiym is sitting on a pension and, as a main source of income for her family, raises livestock and crops, having begun four years ago with a livestock purchase of 30,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Kanchaiym currently has on her homestead: one dairy cow, five sheep and two horses. They have all the conditions for caring for livestock: a barn for keeping the livestock, remote pastures. The dairy cows are kept year-round at home, and care for themselves, but the sheep from March to October every year are sent off to remote pastures. The hay and feed for the livestock are prepared in sufficient quantities. They also have a small plot of land measuring 2.50 hectares, on which annually she grows potatoes and beans for on-farm use and sale. Monthly income amounts to 18,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing her homestead, Kanchaiym applied to the bank Bai-Tushum for a loan - to buy cows for increasing the livestock count. Kanchaiym plans to invest income from the loan in further propagation of the quantity of domestic animals, and plans to save money for home repairs.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Makhkhabat

texts.ru: Маххабат 43 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 дочек, самая старшая дочь-замужем, самой младшей дочери 1 год. У Маххабат - среднее образование, она домохозяйка. Работая многие годы в колхозе впитывала в себе добросовестность, трудолюбие и пунктуальность. По характеру Маххабат целеустремленная, трудолюбивая и ответственная. После развала Советского Союза и получив земельный надел, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Маххабат вместе со своей семьей начала заниматься животноводством и полеводством, с 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Маххабат, на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова с теленком, а также обрабатывает 1,45 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает фасоль для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Маххабат обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом - на покупку семян фасоли для посевных работ. Доходы от кредита Маххабат планирует вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового дома.
texts.en:
Makhkhabat is 43 years old, married, and together with her spouse is bringing up four daughters. Only the eldest daughter is married and the youngest daughter is one year old. Makhkhabat has a secondary education. She is a homemaker.

Working for many years on a collective farm, she absorbed good faith, diligence and punctuality. By character, Makhkhabat is determined, hardworking and responsible. After the fall of the Soviet Union, she also received a land allotment. As a main source of income for her family, Makhkhabat and her family began raising livestock and crops with 10,000 som KGS.

Thanks to her hard work, Makhkhabat currently has one dairy cow with calf, and also works 1.45 hectares of land, on which annually she grows beans to sell. Monthly income amounts to 12,000 som (KGS). With the aim of further developing her homestead, Makhkhabat applied to the bank Bai-Tushum for a loan - to purchase bean seeds for sowing.

Makhkhabat plans to invest income from the loan in propagating the quantity of domestic animals, and plans to save money for building a new home.

loans.use: to buy bean seeds

loans.name: Gonzalo Natividad

texts.es:
Gonzalo, vive junto a su familia, es casado, tiene tres hijos de 18, 8 y un año de edad, no tiene familia en el extranjero, su actividad económica es atender su taller mecánico de automóviles, una de sus ventajas es que el negocio lo tiene en su casa de habitación, aunque también una pequeña dificultad es que en la ciudad donde reside no hay muchos vehículos.
Utilizara el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de sensores, bujías, aceites, cables, etc., entre otro tipo de repuestos para surtir el negocio y dar un buen servicio, espera  fortalecer el negocio, atraer nuevos clientes de las zonas cercanas, aumentar sus ganancias para cumplir con los diferentes tipos de compromisos que posee.
El sueño de Gonzalo es tener un negocio más rentable para salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Gonzalo lives with his family.  He is married and has three children ages 18, 8 and 1 year-old.  He does not have family outside of the country.  He works in his auto repair shop.  One of his advantages is that his business is located in his home.  His one small challenge is that the city that he lives in does not have many vehicles.  

He will use the loan to purchase sensors, spark plugs, oils, cables, and other types of replacement parts to stock his business and provide better service.  He hopes to strengthen his business, attract new customers from neighboring areas, and increase his earnings to meet the different expenses that he has.  Gonzalo's dream is to have a more profitable business so that him and his family can get ahead.

loans.use: purchase sensors, spark plugs, oils, cables, etc...

loans.name: Juana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Juana, opta por otro crédito para comprar variedad de mariscos y productos de revistas, tales como talcos, cremas, cosméticos, lociones, etc., para continuar ofreciendo productos frescos y de calidad a sus clientes, lo cual le ayuda a fortalecer su negocio día con día. 
Con la ayuda del crédito anterior tuvo a su disposición los productos necesarios para mejorar sus ventas, tener buenas ganancias, Juana continua trabajando duro para lograr construir su propia casa.
texts.en: Juana is seeking another loan to purchase a variety of seafood and products from catalogs such as: talcs, creams, cosmetics, lotions, etc., to continue offering fresh, quality products to her customers.  This will allow her to strengthen her business day by day.  With the help of her previous loan, she was able to acquire the necessary products to improve her sales and her earnings.  Juana continues to work hard to reach her dream of building her own home.

loans.use: purchase a variety of seafood and products from catalogs.

loans.name: Vilma Gloria

texts.es:
Vilma, ha notado que su negocio está más prospero y sus productos se venden con mayor rapidez, es por eso que solicita un nuevo crédito para surtir la tienda comprara bebidas, pan, dulces, galletas, granos básicos, pastas, etc., para continuar satisfaciendo las peticiones de sus clientes.
Con el Capital anterior fortaleció el negocio lo necesario dándole como resultado mejores ventas, mayores ganancias, las que ha utilizado para cancelar sus deudas y mejorar el estilo de vida anterior.
texts.en:
Vilma has noticed that her business is more prosperous and her products have been selling much quicker.  For this reason, she is seeking a new loan to stock her business with beverages, bread, candy, cookies, basic grains, pasta, etc..., to continue meeting her customers' demand.  

With the previous loan, she was able to strengthen her business, which improved her sales and earnings.  She has used her earnings to pay off her debts and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: purchase beverages, bread, candy, cookies, basic grains, pasta, etc...

loans.name: Savoeurn

texts.en:
Savoeurn lives in a village about 18 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She is asking for a loan in order to repair the house where she lives. Because the house is old and is broken in some parts, she needs to fix it. 

Savoeurn is a gardener alongside her husband. They commute to work by driving their own motorbike. 

Photo: Savoeurn is pictured at her neighbor’s home.

loans.use: to repair the house where she lives

loans.name: Kotognontala Group

texts.fr:
Kotognontala est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Darsalam1 qui se connaissent bien et  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 42 ans, sont mariées et ont au moins 5 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, des Habits, Jus, Savon, Tasses, Assiettes en Plastique. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur sixième prêt de groupe. 
Salimata  qui est un membre du groupe Kotognontala, première assise  à gauche, est une vendeuse de boisson, jus d’orange, jus de bissap. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des oranges du lait en poudre, du bissap et du sucre enfin de les transformer en boisson. Elle se procure de ces fruits au grand marché  de Koutiala. Elle vend ses boissons bien glacées au comptant à la maison et au marché à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Kotognontala comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 164 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Salimata compte réaliser  155 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
Kotognontala is a group of women from the Darsalam1 district who know each other very well, living in large traditional families with their husbands, children, and other relatives. The women average 42 years of age, are married, and have at least five children. This group of women does commerce in a variety of goods, such as clothing, juice drinks, soap, basins, and plastic plates.

To expand their businesses, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. They are on their sixth group loan. Salimata, who is a member of the group Kotognontala, is the first one sitting at the left. She is a vendor of beverages, orange juice and bissap juice. She intends to use her loan to purchase oranges, powdered milk, bissap [dried hibiscus flowers], and sugar in order to make beverages. She procures these fruits at the big market of Koutiala. Accepting cash, she sells her beverages very cold to a diverse customer base at the house and at the market. 

While the other member's of the group Kotognontala plan on making an average profit of 164,000 francs CFA each loan cycle, Ms. Salimata plans on making 155,000 francs. In addition to paying back loans, the women use part of the revenues to cope with personal expenses and to increase their business capital.

loans.use: to purchase the ingredients for making juice drinks

loans.name: Ofelia Maribel

texts.es:
Ofelia, se ha decidido por otro crédito para mejorar el inventario del negocio comprara piñas, naranjas, zanahorias y bebidas, para continuar elaborando los jugos que tanto han gustado a sus clientes.
Los resultados que le dio la inversión del crédito anterior fueron que pudo contar con los recursos económicos  necesarios para  adquirir la materia prima que le permitió dar un buen servicio, aumentar su clientela y mejorar el estilo de vida familiar.
texts.en: Ofelia has decided to request another loan to improve her inventory buying pineapples, oranges, carrots and drinks to continue making the juices that her customers like so much. As a result of the last loan she was able to have enough financial resources to acquire the raw materials needed to provide good service, increase her income and provide her family with a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy pineapples, oranges, carrots and drinks.

loans.name: Maria Marta

texts.es:
María, se en encuentra un poco descapitalizada y en vista que necesita adquirir productos frescos para continuar vendiendo, está solicitando un nuevo crédito el cual utilizara para comprar pescado,conchas y camarones.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a aumentar el inventario de su venta, vendió más y las ganancias obtenidas las invirtió en efectuar el pago de sus deudas y mejorar las circunstancias familiares.
texts.en: María finds herself a bit  low on capital and seeing that she needs to buy fresh product to continue selling she is requesting another loan. She will buy fish, shellfish and shrimp. The last loan helped her increase her sales inventory, sell more, and with the profits she paid off her loans and improved her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fish, shellfish and shrimp.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomas, solicita un nuevo crédito para invertir en la compra de bugías, pastillas, focos, filtros y baterías entre otro tipo de repuestos para el taller mecánico.
Con la ayuda que se le brindo anteriormente mejoro el negocio, atrajo más clientes, su economía es más estable permitiéndole cancelar sus deudas y dando un mejor estilo de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Tomas is applying for a new loan to invest in and buy spark plugs, bulbs, filter, batteries, brake pads and other spare parts for his garage. With the help previously provided to him, Tomas improved his business and attracted more customers. His financial situation is more stable, allowing him to pay of his debts and to provide his family with a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy spark plugs, bulbs, filter, batteries and brake pads.

loans.name: Aracely Elizabeth

texts.es:
Aracely, es casada, tiene 41 años y su esposo tiene 45 años, tiene dos hijos de 15 y 17 años de edad, hace tres años se dedica a la venta de tortillas, lo realiza debido  a la necesidad de tener ingresos extras para cubrir gastos familiares, en esta actividad es apoyada por su hija.
Con el crédito comprara maíz, gas propano, son los implementos necesarios para continuar trabajando, aumentara su productividad, espera atraer más clientes, aumentar sus ventas y mejorar sus ingresos.
Su aspiración es mantenerse trabajando para continuar aportando en los gastos familiares.
texts.en: Aracely is married. She is 41 years old while her husband is 45 years old. Aracely has two children, aged 15 and 17 years old respectively. Aracely has been working selling tortillas for three years. She started this work as she needed to have another income in order to cover family expenses. She receives support from her daughter in this work. Aracely will use this loan to buy corn and propane gas, the items that she needs in order to continue working. Aracely will increase productivity and hopes to attract more customers, increase sales, and improve her income. Aracely wants to continue working in order to keep on helping with family expenses.

loans.use: to buy corn and propane gas.

loans.name: Nelson Yovany

texts.es:
Nelson, vive en un ambiente muy familiar junto a su esposa y sus hijos, como una forma de subsistencia se dedica a vender ropa en diferentes puestos en el mercado municipal, lo hace en un horario de de lunes a sábado, ya cuenta con muchos clientes en donde distribuye sus productos.
Solicita capital para invertirlo en la compra de ropa por mayor, variada en estilos, colores y tallas, con lo que renovara su inventario y para cubrir las demandas de los clientes, espera mejorar las ventas y traer más clientes.
Sueña con tener un almacén de ropa en el que tendrá a la disipación mejores ofertas y con ello aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Nelson lives in a family environment with his wife and children. In order to support the family, Nelson works selling clothes at different stalls in the municipal market. He works from Monday to Saturday and has many customers .

Nelson is applying for a loan in order to buy different, styles, sizes and colours of clothes in bulk. He can stock up and then cover customers' demands. Nelson hopes to improve his sales and to have more customers.

Nelson dreams of having a big clothes shop where he can provide the best prices and increase his sales.

loans.use: to buy clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Buenaventura

texts.es:
Buenaventura tiene 68 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el caserío El Arenal, una zona rural del distrito de Santo Tomás, un distrito que se caracteriza por sus paisajes verdes, cataratas, relieve accidentado que le ha permitido desarrollarse mediante la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la cria y venta de ganado vacuno, tiene en su propiedad 9 cabezas de ganado vacuno distribuido en 3 Has de inverna, junto a su esposa se dedican a la actividad pecuaria desde hace 45 años, también cultivan cafeto, son una familia unida que se esfuerza en la labor que realiza, ha solicitado un préstamo de 4 500 nuevos soles para la compra de ganado vacuno lechero para ofrecer su leche y posterior venta de sus crías, generándole ingresos mayores para su familia.
texts.en:
Buenaventura is 68 years old. He lives with his wife and children in the village of El Arenal, a rural area in the district of Santo Tomás, located in the Province of Cutervo, which is part of the Cajamarca Region in the North Andes of Peru. This area is known for it's green landscapes, waterfalls and mountains which allow for the development of agriculture, commerce and livestock raising.

Buenaventura raises and sells livestock. He owns 9 head of cattle on 3 hectares of pastureland. Together with his wife they have been raising livestock for 45 years. They also grow coffee. They are a close-knit family who work hard. Buenaventura has requested a loan of 4,500 PEN to buy milk cows to provide milk and later sell their off-spring, generating more income for the family.

loans.use: to buy milk cows.

loans.name: Guiliana Carmina

texts.es:
Carmina tiene 31 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Cayallti, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada a una hora de la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta y comercialización de animales menores patos, cerdos, carneros entre otros, su esposo se dedica a las labores agrícolas y ocasionalmente brinda servicio de jornalearía en las fincas cercanas a su distrito, Carmina ha solicitado un préstamo de 4 000 nuevos soles para la compra de carneros y de esta manera ofrecer a sus clientes, dado que en esta época existe una alta demanda en el mercado por la carne de carnero.
texts.en:
Carmina is 31 years old. She lives with her husband and children in the district of Cayalti. Many residents make a living in agriculture, commerce, and ranching. Cayalti is located an hour from the Chiclayo Province, which belongs to the Lambayeque Region on Peru's northern coast.

She makes a living by selling small animals like ducks, pigs, rams, and others. Her husband works in agriculture and sometimes works as a day laborer on the farms near their district.

Carmina has requested a loan of 4,000 nuevos soles to purchase rams so that she can offer them to her customers. At this time, there is a high demand in the market for ram's meat.

loans.use: to purchase rams to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es:
Gustavo tiene 23 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicios musicales para todo tipo de eventos, quinceañeros, matrimonios, cumpleaños entre otros, desde hace más de 2 años, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3 500 nuevos soles para la compra de un instrumento musical bajo de cuerda y de esta manera hacer crecer su negocio y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gustavo is 23 years old. He lives with his parents in the Cayaltí district, a community whose residents work in agriculture, commerce, and ranching. It is located an hour from the city of Chiclayo, which belongs to the Lambayeque region on Perú's northern coast. 

He provides musical services for all kinds of events, like quinceañeros (15th birthday parties), weddings, birthdays, etc. He has been doing this for more than 2 years. He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 3,500 nuevos soles to purchase a musical instrument (a bass guitar) so that he can grow his business and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase musical instruments (bass guitar)

loans.name: Juan Luis

texts.en:
Peru's Juan Luis, working alongside his wife, Carmen (pictured at right), specializes in handcrafted jewelry with mate gourds and gemstones. He would like to invest in silver, natural gemstones, and leather for jewelry production. Juan Luis has been selling through NOVICA since 2006. This is his story: "We love to let our imagination run free and be as creative as we want to be. We are inspired by everything we see, even by the discarded pieces from other things we made! We put them together and play with them, like a jigsaw puzzle. I love to see how mistakes can be transformed into beautiful things." "Thanks to your microcredit loan, we'll be able to craft a larger stock of your favorite designs. It will also make it possible for us to work on the new designs we have been creating for Mother's Day." Use the link below to view Juan Luis's silver jewelry with mate gourds and gemstones on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/6054

loans.use: to invest in silver, natural gemstones, and leather for production

loans.name: Virgen Purificada Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             
La socia es la Sra. Rina, la socia continua dedicándose al negocio de elaboración de bocaditos, tortas entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le trae satisfaciones tanto económicas  como personales, la socia elabora sus bocaditos, para los distintos compromisos que le solicitan como matrimonios, fiesta de cumpleaños entre otros, siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de insumos como harina, leche entre otros.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de librería, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de servicio de taxi.
La socia que aparece en la foto adjunta pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members are part of the Communal Bank "Virgen Purificada" which is located in the District of Cusco, Cusco Province, Department of Cusco.

Sra. Rina is one of the members who continues her business of preparing snacks, sandwiches, and other items. She has carried out her business for quite some time and it has brought her financial as well as personal satisfaction. Rina prepares various appetizers for events such as weddings, birthday parties, and other occasions. She believes working in this manner has helped her family get ahead. Rina is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies such as flour, milk, and other items.

The other members engage in businesses such as managing a bookstore, selling clothes, selling groceries, and providing taxi services.

Rina appears in the smaller photo because she requested permission to arrive late to the meeting because of her work. She is grateful to those who have helped to fulfill her dream in this manner, so she promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as flour, milk, and other items.

loans.name: Martha Isabel

texts.es:
Marta, es una persona que se dedica a atender su comedor donde ofrece a sus clientes diferentes platillos a buen precio y muy higiénicos, este negocio nace hace 8 años, debida de la necesidad de tener mejores ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares, lo realiza de lunes a domingo de 6:00 a.m. hasta 3:00 p.m., ella es parte de una familia que está integrada por su esposo y sus hijos.
Invertirá el capital que solicita en la compra de aceite, carnes, bebidas, verduras, condimentos, etc., todo los ingredientes necesarios para continuar elaborando y variando el menú, espera dar un mejor servicio, atraer más clientes, y tener mejores ingresos.
Su sueño es tener un negocio más grande para continuar trabajando y mejorar su economía familiar.
texts.en: Marta runs a café which offers a variety of dishes, hygienically-prepared and sold at a good price. She has been running this business for the past eight years. She started the business because she needed more income to cover the household expenses. She works from Monday to Sunday from 6 a.m. to 3 p.m. In her family there is Marta, her husband and her children. She will use the loan to buy oil, meat, drinks, vegetables, condiments, etc. which she will use to make the dishes from her menu and to continue adding variety to it. She hopes to be able to offer a better service, to attract more customers and to increase her income. Her dream is to grow her business so that she can continue working and improving her family's financial situation.

loans.use: to buy oil, meat, drinks, vegetables. condiments, etc. for her café.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two metal shelving units and a refrigerator.

loans.name: Irma Cristina

texts.es:
Irma, se le presento la oportunidad de invertir más en el negocio en esta ocasión solicita capital para comprar dos terneros y alimento para los mismos. De esta forma continuara fortaleciendo su negocio.
El crédito anterior le dio la oportunidad de tener todo lo necesario para preparar la tierra en la que cultivaría, obtuvo mejores ganancias, con las que ha cancelado sus deudas y mejorado el estilo de vida familiar.
texts.en:
An opportunity has come up for Irma to further invest in her business. This time she is requesting capital in order to puchase two calves and animal feed. This will allow her to continue strengthening her business. 

Her previous loan enabled her to have everything she needed to prepare the land she would be farming. She obtained higher earnings and used them to pay off her debts and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy two calves and feed.

loans.name: Marco

texts.en: Marco and his wife Debora (pictured at left) are Mexican artisans who specialize in dichroic art glass jewelry. They would like to invest in glass and silver for production. They would also like to invest in increasing the physical space of their workshop. Marco has been selling through NOVICA since 2004. This is his story: "Dichroic glass is an ultra-thin coating of metal oxides and quartz, grown as a crystal structure on the surface with a highly technical process. Originally produced for the aerospace industry, it now provides a medium for Our designs. Our work is the result of considerable research that we carry out together to create a rainbow of colors. They reflect our love of the art and of each other." "We've enjoyed sharing our craft with the world so they can see what we can do with our hands. Thanks to you, this microcredit will permit us to make our workshop more spacious so the artisans who have joined us can have a more comfortable space to work. It's also important for us to stock up on our prime materials so it makes it easier to work on new designs and be more efficient in the use of our time." Use the link below to view Marco's dichroic glass jewelry on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/4410

loans.use: to invest in glass and silver for production, and also to invest in increasing the physical space of their workshop

loans.name: Elmer Yovani

texts.es:
Elmer Yovani tiene 37 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Cayalti, una comunidad que se caracteriza por grandes depósitos de arena y ripio que su población utiliza para construcciones de viviendas, la comunidad se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte público en su propia mototaxi desde hace más de cinco años por lo que es conocido en la zona, es un padre emprendedor, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de repuestos para su vehículo y de esta manera seguir brindando un servicio seguro a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Elmer Yovani is 37 years old and lives with his wife and children in the district of Cayalti. This community is known for its large sand and gravel deposits, which residents use to build housing. The community works farming, trading, and raising animals. It is located in Chiclayo province, which belongs to the Lambayeque region of Peru's northern coast.

He works providing public transportation services on the rickshaw he owns. He has been doing this for over five years, so he is well known in the area. He is an enterprising father and has requested a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles in order to purchase spare parts for his vehicle so that he can continue providing safe service to his customers.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his vehicle.

loans.name: María Del Rosario

texts.es:
María de 35 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno año de secundaria, es madre soltera,  vive con sus dos hijos y un hermano con capacidades especiales, el mayor de sus hijos trabaja como ayudante de albañil pues quiere que su madre ya no incurra con sus gastos. Hace 2 años vivía junto con su madre, su padrastro, sus hermanastros y su abuela; pero por circunstancias de la vida su madre falleció y luego murió su abuela, después de esto su padrastro tomó la decisión de retirarse a vivir por aparte junto con sus hijos.

María se ha dedicado desde pequeña al trabajo para sobrevivir, actualmente se dedica principalmente al comercio de ropa y especies, en cuanto a la ropa (ropa interior femenina) ella compra a los mayoristas y los vende en las calles en diferentes cantones y comunidades, para esto debe viajar largas distancias en bus para llegar a su lugar de destino, también vende especies como lo son pimenta, canela (producto primordial), mostaza de comida, almidón etc.

El préstamo solicitado a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar más mercadería (ropa y especies), para de esta manera tener producto en reserva y así cubrir con la demanda en el mercado y por ende obtener más ganancias.
Ella sueña con construir una vivienda, donde su hijo mayor pueda vivir y formar su propio hogar.
texts.en: María is 35 years old and studied up to 6th grade of middle school. She is a single mom and lives with her two children and her brother who has special needs. Her eldest child works as a builder's apprentice so that she does not have to pay all the expenses herself. Up until two years ago, she lived with her mother, her stepfather, her stepsisters and brothers and her grandmother, but her mother passed away and then her grandmother passed away, and then her stepfather decided to go and live elsewhere with his children. María has worked since she was a young child to be able to survive, and she now mainly sells clothes, herbs and spices. She buys women's underwear at wholesale and she sells it on the street in different towns and villages. To do this, she needs to travel long distances by bus to be able to arrive to her destination. She also sells herbs and spices such as pepper, cinnamon (an essential spice), mustard, starch, etc. She is requesting the loan to buy more merchandise (clothes, herbs and spices) so that she has some stock in reserve and can meet market demand, and as a result, make a bigger profit. She dreams of being able to build a house for her eldest son to live in and start his own family.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise (clothes and herbs and spices) to have more stock to be able to respond to market demand.

loans.name: Guadalupe Cristina

texts.es:
Guadalupe, está creciendo con su negocio, su número de clientes ha aumentado por lo que se dispone surtir nuevamente el inventario y para ello solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar pulseras, cadenas, anillos, ropa, lociones, cosméticos, cremas. Para mejorar las ofertas.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a fortalecer el negocio teniendo como resultados positivos un aumento en sus ventas, mejores ganancias y mayor popularidad.
texts.en: Guadalupe is growing along with her business; the number of her clients has increased, and this means that she needs to stock her inventory again. Therefore, she is asking for a new loan to buy bracelets, chains, rings, clothing, lotions, cosmetics and creams. In this way she can improve her range. Her previous loan helped her to strengthen the business and produced positive results via increased sales, better profits and more popularity.

loans.use: to buy bracelets, chains, rings, clothing, lotions, cosmetics and creams.

loans.name: Jose Romulo

texts.es:
José Rómulo tiene 50 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Querocotillo, una comunidad que se caracteriza por sus paisajes verdes, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería especialmente, ubicado en la Provincia de Cutervo, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposa se dedican a la ganaderías, compran ganado vacuno para luego del pastoreo en sus propias invernas, lo comercializan, José ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de ganado tierno para posteriormente de su engorde ofrecerlo a un mejor precio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
José Rómulo is 50 years old and lives with his wife and children in the District of Querocotillo, a community that is known for its green pastures. The people engage in agriculture, trade, and especially livestock breeding. This area is located in Cutervo Province, which is part of the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru.

José Rómulo and his wife are ranchers. They buy cattle, tend to them during the winter, and then sell them. José is requesting a loan of 3,000 PEN so that he can buy young cattle that he can fatten. He will then offer them for a good price to his customers.

loans.use: to buy young cattle.

loans.name: Estelfina

texts.es:
Estelfina tiene 52 años de edad, vive junto a sus sobrinos en el distrito de Cayalti, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, es una comunidad que se caracteriza por sus paisajes verdes y grandes depósitos de arena y ripio, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella tiene una pequeña panadería donde ofrecer variedad de panes, galletas, azucarados entre otros, también ofrece venta de comida preparada por ella misa, es conocida en su medio por la labor que realiza, Estelfina ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para mejorar el local donde realiza las ventas de su producto y de esta manera tener un lugar agradable para acoger a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Estelfina is 52 years old and lives with her nephews in the district of Cayalti, whose residents work farming, trading, and raising animals. This community is well known for its green landscapes and large sand and gravel deposits. It is located in Chiclayo province, which belongs to the Lambayeque region on Peru's northern coast. 

She owns a small bakery where she offers an assortment of bread, cookies, sweets, and other items. She also has food for sale, which she prepares herself. She is known in her field for her good work. Estelfina has requested a loan of  3,000 nuevos soles in order to improve the shop where she sells her products so that she can have a nice place to receive her customers.

loans.use: to repair and paint the shop where she sells her bread.

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.en: Teodoro is a Peruvian artisan who creates handcrafted silver jewelry with his family. He hopes to purchase materials such as silver for his work. Pictured here with his sister, Ruth (at left), Teodoro has been selling through NOVICA since 2012. This is his story: "My artistic formation came from my dad during his work as an archeologist in pre-Hispanic sites, and later as the curator of a museum. That's when I became inspired to craft jewelry with designs and motifs unique to ancient Peru. One of my most cherished moment was when I had a small workshop and my children, Carlos and Alicia, where with me while I was cutting gems by hand. Then we put them through a little machine to perfect the contours. I love the idea that foreigners can get to share part of our history through my designs, where I try to replicate both metals and gems." "With this loan, I'd like to renew my jewelry collection, and we hope to have a great response to our 2014 designs. Thank you so much!" Use the link below to view Teodoro's sterling silver and gemstone jewelry on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/8651

loans.use: to purchase materials such as silver for his work

loans.name: Segundo Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago tiene 37 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicado en la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposa se dedican a la crianza y comercialización de animales como patos, gallinas, gallos, pollos, desde hace más de10 años, El ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia , ofreciéndolo a un mayor precio.
texts.en: Santiago is 37 and lives with his wife and their children in the district of Oyotún in Chiclayo province, which is part of the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru. This community works in agriculture, commerce and animal husbandry. Santiago and his wife have worked for more than 10 years rearing and selling animals such as ducks, hens, cockerels and chickens. He has asked for a loan of 1,500 PEN to buy animal feed to fatten up his flock. In this way, he will bring in a better income for his family by selling at a higher price..

loans.use: to buy animal feed to fatten up his flock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Agapito

texts.es:
Agapito tiene 38 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en el Caserío El Sondor, una zona rural del distrito de Pomahuaca, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de frutales, arroz, cafeto y comercio de los mismos y ganadería ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la actividad a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de cafeto desde hace 10 años, junto a su esposa también se dedican a la crianza de ganado vacuno, cultivos de maíz, pila y yuca, se esfuerzan en la labor que realizan, Agapito ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de abono para su cultivo de café y pago de mano de obra de su mantenimiento, de esta manera lograra una producción oportuna para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Agapito is 38 years old and lives with his family in the village of El Sondor, a rural community in the district of Pomahuaca. The weather is hot in this area, and residents work farming, particularly growing fruit trees, rice, and coffee. They also work selling these products an raising livestock. It is located in Jaén province, which belongs to the Cajamarca region of Peru's northern mountains.

His business is farming, specifically growing coffee, which he has been doing for ten years alongside his wife. They also work raising cattle and growing corn and cassava. They work hard on their business. 

Agapito has requested a 1,500 nuevos soles loan from Edpyme Alternativa in order to buy fertilizer for his coffee plantation and to pay for labor to maintain it. This will allow him to yield an adequate amount of product to offer his customers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Lolina

texts.en:
This is Lolina, 58, resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Nardito, a manager, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household, while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lolina operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for each item in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. They also have a junk shop and a house rental for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 2,500 in sales every day.

Lolina is requesting a PHP 60,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She will also use the loan in their junk shop to buy recyclable materials.

Lolina hopes that her business will continue its success and dreams to have a good life.  Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es:
Domingo tiene 36 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el Caserío de Yerma, una zona rural del distrito de Cañarís, una zona rodeada por paisajes verdes, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Ferreñafe, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la cría y comercio de ganado caprino, las compras lo realiza en los caseríos aledaños para posteriormente ofrecerlos en Hualapampa, esta actividad lo realiza desde hace tres años, Domingo es un emprendedor también brinda servicio de transporte de pasajeros en su propia mototaxi.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de ganado caprino para posteriormente engordarlo y ofrecerlo a un mejor precio.
texts.en:
Domingo, 36, lives with his wife and children in the hamlet of Yerma, a rural area in the Cañarís district of Ferreñafe Province in the Lambayeque region.  The region is surrounded by green landscape, and the residents work in agriculture, commerce, and ranching.

Domingo earns a living raising and selling goats.  He makes his purchases in the nearby hamlets and later sells his animals in Hualapampa.  He has had this job for three years.

Domingo's an entrepreneur who also provides passenger transportation services with his own motorcycle taxi.

He has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan for 500 nuevos soles [PEN] to buy goats to fatten so he can sell them at a better price.

loans.use: to buy goats

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is from Dipolog - Sergio Osmeña Zamboanga del Norte Philippines. She is 39 years old and is married with 3 children. 

In 2013, Eliza applied for membership with PMPC. Hearing about all of the benefits, she never hesitated to become a member. She is a member in good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner. Eliza asks for financial assistance of 4,000.00 PHP to purchase ingredients for camote (sweet potato) bar vending. Through this, she hopes to increase her income and  expand her business. 

She has found assistance through Paglum MPC, to meet her financial needs and is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to pay for camote bar ingredients.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria is from  Bato, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao: Philippines. She is  58 years old and is married with 4 children. She farms in order to provide food and meet the needs of the family.

In 2002, Gregoria applied for membership with PMPC and keeps her membership in good standing. She has no record of defaults. 

Recently, Gregoria asks for financial assistance of 12,000 PHP for coco-land redemption. 

She has found assistance for her financial needs through Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and smiles at the thought of being a Paglaum Member.

loans.use: to purchase coco-land redemption.

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
This is Ma. Teresa, 48, resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is single and she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Ma. Teresa operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for each item in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

Ma. Teresa is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Ma. Teresa dreams to expand her business and have it become a grocery store. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Fidencia

texts.en:
Fidencia is from Lower Banicapt Galas Dipolog City Philippines. She is 61 years old and is married. She is a master cutter and owns a tailoring business. 

Fidencia applied her membership with PMPC in 2006. She was interested because she heard about the insurance benefits. She is a member of good standing and repays her obligations in a timely fashion.

She asks for 11,000.00 PHP financial assistance  to purchase materials for her tailoring business. Through this, she hopes to increase her income and expand her business. 

She has found assistance for her financial needs through Paglaum MPC and hopes to save for house repairs.

loans.use: to pay for tailoring materials.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou, age 51, is married and lives in Bato, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao, Philippines. She has two children. From her desire to help the family, she engaged in a fish vending business, starting up with capital of 3,000 PHP. Her business has operated for 20 years already. 

Now, she is planning to borrow PHP 14,900 from Paglaum MP Cooperative, of which she became a member. 

She wants to have a stall in the public market to display her fish. Someday, she will be happy seeing her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to pay for more kilos of fish to sell.

loans.name: Apolinar

texts.es:
Apolinar tiene 69 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Pucara una ciudad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica al cultivo de café, desde hace varios años, su esposa le apoya en esta labor preparando los alimentos para asistir a los jornaleros en la época de mantenimiento de la finca, cosecha, son una familia unida, Apolinar ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para la compra de abono para su cultivo de café y de esta manera prevenir cualquier tipo de plaga, teniendo una producción oportuna para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Apolinar is 69 years old. He lives with his wife and children in the district of Pucara, a town with warm weather whose inhabitants work with agriculture, sales and livestock. It is located in the province of Jaén, which belongs to the Cajamarca region in the northern highlands of Peru.

He has been growing coffee for several years. His wife supports him in his work by preparing food to assist the day laborers during the maintenance of the farm and the harvest season. They're a close-knit family. Apolinar has requested a loan for 1,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to purchase compost for his coffee crop. That way he'll prevent any kind of pest and reap a timely produce to offer his customers.

loans.use: to purchase compost to grow coffee.

loans.name: Jose Camilo

texts.es:
José, está muy complacido con la facilidad de pago que se le brinda en la institución y nuevamente solicita capital para comprar crema, cuajada, quesos, quesillo, etc., para continuar teniendo lo que sus clientes buscan en su negocio.
José invirtió el capital anterior en productos frescos y del agrado de sus clientes, su negocio sigue creciendo y generando los ingresos necesarios para cancelar sus deudas y apoyar a familiares en sus estudios.
texts.en:
José is very pleased with the payment terms he is offered by the institution.  He is, again, requesting capital to purchase cream, curds, cheeses, cream cheese etc. so he can continue have stocked what is customers come to his business looking for. 
José invested the previous capital in fresh products.  Because his customers are pleased, his business keeps growing and generating the income he needs to repay his debts and support family members in their schooling.

loans.use: to purchase cream, curds, cheeses, cream cheese etc.

loans.name: Guillermo Javier

texts.es:
Javier tiene 37 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en una comunidad pequeña de Cayaltí, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposa se dedican a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores desde hace 5 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior a su domicilio, Javier ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y de esta manera ofrecerlos a un mejor precio.
texts.en:
Javier is 37 years old and lives with his wife and children in the community of Cayaltí. The population of Cayaltí is involved in agriculture, trade, and raising livestock. It is located in the province of Chiclayo which is in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.
