That school has started a new badge for more students which is very good news for him because through increase in numbers of students his sales increase also. The demand for syllabus books, copies and pencils has already been increasing and he has been managing it through his personal sources. But this time demand has increased extraordinarily and he does not have sufficient cash on hand to buy enough books to cope with the demand. 

Therefore, Abida requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy the books of various courses and easily cope the increasing demand. She is very glad after taking this loan and praises the lenders who are taking an active part in supporting her.

loans.use: To buy books of various courses and stationery for their bookstore.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
This is Josephine, 37, a resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Rodolfo, an employee and a father to their children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 
 
Josephine operates a tailoring business. She mainly offers curtains, bed sheets, blankets and other home trappings. Seasonal demand for clothing like uniforms and such is available all year round. She also does repairs and alterations. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day. To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other items needed in her business.
 
Josephine hopes to have additional business, and dreams of giving her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, cloth, thread, needles and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.en:
Ramon previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that he used to buy spare parts and maintenance of his computer shop business. His earnings were a big help in his personal, household and business expenditures. He also sells pork and chicken meat for additional income.
 
He would like to apply for another 35,000 PHP loan for him to buy additional spare parts and maintenance of his computer shop business. The profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain his family's daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Ramon dreams to have another stall for his business. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of his computer shop business.

loans.name: Dinara

texts.ru: Динаре 38 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Динары - высшее образование, работает преподавателем начальных классов в местной школе. Супруг работает электриком, имеет стабильную зарплату. Динара в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 15 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Динары, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь, 30 овец, 15 коз, 1 нетель и 25 кур. Дети принимают самое активное участие в хозяйстве. У всех членов семьи распределены обязанности по уходу за скотом. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Динара обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку жеребят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Динара планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку трактора.
texts.en:
Dinara is 38 years old and married.  She and her husband are raising four children.  She has a higher education and makes a living teaching elementary grades at a local school.  Her husband works as an electrician and brings home a stable salary.  In order to make an additional income for her family, Dinara is also involved in animal husbandry and agriculture.  She started in this field 15 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 10,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her very hard work, her farming business now consists of two dairy cows, one horse, 30 sheep, 15 goats, one heifer and 25 chickens.  Dinara's children are very actively involved with the farm work, and all members of the family are assigned responsibilities for the care of the animals.  Dinara makes a monthly income of 15,000 som (KGS).

Eager to further develop her farming business, Dinara has turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" and requested a loan.  She will use her loan to buy some foals in order to increase her number of farm animals.  She plans to reinvest the earnings from her loan into further increasing her livestock headcount.  She is also planning to save enough money to buy a tractor.

loans.use: to buy foals.

loans.name: Allah Barka Group

texts.fr:
Mme AMINATA représente le groupe ALLAH BARKA. Elle se porte très bien. Mariée, elle  mère  de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 17ans et le moins âgé a 05ans.03 vont à l’école.
Mme transforme l’arachide en patte d’arachide et vend en même temps depuis 08ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages proches. Ses clients sont les restauratrices.
Elle veut s’acheter ½ sac d’arachide.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut investir dans  son commerce. Mme ambitionne paye la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Madame Aminata represents the Allah Barka group. She is doing very well. She is married and the mother of four children between 5 and 17 years of age. Three of her children go to school. 

For 8 years, Madame has been making peanut butter from peanuts. She buys her supplies in nearby villages. Her clients are restaurateurs.

She would like to buy 1/2 bag of peanuts. With the profits, she would like to invest in her business. She would like to pay for her children's schooling.

loans.use: buy 1/2 bag of peanuts.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en: Nida is 53 years old and married with one child. Her family lives happily in a rural community. According to her, farming has been her primary source of income. Nida is also involved in another business - a small variety store. She plans to improve her small variety store but she has limited capital. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000.00 to buy more stocks of grocery items like snack foods, canned goods, noodles, beverages, laundry soaps, soft drinks and seasonings to sell. Nida believes that someday she will further expand her business through this financial assistance she requested.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of grocery items like snack foods, canned goods, noodles, beverages, laundry soaps, soft drinks and seasonings to sell

location.town: Brgy. Inaban, Dupax del Norte,Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Gloria De La Paz

texts.es:
Gloria, es casada, vive sola  con su esposa, no tiene hijos. Debido a la necesidad de ingresos en su hogar hace 2 años inicio un negocio en el que brinda a sus clientes productos de primera necesidad para sus hogares es un oficio que aprendió gracias a su suegra.
El crédito que está solicitando será utilizado en la compra de granos básicos, bebidas, detergentes, jabón, verduras y frutas, le permitirá fortalecer el negocio lo suficiente para que sus clientes se mantengan fieles a su negocio.
Gloria sueña con incrementar la rentabilidad de su negocio para mejorar su estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Gloria is married and lives alone with her husband; they haven’t got any children.  In order to meet the household expenses she started a business two years ago selling basic household products to her customers.  She learnt this trade from her mother-in-law.

She is asking for a loan to buy basic grains, drinks, detergent, soap, fruit and vegetables; which will allow her to strengthen her business enough to keep the customers satisfied.

Gloria dreams of increasing her profits to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, drinks, detergent, soap, fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: José Angel

texts.es: José Ángel, tiene la edad  de 39 años, está casado,  vive con sus hijos y esposa, los cuales son mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de repuestas para hacer la reparación de su vehículo el cual es de suma importancia para hacer el traslado de los materiales utilizados en los trabajos de la finca. Con esta compra espera poder realizar una buena reparación del vehículo y poder tener los materiales a tiempo en la finca y así los cultivos tendrán su asistencia en su momento requerido. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
José Ángel, 39 years old, is married and lives with his children and wife, who are his greatest priority. With his loan he plans to buy spare parts to repair his vehicle, which is extremely important for the transportation of materials around his farm. With this purchase, he hopes to be able to repair his vehicle well and be able to transfer materials around his farm on time, and thus attend to his crops at the required moments.

This is the first loan he is receiving from FUDECOSUR. He did not have other loans from state banks before, but FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan with greater ease and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle

loans.name: Didier

texts.es: Didier, tiene la edad  de 48 años, está en unión libre,  vive con sus hijos y esposa, los cuales son mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de repuestas para hacer la reparación de su vehículo el cual es de suma importancia para hacer el traslado de los materiales utilizados  y el trasporte de los peones que le ayudan a realizar los trabajos de la finca. Con esta compra espera poder realizar una buena reparación del vehículo en un corto plazo y así poder tener los materiales a tiempo en la finca y así los cultivos tendrán su asistencia en su momento requerido. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Didier, 48, lives with his partner and his children, who are the most important thing in his life.  With this loan he intends to buy some spare parts to repair the vehicle which is so important to him because he uses it to transport material and laborers when working on the farm.  With this material he hopes to repair the vehicle quickly and well, so that he can have all the material he needs on the farm in time to take care of the crops.  

It is the first loan he has asked for from FUDECOSUR.  He hasn’t been able to get any credit from any of the state banks but FUDECOSUR have given him the opportunity to get the loan with much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to repair a vehicle.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.es: El señor Gabriel vive actualmente en el municipio de Entre ríos, está casado y tiene tres hijos dependientes, actualmente se dedica a la carpintería y también trabaja en un taller mecánico pero en esta actividad solo tiene 6 meses de experiencia, los ingresos de su trabao en la carpintería provienen de la venta de muebles construidos en el taller, el personal esta compuestos por 2 maestros carpinteros, maestro ayudante de carpintería y el propietario como maestro en carpintería, el ultimo es quien se encarga de la compra de insumos como madera, pegamentos, clavos, lijas, etc y tambien administra los gastos de reposición en maquinarias, el crédito solicitado es para la compra de madera para su carpintería lo que le servirá como insumo para continuar con su trabajo y de esta forma lograra cumplir con los contratos de muebles solicitados, por consiguiente incrementara sus ingresos y mejorara la calidad de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Gabriel currently lives in the municipality of Entre Ríos. He is married and has three dependent children. He currently works as a carpenter and also works in a mechanic shop, but he only has 6 months of experience there. 

His income from the carpentry work comes from sales of furniture made in his workshop. The shop is staffed by two carpentry professionals: a carpenter's assistant and the owner, who is a master carpenter. He is in charge of purchasing supplies such as wood, glue, nails, sandpaper, etc. He also oversees the cost of replacing the machines.

The loan will be used to purchase wood for the carpentry. This will serve as a supply to continue with the work of fulfilling contracts for requested furniture. As such, his earnings will increase and his entire family's quality of life will improve.

loans.use: to purchase wood for his carpentry.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is a 39-year-old single woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 8 years to 19 years. She describes herself to be business-oriented. She operates a retail business where she sells drinks, sugar, bread, milk and other consumer goods. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be bad weather. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of bread, drinks, milk and other items she sells. Her business goal is to have a big business that will create employment for others within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will grow economically. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bread, drinks, milk and other items she sells.

loans.name: Rubina's Group

texts.en:
Rubina is 35, living with her two children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband constructs the concrete floors and polishes the marble floors. For this purpose, he uses basic tools to align smoothness and a floor polishing machine; he has been providing these services for many years. A few days ago, his polishing machine has become out of order due to continuous use. 
For this reason, he wants to buy a new machine but he does not have enough cash in hand.

Therefore, Rubina requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy a new polishing machine so that he can continue his services.

loans.use: to buy a floor-polishing machine for services.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: Teodora mayor de edad, casada, originaria de unos de los municipios de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, donde predomina el comercio, y el turismo. Ella es propietaria de un negocio de venta  de mariscos en general, posee dieciséis años de experiencia, el cual comercializa pescado, camarones, entre otros mariscos y lo vende de manera ambulante lo cual sale desde muy temprano a ofrecer sus productos en diferentes restaurantes y comedores de esta ciudad. Teodora es una mujer muy emprendedora con deseos de superación; solicita el préstamo para invertirlo en productos de pescados, jaibas, punches, camarones entre otros , ella agradece a los inversionistas kiva por la ayuda que les brindan a las personas de escasos recursos.
texts.en:
Teodora is married and comes from one of the municipalities of Chinandega which is in the western part of the country where commerce and tourism are the main businesses.  She has her own shellfish business which she has been running for 16 years, selling fish, shrimp and other shellfish.  She works as a street vendor and starts very early offering her products to restaurants and diners in the city.

Teodora is a very enterprising woman who is determined to get ahead.  She is requesting a loan to buy fish, shrimp and other shellfish, and is grateful to Kiva for helping people with low incomes.

loans.use: To buy shellfish to sell.

loans.name: Dúo Las Gaviotas De Ciudad Bieja Group

texts.es: El dúo Las Gaviotas de Ciudad bieja está formado por doña Aura Angelica de 42 años de edad y tiene 3 hijas de(5,8,y 15 años) quien posee un local en su domicilio ubicado en ciudad Vieja tiene una gran variedad de productos a la venta tienda(ropa de niños, dama, caballeros, ropa interior, utensilios de cocina, aguas, jugos, galletas etc.) ella solicita su crédito para invertir y comprar utensilios de cocina ya que es una temporada donde tiene mayor venta en su negocio esto le ayuda a ella a lograr tener mejores ingresos y lograr remodelar mejor su negocio ya que a ella le gustaría poner rejas en su local para tener mejor seguridad.el credito lo esta solicitando para la compra de productos para su tienda.
texts.en: One of the two members of the communal bank group Las Gaviotas de Ciudad Bieja is Aura Angelica, 42, who has three daughters (ages 5, 8 and 15).  She has a store set up in her home in Ciudad Vieja where she sells a variety of products (women's, men's and children's clothing, underwear, kitchen utensils, water, juice, cookies, etc.).  She is requesting a loan to buy kitchen utensils since it is the season when sales are highest.  This will help increase her income so she can renovate her store.  She wants to install grill work for added safety at the store.  She will use the loan to buy products for the store.

loans.use: To buy goods for her store.

loans.name: Jyldyz

texts.ru: Жылдыз 43 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Жылдыз - среднее образование, она домохозяйка, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Жылдыз занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Жылдыз, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 теленок, 15 овец, также обрабатывает 1,11 ГА земельной доли на которой ежегодно сажает картофель и фасоль для реализации, дополнительно к этому у себя в огороде Жылдыз сажает клубнику для реализации. Супруг таксует на своем авто меж селами. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет 13,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жылдыз обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку нетелей для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Жылдыз планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Jyldyz is 43 years old, she is married and is raising four children together with her husband. Jyldyz has secondary education, she is a housewife and does animal husbandry as a main source of income for her family. She started this business twenty years ago with the purchase of cattle for 5,000 som (KGS). Because of her hard work Jyldyz now has one milk cow, one calf, fifteen sheep and also cultivates 1,11 hectares of arable land where she annually plants potatoes and beans for resale. In addition Jyldyz also plants strawberries in her garden for resale. Her husband drives a taxi on his car in between the villages. Their total monthly income comes to 13,000 KGS. With the goal to further grow her business Jyldyz has come to the bank Bai Tushum and Partners to buy heifers to increase the headcount of livestock. Jyldyz plans to invest the income from the loan into further increase the headcount of livestock and save money to repair the house.

loans.use: to buy heifers.

loans.name: Pedro Tomas

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 58 años de edad estado civil unión libre vive con la esposa  y con sus tres hijos en el  Cantón Mocache provincia de los Ríos.

Pertenece a la ventanilla LOS LUCHADORES se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto La Guayas, pertenece al cantón Mocache esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Pedro se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace tres años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.

El crédito solicito para la compra de insumos y fertilizantes para la siembra de maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es  tener un terreno propio.
Le gusta jugar con sus hijos en su tiempo libre.
texts.en:
Pedro, 58, lives with his common-law wife and three children in the Mocache Canton in the province of Los Ríos.  He belongs to the communal bank LOS LUCHADORES which is located in a community called Recinto Las Guayas in the Mocache Canton.  This group is involved in agriculture and livestock farming.

Pedro is a farmer and has been growing corn and rice for three years.  He buys supplies in Ventanas and sells his produce at the local market.

He is requesting a loan to buy supplies and fertilizers to plant corn and rice.  The loan will help increase his income to cover family expenses and to invest.  His dream is to have his own farmland.

He enjoys playing with his children in his free time.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
María Cristina
Doña cristina es una mujer viuda desde hace más de ocho años, le toco enfrentar la vida sola y lucha diariamente pos sacar a sus seis hijos adelante. Ella se dedica a la venta de refacciones como son: tostadas, tacos, chuchos. Atol y otras comidas. Y como actividad secundaria se dedica a la crianza de pollos. De estas fuentes es que doña Cristina obtiene sus ingresos para cubrir sus necesidades diarias. El sueño de Cristina es que todos sus hijos estudien hasta tener una profesión, a pesar de ser viuda sus pagos los a hecho puntualmente no tiene ni un día de atraso.y no callo en mora Solicita el crédito para la compra de materiales para cocinar elaboracion de refacciones.
texts.en:
Cristina has been a widow for over eight years.  She had to face life alone and struggle daily to provide for her six children.  She sells food such as tostadas, tacos, chuchos, atol (corn drink) and other food.  As a second business activity she raises chickens.  Theses are the sources of income for Cristina to earn enough to cover daily expenses.

Cristina's goal is for her children to get an education and become professionals.  Despite being a widow she has always made her loan payments on time without delay.  She is requesting this loan to buy supplies to make food.

loans.use: To buy supplies to make and sell food.

loans.name: Jennifer Adriana

texts.es:
Jennifer tiene 22 años de edad estado civil soltera vive con sus padres en el  Cantón Mocache provincia de los Ríos.

Pertenece a la ventanilla LOS LUCHADORES se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto La Guayas, pertenece al cantón Mocache esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Jennifer se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace algunos años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas en Agroquímica Karmita y en Mocache, vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo y para invertir. Su sueño es terminar los estudios y graduarse de licenciada.
Le gusta hacer deporte y bailar.
texts.en:
Jennifer, 22, is single and lives with her parents in the Mocache Canton in the province of Los Ríos.  She is a member of the communal bank LOS LUCHADORES which is located in a community called Recinto Las Guayas in the Mocache Canton.  This group is involved in agriculture and livestock farming.

Jennifer has been growing corn and rice for several years.  She buys supplies in Ventanas in Agroquímica Karmita and in Mocache, and sells her produce in the same place.

The loan she is requesting is to buy compost, urea and liquid fertilizers for her corn and rice crops.  The loan will help increase her income to cover expenses and invest.  Her dream is to finish her education and get a degree.

She enjoys sports and dancing.

loans.use: To buy supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase five heads of cows and calves to start a business.

loans.name: Les Amis De La Paix Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Chance est une commerçante depuis 3 ans et membre d’une plate forme d’Affaires « Les Amis de la paix»  âgée de 28 ans, mariée et mère de 1 enfant qui étudie. Elle est vendeuse d’habillements. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son activité. Elle va acheter 15 pantalons de lux, 20 chemises, des singlets, sous vêtements, jupes et robes. Son conjoint est un chauffeur de transport en commun. Au début, elle avait reçu de fonds de ses frères. Elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser et assurer les soins médicaux de son enfant. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux hommes et femmes entrepreneurs en leur accordant de crédits sans garantie matérielle et qui sont exclues du système bancaire classique.
texts.en: The customer, Chance, has been a trader for the past three years and is a member of the "Les Amis de la Paix" ("Friends of Peace") business platform. She is 28 years old, married and mother to one child who is at school. Chance sells clothing and is requesting a loan from Hekima so that she can expand her business. She is going to buy 15 pairs of luxury trousers, 20 shirts, singlets, undergarments, skirts and dresses. Her husband is a public transport driver. She got her initial capital from her brothers and she would like to expand it as well as to educate and cover her child's medical expenses.She is grateful to Hekima for its support to male and female entrepreneurs, who do not have access to classic banks, by granting them loans without any material guarantee.

loans.use: to buy 15 high quality pairs of trousers, 20 shirts, singlets, undergarments, skirts and dresses.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Revendeuse de produits cosmétiques dans une boutique, Abla est mariée à un déclarant en douanes et mère de famille: 02 sont scolarisés. Elle est à son quatrième crédit de WAGES et cet argent lui servira d'acheter des produits cosmétiques et des mèches. Elle vend seule et sa difficulté principale est le manque de fonds pour augmenter son stock. Avec les profits, la cliente pense augmenter son fonds de commerce. Elle veut ouvrir d’autres boutiques similaires et contribuer au mieux au développement de ses enfants au coté de son mari. Elle est âgée de 29ans.
texts.en: Abla, who is a retailer of cosmetics in a shop, is married to a customs official and is mother to two children who are at school. She is on her fourth loan from WAGES and this money will be used to buy cosmetics and hair extensions. She works by herself and her main difficulty is the lack of capital to increase her stock. With her profits, the customer is planning to expand her business. She would like to open other similar shops and also, along with her husband, contribute more to her children's growing up. Abla is 29 years old.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Source Divine Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Fabiola est une commerçante depuis 8 ans, âgée de 40 ans, veuve et mère de 7 enfants, qui tous étudient. La cliente est trésorière et membre d’une Association d’Affaires « Source Divine». Elle est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires et sociétaire d’un dépôt. Elle installe ses marchandises dans un dépôt sur la rue dans un quartier animé de la place. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son activité. Elle va acheter 20 sacs de farine de manioc, 25 de mais et 30 jutes d’huile. Elle démarra ses affaires avec le fonds  reçu des épargnes de son mari (lors de son vivant). Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite  accroitre son capital, scolariser, nourrir ses enfants et assurer leurs soins médicaux. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs non bancables en leur accordant de crédit pendant, ce moment post conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en: The customer, Fabiola, has been a trader for the past eight years. She is a 40-year old widow who has seven children, all of whom are studying. The customer is the treasurer and a member of the "Source Divine" ("Divine Source") business association. She sells food products and is a shareholder/member of a store. She lays out her goods in the store on a street in a lively local district. She is requesting a loan from Hekima to expand her business. She is going to buy 20 sacks of cassava flour, 25 of corn and 30 hessian bags of oil. She began her business with funds from her husband's savings (when he was still alive). In the future she would like to increase her capital, educate and feed her children as well as to cover their medical expenses. She is grateful to Hekima for its support to female entrepreneurs who are not able to access classic banks, by granting them loans during this difficult period following the conflicts in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy 20 sacks of cassava flour, 25 sacks of corn and 30 hessian bags of oil.

loans.name: Gloria Margoth

texts.es:
Gloria tiene 41 años de edad estado civil soltera vive con los hijos de 21,18 14 y 11 años. Vive en el  Cantón Mocache provincia de los Ríos.
Pertenece a la ventanilla LOS LUCHADORES se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto La Guayas, pertenece al cantón Mocache esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Gloria se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz. Hace las compras de los productos en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado del mismo lugar. 

El crédito solicito para arrendar un terreno y  comprar fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado a cambiar el estilo de vida de su familia. Su sueño es comprar un terreno y mejorar en los negocios.
Le gusta ver la televisión y  hacer deporte con los hijos.
texts.en:
Gloria is 41 years old. She is single and lives with her children, aged 21,18 14 and 11. She lives in the Mocache canton in the Los Rios province. She belongs to the LOS LUCHADORES credit group, located in the community of La Guayas in the Mocache canton. This credit group is dedicated to farming and livestock work.

Gloria works in agriculture. She grows corn and rice. She makes her purchasing in Ventanas and sells her products in the market in the same place. 

She asked for the loan to rend some land and buy fertilizer to plant corn and rice. The loan has helped her to change her family's lifestyle. Her dream is to buy land and improve her business. 

She likes to watch television and play sports with her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to plant corn.

loans.name: Melina Jaquelina

texts.es:
Melina, desde hace 10 años se dedica a administrar su negocio que consiste en sastrería y pupusería, su horario es de 8:00 a.m. hasta las 5:00 p.m., son oficios que ha aprendido mediante cursos impartidos en su comunidad. Ella es casada, tiene dos hijos de 10 y 15 años de edad.
El capital que solicita lo invertirá en la compra telas, broches, zippers, botones, aderezos, quesillo, harina, entre otros materiales e ingredientes para su negocio, con  lo que responderá a la temporada de inicio de clases y de esa manera mejorar sus ingresos.
Para Melina su objetivo es mejorar expandir su negocio y mejorar su economía.
texts.en:
For 10 years, Melina has run her business, which is tailoring and selling pupusas. Her schedule is from 8:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. She learned her trades through classes in her community. She is married and has two children, aged 10 and 15. 

The capital she is asking for will be invested in buying fabric, fasteners, zippers, buttons, cheese curd, flour, and other materials and ingredients for her business. With this, she will be able to respond to the back to school season and thus improve her income. 

Melina's objective is to improve her business and her finances.

loans.use: to buy fabric, fasteners, zippers, buttons, seasonings, cheese curd, and flour.

loans.name: Dúo Tejedoras Group

texts.es:
Dúo Tejedoras
Dúo conformado por María Esteban ella es originaria de san Martin Jilotepeque, se dedica al arte de realizar tejidos y bordados típicos. María Esteban realiza güipiles de muchos colores, tiene sus propias clientas y llegan a su casa para hacerle los pedidos,en esta oportunidad esta solicitando este credito para la compra materia prima para la elaboracion y venta de tejidos tipicos
texts.en:
Tejedoras Duo

This duo includes María Esteban. She is from San Martin Jilotepeque. She works in the art of traditional weavings and embroidery. María Esteban makes many colored güipiles. She has her own customers and they go to her house to make their own orders. At this time, she is asking for a loan to buy materials to make and sell traditional weavings.

loans.use: to buy materials for her weavings she will sell.

loans.name: Ayélé

texts.fr: Madame Ayélé coiffeuse de profession exerce son activité dans un quartier de la ville de Lomé. En plus de son activité, elle revend des mèches, des produits cosmétiques et emploie 03 personnes. Son premier prêt sollicité à WAGES l'aidera à s'approvisionner en marchandises (mèches, produits cosmétiques...) afin de mieux répondre aux besoins des clients. Son souhait est d'agrandir son activité. Elle est âgée de 24ans, et n'a pas d'enfants en charge.
texts.en: Ayélé is a hairdresser and runs her business in a district of Lomé. She also sells hair extensions and cosmetics and employs 3 people. Her first loan from WAGES will enable her to buy merchandise (hair extensions, cosmetic products etc) so that she is better able to meet her customers' needs. She wants to grow her business. She is 24 years old and has no children to take care of.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions, hair weaves and cosmetics.

loans.name: Halowiyao

texts.fr: Halowiyao vit avec son conjoint(enseignant) et leur enfant de 06ans scolarisé à Lomé. En 2008 pour contribuer aux besoins de la famille, elle a décidé de vendre des produits alimentaires. Activité qu'elle mène avec joie car cela lui permet de voir sa famille s'épanouir. Son premier prêt lui servira de s'approvisionner plus en marchandises. Le profit l'aidera à ouvrir d'autres boutiques et assurer l'éducation de son enfant.
texts.en: Halowiyao lives with her spouse (a teacher) and their 6-year-old child (who is attending school) in Lomé. She decided to start selling food products in 2008 so that she would be able to contribute to the family's needs. She enjoys her job because it allows her to watch her family blossom. Her first loan will be used to get more supplies. The profit from her business will enable her to open more shops and to ensure that her child gets an education.

loans.use: to buy staple products.

loans.name: Marina Abigail

texts.es:
Marina, se ha decidido por solicitar más capital para invertirlo en la compra de concentrados por mayor para ganado, pues se está preparando para la época seca y así reducirá costos en su alimentación.
Con la inversión anterior Marina tuvo la facilidad de aumentar su ganado, que luego vendió a mejor precio, con sus ganancias ha mejorado las circunstancias familiares.
texts.en:
Marina has decided to ask for more capital to invest in buying concentrate wholesale for cattle. She is preparing for the dry season and this will reduce feeding costs.  

With the previous investment, Marina was able to increase her cattle that she later sold for a better price. With her profits she has improved her family circumstances.

loans.use: to buy concentrate wholesale for cattle.

loans.name: Adakouvi

texts.fr: Revendeuse de pagnes dans un marché de la ville de Lomé depuis 2003, madame Adakouvi âgée de 49ans, maman de 02 enfants(20 et 15ans)scolarisés a pour conjoint un employé dans une société d'assurance. Elle sollicite son tout premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter plus de marchandises afin de satisfaire ses clients. Le profit lui permettra d'améliorer son activité et d'assurer le bien - être de la famille.
texts.en: Adakouvi has been selling pagnes (highly colourful and decorative West African clothing) at a market in the town of Lomé since 2003. She is 49 years old and the mother of 2 children (aged 20 and 15) and her husband works at an insurance agency. She is requesting her first loan from WAGES in order to buy more merchandise so that she can satisfy her customers. The profit she earns will enable her to improve her business and to ensure her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy some pagnes.

loans.name: Edoh

texts.fr: Jeune homme de 29ans, mr Edoh a pour femme une revendeuse. Edoh quant à lui est aussi revendeur de CD,DVD et de prêt à porter au marché. Son approvisionnement se fait au même lieu et il sollicite son quatrième prêt à WAGES pour acheter des marchandises. Il espère réinvestir dans son activité et assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille. Il a démarré en 2002.
texts.en: Edoh, a young 29-year-old man, is married to a retailer. Edoh himself sells CDs, DVDs and ready-to-wear clothing at the market. He gets his supplies locally and is requesting his 4th loan from WAGES in order to buy more merchandise. He hopes to be able to reinvest in his business and to ensure his family's food self-sufficiency. He started his business in 2002.

loans.use: to buy CDs, DVDs and clothing.

loans.name: Gradie Group

texts.fr: La cliente Murhibashaza est une commerçante et membre du groupe d’affaires «Gladie», entrepreneur, âgée de 34 ans et mère de 9 enfants, qui 6 étudient et 3 autres sont encore gosses. Elle est une vendeuse des oignons. Elle installe sa marchandise à son domicile dans un dépôt, où, elle a su gagner sa clientèle. Elle commença ses affaires avec le premier capital reçu de son mari. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 3 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 10 sacs d’oignons. Ainsi, elle souhaite acheter une parcelle, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. En définitif, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs exclues de système bancaire classique, surtout; pendant ce moment difficile  post conflits à l’Est du pays.
texts.en: Murhibashaza, the customer, is a retailer and a member of the Gladie business group. She is a 34-year-old entrepreneur and the mother of 9 children, 6 of whom attend school and 3 who are still very young. She sells onions. She displays her merchandise in a storage area at her home where she has built up her clientèle. She started her business with funds she received from her husband. Later on, she benefited from loans from the MFI Hekima. She has been in business for 3 years. This new loan will be used to buy 10 bags of onions. She hopes to be able to buy a plot of land and to feed her children and ensure they get an education. Finally, she would like to strongly thank Hekima for its support of women entrepreneurs who are excluded from traditional banking channels, especially in this difficult time after the war in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy 10 bags of onions.

loans.name: Enyovi

texts.fr: Jeune femme de 27ans, Enyovi est célibataire et n'a pas d'enfants en charge. Pour assurer ses propres besoins, elle revend des perles au marché. Son second cycle de prêt lui permettra d'acheter plus de marchandises. Elle espére réinvestir dans l'activité et assurer son auto suffisance alimentaire. Elle a une ancienneté de 05ans.
texts.en: Enyovi is 27 years old, single and has no children to take care of. In order to be able to meet her own needs, she sells beads at the market. Her second loan will enable her to buy more merchandise. She hopes to be able to reinvest in her business and to ensure her food self-sufficiency. She has been in business for 5 years.

loans.use: to buy beads.

loans.name: Lattou Group

texts.fr:
Mme AGUIRATOU représente le groupe  LATTOU. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 03enfants. Le plus âgée a 14ans et le moins âgé a 03ans. 02 vont à l’école.
Mme vend des céréales depuis 03ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants. Ses clients viennent de divers quartiers (hommes et femmes).
Mme veut s’acheter 02 sacs de petit mil, 03sacs de maïs, 01 sac de sésame et 02 sacs d’haricots.
Avec  ses bénéfices, elle veut ouvrir un magasin. Mme ambitionne aider à l’épanouissement de la famille.
texts.en: Aguiratou is the representative of the Lattou group. She is doing well. She is married and the mother of 3 children, the eldest of whom is 14 years old and the youngest, 3. Two of her children attend school. Aguiratou has been selling cereals for 3 years. She gets her supplies in the surrounding villages. Her customers, men and women, come from different districts. She would like to buy 2 bags of little millet, 4 bags of maize, 1 bag of sesame and 2 bags of beans. She wants to use her profits to open a shop. Her aim is to help her family flourish.

loans.use: to buy 2 bags of little millet, 4 bags of maize, 1 bag of sesame and 2 bags of beans.

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
DJEKAFO est un groupe constitué de  4 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles  élargies dans le quartier  NIEBALA de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 13ème prêt. Les  prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce  d’articles divers à l’image de NABINTOU qui est la 1ère femme debout  dans la photo de la gauche vers la droite. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt,  des articles divers : des céréales, savons, pagnes, chaussures et produits de beauté avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Djekafo group is made up of 4 married women who have an average age of 43 and, on average, 3 children. They live in traditional extended families in the district of Niebala in Bougouni town. They got to know each other via neighbourly relationships, friendships and business. They joined the Soro Yiriwaso MFI in order to strengthen their financial capacity so that they can better do business and are on their 13th loan. The previous loans have been properly repaid. This group of women sells various items.

Nabintou, the woman standing on the left in the picture, plans to use her loan to buy cereals, soaps, pagnes (highly colourful and decorative West African clothing), shoes and beauty products from the wholesalers in Bamako. She makes her sales at the market and door-to-door for cash or credit to a varied retail clientèle. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 40 000 francs which she will reinvest in her business and use to repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy cereals, soaps, pagnes (highly colourful and decorative West African clothing), shoes and beauty products.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and the children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Evangeline dreams of being a successful businesswoman, and hopes to give her family a good future.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani is 38; she lives with her three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her son has been selling fruit for many years; he sells seasonal fresh fruit in his hometown. He is a hawker, and uses a four-wheel manual cart for selling. Due to the freshness of the fruit, he has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. Due to his reputation, the demand for fruit has increased and at noon he is out of stock. 

Rani is taking loan for her son so he would be able to buy fruit in larger quantities and sizes.
 
Rani wants to save the excess profit for future sudden needs, to repay the loan amount, and for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy fresh and seasonal fruit for her son to sell.

loans.name: La Paix Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    LA PAIX est constitué de  6 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 26 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles nucléaires dans le quartier  HEREMAKONO NORD de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 1er prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers à l’image de  MINETOU qui est la 1ère femme debout  dans la photo de droite vers la gauche. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt,  des articles divers couvre lit, couvertures, draps de lit et tapis, avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The La Paix group is made up of 6 married women who have an average age of 26 and, on average, 3 children. They live in nuclear families in the district of Heremakono Nord in Bougouni town. They got to know each other via neighbourly relationships, friendships and business. They joined the Soro Yiriwaso MFI in order to strengthen their financial capacity so that they can better do business and are on their first loan. This group of women sells various items.

Minetou, the woman standing on the far right of the picture, plans to use her loan to buy bed covers, blankets, sheets and rugs from the wholesalers in Bougouni. She makes her sales at the market and door-to-door for cash or credit to a varied retail clientèle. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 40 000 francs which she will reinvest in her business and use to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy bed covers, blankets, sheets and rugs.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita previously accessed a 12,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase an additional stock of various spices, which she will sell in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for her to buy an additional stock of various spices, which she will sell in her business. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Elenita dreams of being more successful in business, and hopes that her family will always be in good health. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week to share stories of her work. This is where she grows in her relationship with God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for an additional stock of various spices, which she will sell in her business.

loans.name: Luis Angel

texts.es:
Luis tiene 24 años de edad estado civil Unión Libre vive con la esposa  y con su hijo de 3 años. Vive en el  Cantón Mocache provincia de los Ríos.

Pertenece a la ventanilla LOS LUCHADORES se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto La Guayas, pertenece al cantón Mocache esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Luis se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace algunos años, también se dedica a la cría de animales. Compra sus productos en Ventanas en el Dr. Agro y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes y alquiler del terreno. El préstamo le ayudado para cambiar el estilo de vida de la familia. Su sueño es tener un terrero para construir una casa. Los desafíos que enfrenta es las plagas de los sembríos.
En los tiempos libres le gusta jugar indor.
texts.en:
Luis is 24 years old and lives with his common-law wife and their 3-year-old son. Luis lives in the Mocache canton of the Los Ríos province.

Luis is part of the "Los Luchadores" communal bank, located in the La Guayas area. La Guayas is part of the Mocache canton. The members of the communal bank here make a living in farming work, and in raising livestock.

Luis works in farming: he has been growing corn and rice for some years now. He also raises animals. Luis buys his supplies in the "Dr Agro" shop in Ventanas. He sells his own products at the market here too.

Luis is applying for a loan in order to buy manure, urea and liquid fertiliser, and to rent land. This loan will help Luis to change his family life style. Luis's dream is to have a plot of land on which to build his house.

The challenge that Luis is facing is diseases in his seedlings.

In his free time Luis likes to play indoor football.

loans.use: to buy manure in order to sow rice and corn.

loans.name: Wilmer Antonio

texts.es:
Wilmer, es una persona de 30 años de edad, es soltero, vive en casa de sus padres, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos y a la ganadería, son actividades que aprendió de su padre, las cuales disfruta mucho al realizarlas, esta es la forma que tiene de generar ingresos necesarios para apoyar a sus padres con los gastos familiares.
Invertirá en el pago de la recolección de la cosecha y comprara una vaca, con esta acción fortalecerá de gran manera su negocio y continuara trabajando para salir adelante.
Sus aspiraciones son aumentar el área de cultivo y aumentar su ganado.
texts.en:
Wilmer is 30 years old, single and lives in his parents' house. He works growing basic grains and raising cattle, having learned these trades from his father. Wilmer really enjoys this work and it is how he earns the necessary income to support his parents with household costs.

Wilmer will invest this loan in paying to bring in the harvest and to buy a cow. This will strengthen his business greatly and Wilmer will continue to work in order to get ahead. 

Wilmer aspires to increase the amount of land on which he grows crops, and to increase the number of cattle that he has.

loans.use: to pay to bring in the harvest and to buy a cow.

loans.name: María Estela

texts.es:
María de 29 años de edad,  estudio hasta séptimo  grado. Es  madre soltera, ya que el esposo la abandono con sus dos niñas que actualmente están en la escuela.

María realiza los oficios domésticos en su casa  y a la venta de frutas y verduras en la comunidad esto lo hace desde ya hace ya 6  años empezó vendiendo en la escuela;  pero luego vio que era mejor  la venta de verduras casa por casa y fue así que ella decidió seguir ya que eso le generaba más ingresos.  Ella también se dedica a la agricultura le ayuda al papá a sembrar los cultivos.  La venta de verduras lo hace  a pie recorriendo unos 3 kilómetros, por todo el cantón  esto lo hace por las mañana de 6 a 12 del mediodía. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar verduras como tomate, papas, chile, zanahoria y también comprara naranjas,  pepinos.  Esto con el fin de invertirle más al negocio y así con los ingresos que tenga terminar de repellar el piso de la casa,  esto le ayudara tanto para más ingresos y el bienestar de la familia teniendo el piso de cemento para la casa.
  
Los sueños de María,  es poder sacar a sus hijas adelante ya que desde pequeña las ha mantenido sola y seguirá luchando por sacarlas adelante y poder terminar la casa para que las hijas vivan bien.
texts.en:
María is 29 years old and completed up to seventh grade at school. María is a single mother as her husband left her alone with two daughters, both of whom are now attending school.

María looks after the home and also sells fruits and vegetables in the community. She has been doing this work for six years now. She started by selling at the local school but then realised that it was better to sell door-to-door. She decided to continue like this as it brought in a higher income. María also does farming work: she grows potatoes. She sells her vegetables on foot, walking three kilometres to get round the whole canton. She works all morning, from 6am until 12 noon.

This loan from "Credicampo" will be used to buy vegetables such as tomatoes, potatoes, chillis, carrots, cucumbers, and also oranges. She is taking out this loan in order to invest more in her business and then, with her income, she can finish the floor in her home. This loan will help María to have a higher income and will improve her family's well-being, with a cement floor in the house.

María's dreams are to help her children to prosper. María has supported them alone she they were very young and María will continue to fight to help them to get ahead and to finish the house so that they can have better lives.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as tomatoes, potatoes, chillis, carrots, cucumbers, and also oranges.

loans.name: Hilario Roberto

texts.es:
Hilario tiene 37 años de edad estado civil unión libre,  vive con su esposa y sus 5 hijos en el  Cantón Mocache provincia de los Ríos.

Pertenece a la ventanilla LOS LUCHADORES se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto La Guayas, pertenece al cantón 
Mocache esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Hilario se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Ventanas en Agroquímicos Briones y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado a fomentar la economía. Su sueño es comprarse un terreno.
Le gusta viajar con su familia.
texts.en:
Hilario is 27 years old and lives with his partner and their five children. Hilario lives in the Mocache canton of the Los Ríos province.

Luis is part of the "Los Luchadores" communal bank, located in the La Guayas area. La Guayas is part of the Mocache canton. The members of the  communal bank here make a living in farming work, and in raising livestock.

Hilario works in farming. He grows corn and rice. He buys his supplies in Ventanas, in a shop called "Agroquímicos Briones", and sells his own products at the market in Ventanas.

Hilario is applying for a loan in order to buy manure, urea and liquid fertilisers in order to sow corn and rice. This loan will help him to support the household economy.

Hilario's dream to buy a plot of land.

Hilario likes to travel with his family.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Laidou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    LAIDOU est constitué de  4 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 26 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles nucléaires dans le quartier  HEREMAKONO NORD de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 8ème prêt. Les  prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  fruits et légumes à l’image de KADIA qui est la femme assise  dans la photo. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 70 régimes de bananes plantain avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Laidou group is made up of 4 married women with an average age of 26 and, on average, 3 children. They live in nuclear families in the district of Heremakono Nord in Bougouni town. They got to know each other via neighbourly relationships, friendships and business. They joined the Soro Yiriwaso MFI in order to strengthen their financial capacity so that they can better do business and are on their 8th loan. The previous loans have been properly repaid.

Kadia, the woman who is sitting in the picture, sells fruit and vegetables. She plans to use her loan to buy 70 bunches of plantains from the wholesalers in Bougouni. She makes her sales at the market and door-to-door for cash or credit to a varied retail clientèle. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 25 000 francs which she will reinvest in her business and use to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Tukolerewamu Group

texts.en:
Juliet is 36, and is a member of the Tukorelewamu Group. She is married, with three children who are school going.
 
Juliet has a beauty salon business in Nateete; in addition she works with a veterinarian. She started the saloon five years to generate more income to supplement her salary. 

She approached UGAFODE for a second loan of UGX.1,000,000 to improve her saloon to a standard that would attract more and better customers.

Juliet is hardworking, and manages to supervise her saloon alongside her job with a veterinarian. 

She thanks Ugafode for empowering women to stand on their own, and the Kiva lenders for being supportive.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is from the village of Antonino in the town of Alicia. She is 34-years-old, married and blessed with three children. Marites wants to improve her family's standard of living through the vending of shoes, clothes and sandals in the public market. She has been in this business for more than ten years now. She usually gains a net income of PHP 4,000 a week but still aspires for continuous flow in her business. It's for this reason Marites is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy more shoes, clothes and sandals to sell.

She believes that through her requested loan, she will improve her business further.

loans.use: to buy more shoes, clothes and sandals to sell.

loans.name: Al-Hanan Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Hanan, and is comprised of four women who live in Hodeidah, Yemen. The head of the group is 55-year-old Aisha, who has a cafeteria in a deaf-and-mute school. She sells sandwiches, sweets and soft drinks. 

She applied for a second loan in the amount of YER 60,000 to buy products such as sandwiches, sweets and soft drinks. 

She will use this loan to expand her business, and in this way will increase her working capital and improve her business. 

With this loan, she hopes to attract more clients to increase her profit. She thanks Kiva lenders for funding her first loan.

loans.use: to buy products such as sandwiches, sweets and soft drinks.

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en:
Anwar is a 36-year-old married woman, living with her children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  Anwar belongs to an ultra poor family and has been feeding her three children. There is only one earning person who has been contributing to the household expenses. 

Anwar has been saving for many days to buy a new auto rickshaw for her husband, but most of the savings are spent on household expenses. 

Now she wants to buy a new auto rickshaw for her husband, but she does not have enough cash in hand to buy new it. 

Therefore, Anwar requested a loan so her husband can buy a new rickshaw with the contribution of savings.  

She hopes that her husband will drive the auto rickshaw with his full devotion and earn sufficient income.

loans.use: To buy new auto rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
This is Rosemarie, 44, a resident of Batasan Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Renato, a cook, and they have children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. She works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.
 
Rosemarie operates the buy and sell business of her family. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers, and sells them with for a little profit. Her products are men and women’s clothes and other similar products. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offered. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 900 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 25,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy RTW products and merchandise items like polo shirts for men and women, socks, slippers and shirts to expand her product inventory.

Rosemarie dreams of being more successful in business and hopes to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for ready-to-wear (RTW) products and merchandise items like polo shirts for men and women, socks, slippers and shirts to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en:
Sadia is a 30-year-old married woman, living with her husband and two children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband drives a van in Lahore city. He provides transportation to passengers from one stop to another. Due to continuous use, most of the parts of the van are worn out and urgently need to be replaced with new ones.

Therefore, Sadia requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which is a field partner of Kiva. Sadia hopes that through this amount her husband will be able to buy the spare parts so he can drive the van again. 

Sadia belongs to a poor family. Her husband is the sole wage earner and does not have any other sources of income. She seems very happy. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of a van.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a responsible mother.She lives with her family within the village of Calaocan. She and her husband have been blessed with three children.

Emily involved herself in the retailing business, particularly running a home-based store. She has been in this kind of business for almost three years. 

Right now, Emily wants to improve her business but she lacks the necessary capital. For this reason, she is asking a loan in the amount of PHP 20,000 to buy more snack foods, biscuits, and soft drinks to sell. Emily hopes that she can obtain her desired loan to further improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more snack foods, biscuits, and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Thouk

texts.en:
Thouk is 59 years old and a resident of Prey Chhor district in Kampong Cham province. She is married and has six children, only two of whom are currently her burden, while the others are married and live independently. Thouk is engaged in the arming business, which is the main source of income for her family. Having support from her husband and children, Thouk is able to earn a decent income to provide enough food for her family.
 
Thouk has applied for a loan of $1,000  to drill a well and install a hand-pump well on the top of the drilled well. She is hoping that she won’t face water shortage in the future or she doesn't need to spend much time to collect water from far-distant areas, so that she can pay more attention to her business and earn more income to support her family. She is very thankful to all lenders in advance.

loans.use: to drill a well and install a hand pump well on the top of the drilled well.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en: Thelma is 42 years old, married and has engaged herself in selling snacks within her village for almost two years. She earns a net income of PHP 200 daily and uses that to cover their household expenses. With her aim to have a better way of living and a profitable business, she is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase glutinuous rice, sugar, coconut milk, peanut and cheese to make native cake “bibingka” as a snack. She is hoping that her loan request will be granted so that she can produce more native cakes made of glutinous rice to be able to earn a higher income every day.

loans.use: to purchase glutinous rice, sugar, coconut milk, peanut and cheese for her food vending business

loans.name: Kubra's Group

texts.en:
Kubra is a 32-year old lady, her residence is in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  She is the mother of a baby; her husband owns a furniture shop in which he makes wooden furniture such as chairs, table, Almira and beds.  His practice to buy planks and timber from the market; he cuts the raw wooden into multiple sizes for making furniture. 

His wood cutting machine has become out of order due to continuous usage for a long time.  The demand for manufacturing suddenly increased and her husband has spent all the money to buy raw material.  Now he does not have enough cash on hand to fix the wood cutting machine.  Therefore, Kubra has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so her husband would be able to buy a wood cutting machine.  Kubra is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan for this honorable support.

loans.use: To buy wood cutting machine for making furniture.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is a 31 year old woman.  She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan.  She is a responsible mother of 4 daughters and a son.  Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession.  He has been running an auto rickshaw for the last year. For the past many days his rickshaw is not working properly, because of which he is unable to generate any amount of income. 

He wants to repair it as soon as possible.  However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw.  Therefore Nazia has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw.  This will help him to continue his business.  Nazia is so thankful to Kiva and its field partner Brac Pakistan.

loans.use: Maintenance of a rickshaw.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 36-year-old woman; she lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of six children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. 

He has wanted to replace his old rickshaw's body for a long time. He is unable to attract passengers due to the ugly looking vehicle, and to generate any amount of income. He wants to buy a new rickshaw body as soon as possible. However, due to a lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of the new rickshaw’s body. 

Therefore, Shamim has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of the rickshaw body. 

This will help him to continue his business. She is very thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a new rickshaw body.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en:
Firuza was born in 1973. She has been busy selling dried fruits more than five years. She sells dried fruits such as kuraga, nuts, etc. She buys in bulk and sells to local people. She brings up three children. Her elder daughter Parvina helps her with managing the business. Her husband is a migrant in Russia. 

Firuza always tries for the well being of her children and their education. Her son, Ahmad, is a student in the second year; he studies in Malaysia. 

Firuza must to pay the tuition of her son, but doesn't have the money. 

She is asking for a loan of 2,700 USD to pay for the tuition of her son. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay for tuition for her son in Malaysia

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is from the village of Linglingay Alicia.  She is 54 years old and happily married.  The couple has been blessed with three children.  She has owned and operated a variety store for almost four years.  Now, she wants to improve her business, but due to insufficient capital she decided to borrow a loan of PHP 10,000.  She will invest this amount of loan in buying snack foods, beverages, noodles and condiments to sell.  Everything that Evelyn makes from the growth of her business is used to further attain her goals in life.

loans.use: to buy snack foods, beverages, noodles and condiments to sell

loans.name: Menchie

texts.en:
Menchie previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed for her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and the children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Menchie hopes that her business will last a long time, and dreams that her children will finish their studies.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Raheela

texts.en:
Raheela is a 40-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of three daughters and a son. Her husband is residing in another country and working there. He is responsible for feeding the entire family. Rahila is also engaged in the business of clothes selling and contributes her income to manage her household with her husband. 

Raheela has to purchase different kinds of clothes for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient financial resources she is not in the position to purchase these inventories of clothes. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will help her to purchase these clothes for reselling purposes and enable her to earn a favorable income. She plans to increase her savings with the income derived from her business so that she can provide financial assistance to her family.

Raheela is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different types of clothes for reselling purpose.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad is a 55-year-old lady, living with her spouse and six children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her son had been driving an auto rickshaw in the Lahore city for many years, but now his rickshaw’s body and engine have become fully damaged. He has fixed the engine but needs additional money to maintain the rickshaw’s body. Her son is unable to earn even a single penny for his family without using the rickshaw. 

Therefore, Irshad requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan; through the addition of this amount her son can easily buy a new rickshaw body. 

Her son and Irshad thank Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of their rickshaw.

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr:
Mamadou est gérant d’un fast-food qui se trouve à quelques mètres du guichet sis au croisement. C’est en 2010 qu’il a ouvert et a pris sa femme pour travailler avec elle (c’est elle qui prépare les mets proposés). Ils ont 2 enfants de 1 et 3ans. Le fast-food fonctionne de 10h du matin à 23h et peut même aller au-delà de cette heure compte tenue de la clientèle. Mamadou vient pour la 1ère fois solliciter un crédit afin de pouvoir acheter les condiments nécessaires (viande, oignons, épices…) pour la préparation des mets (fataya, sandwich, riz et accompagnements…).
Avec les recettes, Mamadou est capable de gérer la dépense quotidienne de sa famille et de payer le loyer où il mène son activité.
Puisqu’il se situe à un lieu focal, il a besoin d’innover son activité pour attirer plus de clientèle et pour cela ; il aura besoin de l’appui financier d’un bailleur.
texts.en:
Mamadou is the manager of a fast-food restaurant located a few meters from the branch office at the crossing. He opened it in 2010 and has his wife to work there with him. (She is the one who makes the dishes offered.) They have two children, who are 1 and 3 years old. The restaurant operates from 10 AM to 11 PM or even later if there are customers. 

Mamadou is here for the first time to request a loan to be able to purchase the necessary condiments (meat, onions, spices,…) for making 'fataya', sandwiches, and rice dishes.

With the income, he is able to manage his family's day-to-day expenses and to pay the rent for his business location. Since he is located at a central location, he needs to be innovative in order to attract more customers. To do so, he will need financial support from a lender.

loans.use: to purchase condiments (onions, meat, spices,...) for making the dishes on the menu in his restaurant.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 32 years old and lives in Manga, Tangub City, Mis.Occ. She is married with three children. 

Jenelyn has a sari-sari store, or general store. She has had this business for 1 year. She requested a loan to add capital so she can buy kilos of rice and sugar, gallons of oil and cases of soft drinks for her sari-sari store.

Jenelyn has been a member of PMPC for 5 months. In the future, Jenelyn hopes to provide a comfortable life for her family.

loans.use: to buy kilos of rice and sugar, gallons of oil and cases of soft drinks for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Gora

texts.fr:
Monsieur Gora, exerce le métier de peintre auto depuis plus de 15 ans. Il a d’abord suivi une formation jusqu’à obtention de son diplôme en 1993. Il s’est ensuite perfectionné dans l’atelier de son patron pendant un certain temps avant d’ouvrir son propre atelier en 1996. Gora est très assidu au travail, il commence sa journée à 7h 30mn du matin pour descendre à 20h. Il vient solliciter un crédit afin de pouvoir acheter un compresseur dont il a besoin pour son travail.
Gora est marié et père de 2 enfants, un garçon et une fille âgés respectivement de 2 et 4 ans. Il vit en famille avec son père et ses frères et participe à la dépense quotidienne de toute la famille.
Il faut aussi noter que grâce aux crédits, il peut augmenter son matériel et a pu acquérir un terrain avec les bénéfices.
Gora a comme ambition, de terminer la construction de sa maison, d’ouvrir un autre atelier et d’amener ses parents à faire le pèlerinage à la Mecque.
texts.en:
Mr. Gora is a tradesman who has been painting automobiles for fifteen years. First, he got training to obtain his certificate in 1993. Then he perfected his trade for a while in his employer's workshop before opening his own shop in 1996. Gora is very assiduous in his work. His day starts at 7:30 AM and ends at 8 PM. He is here to request a loan to purchase a compressor he needs for his work.   

Gora is a married father of two children, a boy and a girl, who are 2 and 4 years old, respectively. He lives all together with his father and brothers, and he helps cover the day-to-day expenses of the entire family. It must also be noted that, thanks to loans, he is able to add to his supplies and equipment and to acquire a plot of land with is profits. 

Gora's ambitions include finishing the construction of his house, opening another workshop, and taking his parents to make the pilgrimage to Mecca.

loans.use: to purchase a compressor for his work painting automobiles.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a married man with 2 children who describes himself as passionate. He operates a barber shop where he shaves men's hair. 

Julius has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a good area for the business, and his primary customers are men and young children. He says his biggest business challenge is the lack of funds to expand. He will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy hair cutting machines, and his business goal is to expand within the next 5 years. 

This is his third loan with SMEP DTM, and his previous loan of KES 50,000 was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to pay family expenses.

loans.use: to buy hair cutting machines

loans.name: Bitractor2 Group

texts.en:
Deborah, a member of Bitractor group, is 35 and a single mother with three children, ages 4, 8 and 16, who all go to school. She rents a shop in Kampala town where she deals in the sale of traditional wear for women known as gomesi.

She started this business after her husband abandoned her and he did not want to cater for the family. As a mother she would not sit back and look at her children’s future getting wasted without education and all basic needs. She therefore saved some money from the sale of charcoal and this enabled her to engage in the sale of traditional clothes in town. This has enabled her to meet her family needs.

Deborah has dreams of expanding her business and educating her children up to higher levels of learning such that they have a bright future.
