Deborah faces challenges of providing the best basic needs for her children as a single parent. Lack of enough capital has led to the sluggish growth of her business. She therefore needs a loan to boost her business.

Deborah’s neighbors and workmates described her as a courageous, hardworking and co-operative lady in society. She is grateful to the group members for standing by each other.

loans.use: To buy traditional attire clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase tools and materials to construct a well.

loans.name: Ibodat

texts.en:
Ibodat is hardworking woman who was born in 1952. She is a widow. Ibodat has four children. 

She began her own business with growing vegetables 14 years ago because she needed money. Ibodat little by little developed her business. She grows vegetables, makes different kinds of salads and sells to local people. She has her own selling place in a local market. Ibodat’s son and daughter-in-law help her with managing the business. 

Ibodat works hard but her income from business is not enough for improving living conditions. She is going to organize an additional business with animal husbandry. She is asking for a loan of 2,400 USD to buy cattle for organizing a new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle for organizing a new business.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan, es acompañado, vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos, sus actividades económicas son la venta de bicicletas usadas lo cual realiza desde hace 2 años, desde hace 5 años vende ladrillos y hace 7 años vende pescado, son oficios que desempeña por su propia cuenta y los aprendió por necesidad de tener ingresos para salir adelante junto a su familia.
Invertirá la compra de leña, variedad de pescado y repuestos para bicicletas. La leña le servirá para la producción de ladrillo y también tendrá los repuestos necesarios para las bicicletas. Espera aumentar las ventas y calidad de sus productos ya que así sus ventas le dejaran más ingresos.
Juan persigue el sueño de construir su vivienda de ladrillos, también mejorar el estilo de vida que ofrece a su familia y cancelar sus deudas.
texts.en:
Juan lives with his life partner and their three children. His business is selling used bicycles. He has done this work for 2 years. For the past 5 years, he has also sold bricks. He has also sold fish for 7 years. These are the trades he does on his own which he learned because he needed income for his family to get by.

He will invest in buying firewood, a variety of fish, and spare bicycle parts. The wood will be used in the production of brick. He will also have the parts necessary for bicycle repairs. He expects his sales to increase and also expects the quality of his product will improve leading to more sales revenue.

Juan pursues the dream of building a brick house, to improve the lifestyle that he offers his family, and to pay his debts.

loans.use: to purchase firewood to make brick, to buy fish to sell, and to buy bicycle parts for repairs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fridges, television sets, and bedroom suites for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
This is Fe, 43, a resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Salvador, an employee, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while they both work hard to provide for their family.

Fe operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5-pesos worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 600 PHP (Philippines pesos) in sales every day.

She is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Fe hopes to be successful in business and dreams to see her family happy and content. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Phalla is 52 years old. She lives together with her husband and some children in the district of Ba Phnum district, where the majority of the population dedicates themselves to farming. Like other farmers, Phalla pays her full attention to growing and harvesting a rice crop to sell once a year. Phalla, with the help of her husband, is able to earn approximately USD 6.00 per day. She has been working as a rice grower for nearly 30 years. 

Besides the hardships she faces in the business and living, Phalla also wants to focus on improving sanitation practices for her entire household. That’s why she has applied for a loan in the amount of USD 600 to build a hygienic latrine for the sake of her family members. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Phalla is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine for the sake of her family members.

loans.name: Komuljon

texts.en:
Komuljon was born in 1952. He is a hardworking man from a rural area. He is married and has two sons. Komuljon has a lot of experience growing crops and vegetables. He grows mainly wheat and potatoes. 

Komuljon works from early morning till late evening because his farming business is their only source of income. He wants to sow new crops, but he has no money to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. He is asking for a loan of 6000 Somoni to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. This loan will help him sow his crops and get a good harvest. He thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Dúo Mujeres Maravillosas Group

texts.es:
DUO MUJERES MARAVILLOSAS
La señora Vidalia de 62 años; cuenta con su negocio de tortillería la cual tiene ubicada en la colonia donde vive, todos los días le vende a sus clientes, después de vender tortillas en su negocio se dedica al cuidado de sus animales porque tiene su crianza de cerditos; de esa manera ella obtiene sus ingresos para salir adelante juntamente con su esposo que la ayuda a cuidar sus animales, lo que pretenden es seguir trabajando los dos y no ser carga para sus hijos que los apoyan en sus que haceres diarios y mientras Dios les dé vida y salud se sienten capaces de seguir trabajando, comentan que quieren tener algunos ahorros para las necesidades que se les puedan presentar en el futuro,doña Vidalia esta solicitando este credito para la compra de maiz por mayo para seguir elaborando tortillas para la venta.
texts.en:
Mujeres Maravillosas Partnership:

Vidalia is 62 years old.  She has a business making and selling tortillas located in the town that she lives in.  She sells to her customers everyday, and after selling tortillas, she dedicates her time to taking care of her animals, as she raises pigs.  This allows her to earn an income so that she and her husband, who helps her care for the animals, can get ahead together.  They hope to continue working together, not be a burden for their children who help them with their daily work, and as long as God gives them life and health, be able to continue to work.  She comments that they want to have some savings for necessities that may arise in the future.  

Vidalia is seeking  this loan to purchase corn in bulk so that she can continue making and selling tortillas.

loans.use: purchase corn to make and sell tortillas.

loans.name: Dorington

texts.en:
Dorington is a 30-year-old, married man. He has two children. He describes himself as being ambitious and energetic. 

Dorington operates a retail shop where he sells bags. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in an area with a ready market and his primary customers are regular customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be theft. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stocks of bags. His business goal is to be a leading supplier within five years. He hopes that, in the future, he will meet his personal and business goals. He will use the anticipated profits to open a boutique.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of bags to sell.

loans.name: Humberto Gregorio

texts.es:
Humberto tiene 32 años de edad estado civil Unión libre vive con la esposa  y con sus dos hijo de 3 y 2 años en el  Cantón Mocache provincia de los Ríos.
Pertenece a la ventanilla LOS LUCHADORES se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto La Guayas, pertenece al cantón Mocache esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Humberto  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para su familia y para invertir. Su sueño es comprarse un terreno para aumentar la siembra.
Le gusta trabajar y jugar indor.
texts.en:
Humberto is 32 years old.  He is in a common-law marriage and lives with his wife and their two children, who are 3 and 2 years old, in the Mocache canton in the province of Los Ríos.  He is a member of the Los Luchadores communal bank, which is located in the La Guayas precinct of the Mocache canton.  This communal bank is made up of agriculture and livestock workers.  

Humberto works in agriculture, growing corn and rice.  He purchases his products in Ventanas, and sells his produce in the same market.  He is seeking this loan to purchase manure, urea, and liquid fertilizers to plant corn and rice.  The loan will help him to increase his earnings for his family, and to invest.  His dream is to purchase a plot of land to expand his crops.  He enjoys working and playing indoor soccer.

loans.use: purchase manure for planting rice.

loans.name: Alejandro Alberto

texts.es:
Alejandro tiene 56 años de edad estado civil Unión Libre vive con su esposa e hija en el  Cantón Mocache provincia de los Ríos.

Pertenece a la ventanilla LOS LUCHADORES se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto La Guayas, pertenece al cantón Mocache esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Alejandro se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos y mejorar el estilo de vida de la familia. Su sueño es seguir en la agricultura y cumplir con los proyectos que se propone.
Le gusta hacer deporte, y mirar la televisión.
texts.en:
Alejandro is 56 years old.  He is in a common-law marriage, and lives with his wife and daughter in the Mocache canton, in the Los Ríos province.  He is a member of the Los Luchadores communal bank, which is located in the La Guayas precinct, in the Mocache canton.  The group's members are agriculture and livestock workers.  Alejandro works in agriculture, growing corn and rice.  He purchases his products in Ventanas, and sells his harvest in the same market.  

The requested loan will be used to purchase manure and fertilizers to grow corn and rice.  The loan will help him to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.  His dream is to continue in agriculture, and complete the projects that he has proposed.  He enjoys playing sports and watching television.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers and other agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Luz Mila Esperanza

texts.es:
Luz, vive en casa de su familia, es acompañada, desde muy joven aprendió a trabajar en tiendas, ya con mucha experiencia  hace 7 años posee un chalet donde ofrece variedad de productos comestibles, también vende pupusas y otros productos que sus clientes solicitan.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar golosinas, bebidas, embutidos, aceite, pan, quesillo, etc., le ayudara a incrementar sus productos y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes ya que su negocio está ubicado frente a una escuela.
Su sueño es tener una tienda completa donde también ofrezca artículos para el hogar para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Luz is married, and lives in her family's home.  From a very young age, she learned to work in stores.  Now, with a lot of experience, she has owned a cafe for the past seven years.  There, she offers a variety of foods, and also sells Pupusas and other products that her customers request.

The loan will be used to purchase snacks, drinks, deli meats, oil, bread, cheese, and other items.  It will help her to increase her product offerings, and meet the needs of her customers, given that her business is located in front of a school.  Her dream is to have a full store where they also offer household goods, so she can generate better earnings.

loans.use: purchase snacks, drinks, deli meats, oil, bread, cheese, etc...

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
María, está solicitando capital para surtir su tienda con más mercadería, en está ocasión comprara jugos, dulces, pan, granos básicos, azúcar, sal, jabón, legía.
Los cambios que ha tenido en su economía son muy pasivos pues con el crédito aumento la variedad de productos que tenía en su tienda, a crecido su cartera de clientes y a cancelado sus deudas.
texts.en:
María is seeking capital to stock her store with more merchandise.  In this occasion, she will purchase juices, candy, bread, basic grains, sugar, salt, soap, and bleach.  

The changes that she has had in her finances have been very passive.  The loan allowed her to increase the variety of products in her store, her customer base has expanded, and she has cancelled her debts.

loans.use: purchase juices, candy, bread, basic grains, sugar, salt, soap, and bleach.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
María, está necesitando más capital para efectuar la compra de ropa usada para dama, caballero y niños con lo que renovara los estilos colores y tallas de su inventario, para contar con la satisfacción de sus clientes.
En el crédito anterior le ayudo a mejorar la variedad  de prendas, con lo que sus clientes compraron más productos y tuvo una mejor rentabilidad con lo que se le facilita apoyar a su hijo en los estudios y a su esposo en los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en:
María needs more capital to buy used clothes for women, men and children. She will renew her inventory with new styles, colors and sizes in order to satisfy her customers.

The previous loan helped her to have assorted clothes. Her customers bought more products and her profits improved, which helped her to pay for her son’s studies and help her husband with the home expenses.

loans.use: to buy used clothes for women, men and children.

loans.name: Nasridin

texts.ru: Насридин 36 летный женатый мужчина из района Кубадиён. Он любит свою семью и старается обеспечить семью во всем. Насридин занимается продажей миндаля. Дополнительно в теплое время года он выращивает сельскохозяйственные культуры. Насридин активный и многофункциональный мужчина. Он начинает новую деятельность. Он собирается начать бизнес в сфере животноводства. Он будет выращивать скотов. Для данного бизнеса у него имеется все условия, в том числе коровник, корм, два телята и опыт. Насридин надеется с Вашей помощью купить еще пару телят. Поддержите Насридина.
texts.en: Nasridin is a 36-year-old married man from the Qubadiyon region. He loves his family and tries to take care of them in all ways. He earns a living selling almonds and, in the warmer part of the year, by growing crops. Nasridin is an energetic man with many skills. He is preparing to add a new business to his roster of activities, in animal husbandry. He plans to raise cattle. He has everything necessary for such a business: a cow shed, feed, two calves and the right experience. He is hoping for your help to buy two more calves. Please support Nasridin.

loans.use: to buy calves and start an animal husbandry business

loans.name: Carlos Eduardo

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 21 años de edad estado civil soltero  vive con sus padres en el  Cantón Mocache provincia de los Ríos.

Pertenece a la ventanilla LOS LUCHADORES se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto La Guayas, pertenece al cantón Mocache esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Carlos  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace algunos años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar y en Cantón.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para fomentar la economía de la familia. Su sueño es estudiar y graduarse de ingeniero para mejorar sus cultivos.
Le gusta hacer deporte y estudiar.
texts.en:
Carlos is 21 years old, single and lives with his parents in the Mocache canton, De los Ríos province. He is a member of the communal bank “Los Luchadores” [The Fighters], in Recinto La Guayas, Mocache canton. The members of this communal bank work in agriculture.

Carlos works in agriculture; he has been growing corn and rice for some years now. He buys the supplies in Ventanas and sells them at the local marketplace and in Cantón.

Carlos is requesting a loan to buy compost and fertilizers to grow corn and rice. The loan has helped him to support the family’s economy. His dream is to study and become an engineer, so that he can improve his plantations. He likes to play sports and to study.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to grow corn and rice.

loans.name: Jumakan

texts.ru: Жумакан 67 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитали 5 детей. Все дети женаты, проживают отдельно вместе со своими семьями, самый младший сын проживает с родителями и помогает по хозяйству. У Жумакан - среднее образование, после окончания школы она проработала в колхозе дояркой на протяжении 27 лет. На данный момент она пенсионерка, но не сидит сложа руки и в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Жумакан занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 22 года назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Жумакан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 3 лошади, 20 овец, также имеет земельный надел мерою 0,96 ГА, где в основном выращивают фасоль и многолетнюю траву для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,500 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жумакан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Жумакан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку земельного участка для строительства дома для среднего сына.
texts.en: Jumakan is 67 and married with five children. All of her children are married and live on their own with their families, except for her youngest son, who still lives with his parents and helps around the house. Jumakan has a high school education and spent 27 years working on a collective farm after finishing school. She is currently retired, but doesn't sit around doing nothing - she works in agriculture and animal husbandry as the primary source of income for her family, a business she began 22 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 5,000 KGS. Thanks to her hard work, she now has one milking cow, three horses and 20 sheep as well as 0.96 hectares of land on which she mainly grows beans and hay, with a monthly income of 10,500 KGS. With the goal of further developing her business, Jumakan has turned to bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan to purchase sheep to increase her head count of livestock. She plans to invest profits from the loan into further augmentation of the size of her herd, and to save toward buying property for her middle son to build a house on.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is a 31-year-old married man with 2 children who are 3 and 10 years old. 

He describes himself as ambitious. He operates a retail business to sell shoes. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a vibrant area and his primary customers are students. He describes his biggest business challenge as a lack of funds to increase his stock. 

He will use the 40,000 KES loan to increase his stock of shoes. His business goal is to open a boutique within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will buy a piece of land. This is his fifth loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy shoes to increase his stock.
